Writer and illustrator Laurent de Brunhoff, who continued his father’s legacy by producing dozens of original books for his “Babar the Elephant” series, has died aged 98.
Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
label: Y

text: De Brunhoff died at his home in Key West, Florida on Friday following a recent stroke, his wife, the critic and author Phyllis Rose, told CNN via email.

label: Y

text: A citizen of both France and the US, de Brunhoff published more than 40 books featuring Babar, an impeccably well-dressed elephant dreamed up by his mother, Cécile, and brought to life by his illustrator father, Jean, in the 1930s.
Article Title: Laurent de Brunhoff, ‘Babar the Elephant’ author, dies aged 98
label: Y

And he just discovered himself, I think.”

text:
In the 1980s, Chilean author Ariel Dorfman argued that Babar’s story — including his adoption of human clothes and mannerisms, and the subsequent depictions of him bringing the benefits of human civilization back to the jungle — represented the “fulfillment of the dominant countries’ colonial dream.”

“Babar slips progress into the jungle without upsetting the ecological balance, because (Jean) de Brunhoff omits all the plundering, racism, underdevelopment and misery from his story of the relationship between the two worlds,” Dorfman wrote in his 1983 book, “The Empire’s Old Clothes: What the Lone Ranger, Babar, and Other Innocent Heroes Do to Our Minds.”

Paris CNN —

The army of waiters who are the lifeblood of the French capital’s many cafés often get a bad rap, accused of everything from being unable to crack a smile to being downright rude and impatient to their customers.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: But the “garçons de café” of Paris are undoubtedly professionals.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: They can remember the orders of eight people without taking notes.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: They can carry all the dishes and drinks in one go.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: And they can manage a busy lunch rush without breaking a sweat – and still find time for a quick cigarette break.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Those professional skills (minus the smoking) were on display in full force on Sunday when Paris staged the Course des Cafés, marking the revival of a once-annual event that challenges waiters to race a two-kilometer route (1.2 miles) while carrying a tray laden with a cup of coffee, a glass of water and a croissant.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Two hundred of the crème de la crème of the city’s cafes, classically attired in black pants or skirt, apron and a white top, took to the streets and alleys of central Paris to compete in the event and entertain the crowds.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: To win the race, participants not only needed to be quick but also careful.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Any change to the composition of their tray would impact their final score.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Absolutely no spillage was permitted.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: And, as the Paris city government jokingly pointed out, no eating either!
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: The strict requirements meant the event was less of a run and more of a speed walk.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: “I tried holding the tray, it’s pretty heavy!”
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Water spilled, cups fell.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: There were gasps, cheers and laughter from the thousands of Parisians who decided to fight the early spring chill to watch the return of this quintessential French event, which was canceled 12 years ago due to budget constraints.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

text: Waiters start the Course des Cafes race on March 24, 2024.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

‘Excellence of French service’
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

text: It’s been revived to promote sport and “the excellence of French service” as the country gets ready to host the 2024 Summer Olympic and Paralympic Games, the Paris city government said in a statement earlier this year.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Several city officials also participated in the race, including the mayor of central Paris, Ariel Weil and the two deputy mayors of Paris in charge of Olympic affairs and business, Pierre Rabadan and Nicolas Bonnet Oulaldj.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text:
The “Course des Garçons de Café” (cafe waiters race) was first launched in 1914 to highlight the cafés and restaurants of the French capital, according to French historian Laurent Bihl.

Throughout the years, it found popularity not only in Paris but across France in cities such as Nice, Belfort and Calais.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Across the English Channel, many towns in the UK have also adopted this race but added a little bit of local flavor – the coffee and croissant have been switched out for a pint of beer.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Variations have also been staged in cities as far away as Hong Kong and Yokohama.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: Back on the streets of Paris, the quickest entrants completed Sunday’s Course des Cafés race – the name of the revived version has been shortened, dropping the ‘garçons’ – in less than 14 minutes.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: In the end, Pauline Van Wymeersch from the Café le Petit Pont and Samy Lamrous from La Contrescarpe were crowned the fastest woman and man.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital
label: Y

text: They both won tickets to the Olympic opening ceremony this summer – and perhaps some newfound respect from those customers cursing about the time it takes to order up a coffee, croissant and a glass of water.
Article Title: Paris waiters compete in race to get a coffee and croissant across the capital

Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun said Monday he intends to leave the beleaguered company by the end of the year in a major shakeup of the company’s leadership.

Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: The board has elected former Qualcomm CEO Steve Mollenkopf to succeed him.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: The company also announced that Stan Deal, CEO of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, is retiring.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: Stephanie Pope, Boeing’s chief operating officer since January, is taking his place effective immediately.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Boeing has been buffeted by more than five years of problems with its airplanes, including two fatal crashes of the 737 Max in 2018 and 2019 that killed 346 people, and most recently a door plug that blew out of the side of an Alaska Airlines 737 Max in January, leaving a gaping hole in the side of the plane.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: The problems have led to multiple groundings for safety issues and more than $31 billion in cumulative losses.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: In a letter to Boeing employees Monday, Calhoun called the Alaska Airlines incident “a watershed moment for Boeing.”
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: “The eyes of the world are on us,” he said in announcing his departure plans.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: “We are going to fix what isn’t working, and we are going to get our company back on the track towards recovery and stability.”
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: The decision to leave was “100%” his choice, Calhoun said in an interview on CNBC Monday morning.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: But Calhoun has become the focus of many who are critical of the way Boeing has been run in recent decades and the string of safety and quality issues.

text:
Airlines’ problems with Boeing

The airlines are upset both by the quality of the planes they are getting from Boeing, and the fact that Boeing won’t be able to deliver the planes they were counting on this year, as passenger demand continues to surge to record levels.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Michael O’Leary, CEO of Ryanair, Europe’s largest airline and one that flies only Boeing 737 planes, told CNN last week that whenever it takes deliveries of Boeing jets “we spend 48 hours going through the plane checking it for errors, omissions or anything else.”
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text:
And O’Leary said while it hasn’t found anything major in those checks, it regularly finds minor problems such as tools under floorboards and missing seat handles, that “shows, I think, a lack of attention to detail quality issues in Boeing.”

Monday Ryanair issued a statement saying, “We welcome these much-needed management changes in Seattle.”

United Airlines, which flies Boeing jets for more than 80% of its mainline fleet, has expressed disappointment in quality issues at Boeing and a delay in its scheduled deliveries.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: The airline is a primary customer for a stretched version of the Boeing 737 Max, known as the Max 10, but Boeing’s inability to get the plane certified to carry passengers is also causing headaches.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Scott Kirby, CEO of United, described the Alaska Air incident as the “straw that broke the camel’s back” for its plans to get the Max 10 this year, as planned, and it is now looking at possibly buying jets from Boeing rival Airbus to take the place of the Max 10s it has ordered.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: But it is difficult for airlines to shift to Airbus, which has a long backlog of jets it has already committed to build for its existing customer base.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: Any Boeing customer shifting to Airbus could find itself waiting until 2030 or beyond to get its planes delivered.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: And operating two types of aircraft of the same class is costly, since pilots are certified to fly specific aircraft, and most cannot shift back and forth between an Airbus and a Boeing without training.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: And the airline needs to keep a supply of expensive spare parts on hand for every type of aircraft it operates.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Alaska Air CEO Ben Minicucci estimated recently it cost his airline $75 million to $100 million a year to operate both Airbus and Boeing single-aisle jets after it merged with Virgin America, and which is why it got rid of its Airbus jets after the merger was complete.

text: And Alaska is a smaller national airline, only America’s fifth largest.

text: Larger airlines face even greater costs from splitting fleets between manufacturers.

text:
Facing numerous safety probes

The Boeing 737 Max 9 was grounded for three weeks after the Alaska Air incident as airlines completed inspections of their own planes’ door plugs.

text: Minicucci disclosed that many of his planes were discovered to have loose bolts, although he did not mention missing bolts.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: An audit of Boeing procedures by the Federal Aviation Administration in the wake of the Alaska Air incident found numerous “non-compliance issues.”
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: The agency gave the company 90 days to come up with a plan to fix its safety and quality issues.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: But the probes at Boeing aren’t limited to the FAA audit.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: A preliminary investigation of the Alaska Air incident found that the plane left the Boeing factory in October without the four bolts needed to keep the door plug in place.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: While the NTSB has not identified who is at fault for the missing bolts, NTSB Chair Jennifer Homendy criticized Boeing for not providing the agency with the documentation for who handled the installation of the door plug.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: Calhoun told investors in January after the incident that “we caused the problem, and we understand that.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Whatever conclusions are reached, Boeing is accountable for what happened.”
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: And Boeing is also facing an investigation by the Justice Department, which could open it up to criminal liability, and upend a controversial deferred prosecution agreement the company reached in January 2021 to settle charges it defrauded the FAA during the original certification process for the 737 Max last decade.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: It was days away from having that probation-like period end when the Alaska Air incident happened.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: The company has also had problems not related to the Max during Calhoun’s time in charge at Boeing, including a couple of halts in deliveries of the 787 Dreamliners, one of its main widebody jets, due to quality issues with that plane.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text:
Finance, not engineering background

Calhoun, 66, a longtime board member at Boeing, became chairman of the company in late 2019, when the board stripped his predecessor Dennis Muilenburg of that title.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: He was tapped as CEO after Muilenburg was ousted in December of that year, starting in the job in January 2020.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Boeing was once known as a company that put engineering excellence ahead of financial performance, and produced planes that were the gold standard in the industry.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Critics of the company say that focus has changed in the last 25 years, citing the 1997 merger with competitor McDonell Douglas for the shift in focus on saving money.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text: Calhoun is one of the executives since that time with no engineering background, having served as senior managing director and head of portfolio operations at investing firm The Blackstone Group, as well as CEO of Nielsen after 26 years at General Electric.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: Calhoun’s tenure began about halfway through a 20-month grounding of the 737 Max due to a design flaw that was determined to have caused the two crashes; and just before the Covid pandemic broke out globally, causing a near halt in air travel and massive losses for the airlines Boeing depends upon to buy its planes.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: Asked about what he would like to see in his successor, Calhoun told CNBC Monday that “I want somebody who knows how to handle a big, long, long-cycle business like ours.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: It’s not just the production of the airplane.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: It’s the development of the next airplane.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: N

text: It will be a $50 billion investment.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems
label: Y

text:
I would like somebody who clearly has the experience inside our industry.”

Shares of Boeing, which have lost more than 27% of their value since the start of the year, jumped 4% in premarket trading on the news.
Article Title: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down in wake of ongoing safety problems

text: CNN’s Allison Morrow contributed to this report.

New Delhi CNN —

A court in India’s most populous state has effectively banned Islamic schools by striking down a law governing madrasas, weeks before a nationwide election that could further polarize the world’s largest democracy along religious lines.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: The Allahabad High Court in Uttar Pradesh on Friday declared the Madrasa Act of 2004 to be unconstitutional, according to a court order seen by CNN, while ordering the state government to move students enrolled in the Islamic system into mainstream schools.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: “We hold that the Madarsa (sic) Act, 2004, is violative of the principle of Secularism, which is a part of the basic structure of the Constitution of India,” the high court said in its order.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: “Since providing education is one of the primary duties of the State, it is bound to remain secular while exercising its powers in the said field.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: It cannot provide for education of a particular religion, its instructions, prescriptions and philosophies or create separate education systems for separate religions.”
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: Madrasas provide a system of education in which students are taught about the Quran and Islamic history alongside general subjects like math and science.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: Some Hindus also send their children to an equivalent system known as Gurukuls, residential education institutions where students learn about ancient Vedic scriptures alongside general subjects under a “guru” or teacher.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: The ruling can be appealed in the country’s Supreme Court.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: Uttar Pradesh is home to some 200 million people, about 20% of whom are Muslim, according to the country’s most recent census data from 2011.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: It is governed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and has over the past decade made headlines for passing some of the country’s most controversial laws that critics say discriminate against Muslims and marginalize them in the secular republic.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: Friday’s court order affects 2.7 million students and 10,000 teachers in 25,000 madrasas, Reuters reported, citing Iftikhar Ahmed Javed, the head of the board of madrasa education in the state.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: It comes weeks before a nationwide election - the world’s largest - during which an estimated 960 million people are eligible to vote.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: Modi’s BJP is expected to secure another five years in power, ruling an India that has become increasingly polarized along religious lines.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: While the Allahabad High Court order cited India’s constitutional separation of religion and state in its reasoning for ruling against madrasas, it is Modi who has been frequently accused by critics of dismantling India’s secular traditions.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: At the start of the year, for example, Modi presided over a landmark inauguration ceremony of a controversial Hindu temple built on the ruins of a centuries-old mosque that was destroyed by right-wing groups in 1992.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text:
Video Ad Feedback See why this long-anticipated temple has divided India 02:31 - Source: CNN

The temple’s opening, which was broadcast live by the government and hailed as a new era, was the conclusion of a decades-long campaign by Modi and his BJP party to pull India away from the secular roots upon which the country was founded following independence.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: Many Muslims and critics of the BJP have raised concerns that India’s secular fabric is also being eroded as anti-Muslim hate speech make frequent headlines and Muslim-owned properties face demolitions.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: The BJP denies it discriminates against Muslims and says it treats all citizens equally.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: In December 2020, the northeastern state of Assam passed a law to convert all Islamic schools to regular education institutions.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state
label: Y

text: The state’s then Education Minister, Himanta Biswa Sarma, who is now Assam’s chief minister, said it would ensure “a right to equal education for all children and eases the path to higher education.”
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: Opposition politicians criticized the move, claiming it was reflective of hardening anti-Muslim attitudes in the Hindu-majority country.
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text: Senior state opposition leader Debabrata Saikia at the time said the law was passed by the BJP to “consolidate more Hindu votes.”
Article Title: Uttar Pradesh: Court ruling effectively outlaws Islamic schools in India’s most populous state

text:
CNN —

At least 27 people have been killed in southeast Brazil as rainfall continues to ravage parts of the country, according to CNN affiliate CNN Brasil citing state authorities.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: The death toll in the Brazilian state of Espirito Santo rose to 19, and at least eight people have been killed in neighboring state Rio de Janeiro, CNN Brasil reported citing each state’s respective Civil Defense.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides

text: At least six people are still missing, and more than 7,000 people were forced to flee their homes in Espirito Santo, according to CNN Brasil.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: Warnings for heavy rainfall are in place through Tuesday morning with lingering threats of scattered showers and storms over the region, according to the latest forecast predictions, where rainfall can potentially reach up to 50 millimeters (2 inches) per day through Tuesday.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: There are higher rainfall chances and new flood potential in central Brazil through midweek, with daily rainfall potentially reaching 100 mm (4 inches) in 24 hours.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: Construction worker Nicelio Goncalves, 52, shows the interior of his flooded house outside in Rio de Janeiro state on Sunday, March 24.

label: Y

text:
Pilar Olivares/Reuters

Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva shared his condolences to those affected in a post on X on Saturday, saying “the federal government sympathizes with the affected families and lives lost and is in constant contact with state and municipal governments to protect, prevent and repair flood damage.”

Rescue operations are underway in both states, and residents are being urged to exercise caution, Rio de Janeiro Governor Claudio Castro and Espirito Santo Governor Renato Casagrande posted on X late last week.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides

text: Flooding and landslides remain one of the main concerns as rainfall has yet to cease through the week.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: The climate crisis is helping to fuel more intense and more frequent rainfall events, and in Brazil this combines with rapid urbanization and often unsafe construction to deadly effect.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: More than 30 were killed after heavy rains last year in Rio Grande do Sul, while another 20 died in flooding in 2022 in Sao Paulo.
Article Title: Brazil flooding: At least 27 killed as relentless rain causes floods and landslides
label: Y

text: CNN Meteorologist Allison Chinchar contributed to this report

text: The Biden administration is preparing to publicly accuse several Chinese hackers of conducting sweeping hacks against US companies on behalf of China’s civilian intelligence service, three people familiar with the matter told CNN.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: The multi-agency crackdown is expected to include criminal charges, sanctions and a multimillion-dollar reward for information on the hackers, whom the US government alleges operate at the behest of China’s powerful Ministry of State Security spy agency, the sources said.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: An announcement identifying the hackers with names and photos is expected as soon as Monday, the sources said.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: The hackers have been using a Chinese technology company as a front to cover their hacking activity, one of the sources said.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign
label: Y

text: The British government is also preparing to accuse the hacking group of targeting UK organizations, the sources said.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign
label: Y

text: CNN has requested comment from the Chinese Embassy in Washington, DC.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign
label: Y

text: The Justice Department declined to comment for this story.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign
label: Y

text: The moves would come at a particularly delicate time in US-China cyber relations, weeks after FBI Director Christopher Wray issued a dire public warning that a different group of Chinese hackers was preparing “to wreak havoc and cause real-world harm to American citizens and communities, if or when China decides the time has come to strike.”
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: At a meeting in November, Chinese President Xi Jinping assured US President Joe Biden that China would not interfere in the 2024 US election — an assurance that US officials are not taking at face value, CNN previously reported.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: Beijing has vigorously denied the US allegations of hacking and in turn accused the US of conducting its own hacking operations against China.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: The US announcement expected this week will focus on alleged Chinese cyber-espionage instead of the possible disruptive cyberattacks highlighted by Wray, according to the sources briefed on the matter.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: The US is expected to identify several Chinese men as working for a Wuhan-based technology company that conducts hacking operations on behalf of the MSS, China’s civilian spy agency.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: The cybersecurity industry knows the hacking group as APT31 or Judgement Panda, and researchers have found the hackers targeting everything from US law firms to European industrial organizations to international apparel companies.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: Ahead of the 2020 US election, hackers associated with the group had unsuccessfully tried to break into email accounts of people affiliated with the Biden campaign, according to Microsoft.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: It was not immediately clear whether any of the men expected to be named this week were allegedly involved in that activity.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: The announcement this week wouldn’t be the first time that the Chinese government’s extensive cyber capabilities have been traced back to contractors working for front companies.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: A trove of documents leaked last month from another Chinese tech firm, I-Soon, showed victims of the firm’s hacking from Tibet to Hong Kong.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text: Clients listed in contracts with the firm included China’s police, intelligence service and military, according to the leaked data.
Article Title: Biden administration to accuse Chinese hackers of targeting US companies in espionage campaign

text:
CNN —

An undertaker turned academic, Alexandra Morton-Hayward became interested in brains — specifically how they decompose — during her former job.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: “I worked for years with the dead.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: My own experience is that the brain is pretty quick to liquefy (postmortem),” she said.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: “So it was a real shock when I came across a (scientific) paper referencing a 2,500-year-old brain.”
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: Now a forensic anthropologist studying for a doctorate at the University of Oxford, Morton-Hayward has discovered that brains, while not as commonly found intact as bones, do preserve surprisingly well in the archaeological record.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: To understand why, the anthropologist has compiled a unique archive of information about 4,405 brains unearthed by archaeologists.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: Brains have surfaced from northern European peat bogs, Andean mountaintops, shipwrecks, desert tombs and Victorian poorhouses.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: The earliest discovered were 12,000 years old.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

text: Morton-Hayward is primarily working toward understanding how these brains survive the ravages of time, with at least four preservation mechanisms at play.
Article Title: ‘Extraordinary’ archive of ancient brains could help shed light on mental illness

British actress Olivia Colman has hit out at the gender pay gap, declaring that she would be paid “a f**k of a lot more” if she were a man.
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: The star, who won an Oscar in 2019 for her leading role as Queen Anne in Yorgos Lanthimos’ “The Favourite,” made the claim in an interview with CNN’s Christiane Amanpour.
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: There to discuss her current film, “Wicked Little Letters,” together with the movie’s director, Thea Sharrock, Colman, 50, suggested there could be no justification for paying women less than men.
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: Olivia Colman hit out at the gender pay gap in an interview with CNN's Christiane Amanpour about her new movie, "Wicked Little Letters."
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text:
Don Arnold/WireImage/Getty Images

She was responding to a question that Amanpour posed to Sharrock, asking whether female actors are now considered “big box office draws.”
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text:
Sharrock said “I would say yes,” before Colman cut in to say: “Research suggests that they have always been big box office draws, but they have chosen to say…”

Colman, who played Queen Elizabeth II in seasons three and four of “The Crown,” then paused briefly, adding: “Don’t get me started on the pay disparity.”

Clearly passionate about the subject, she continued: “Male actors get paid more because they used to say they draw in the audiences, but actually that hasn’t been true for decades.
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: But they still like to use that as a reason to not pay women as much as their male counterparts.

text: Particularly in our industry.”
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text:
I mean you’re an Oscar-winning actress, Olivia?”

Without hesitation, Colman replied: “I’m very aware that if I was Oliver Colman I would be earning a f**k of a lot more than I am.”
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: Reacting with surprise, Amanpour asked: “Really?”
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: Colman replied: “Absolutely, yes.”
Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

text: She said she was “aware of one (example of) pay disparity that is a 12,000% difference,” though she didn’t name the individuals involved.

Article Title: Olivia Colman says if she were a man, she’d be earning ‘a f**k of a lot more’

London CNN —

The European Union has launched investigations into Apple, Google and Facebook parent Meta on suspicion that they are failing to comply with a new landmark European law designed to promote competition in digital services.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: The European Commission said it “suspects” that various practices by all three companies “fall short of effective compliance” with the Digital Markets Act (DMA), which went into effect earlier this month.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: If the probes find a “lack of full compliance,” they could face “heavy fines,” said European Commissioner Thierry Breton.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: The DMA requires dominant online platforms to give users more choices and rivals more opportunities to compete.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: It currently applies to the three tech giants under investigation, as well as Amazon (AMZN), Microsoft (MSFT) and ByteDance, the Chinese parent company of TikTok.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: By mid-May, the list could also include Elon Musk’s X and Booking.com, the EU has said.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Violations of the new law can lead to stiff penalties, including fines of up to 10% of a company’s global revenue and up to 20% for repeat offenses.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: For most of the regulated companies, that would translate to tens of billions of dollars.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: The practices the European Commission is investigating include what it calls Meta’s “pay or consent” approach.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Last October, Meta (META) launched a subscription service, called “Subscription for no ads,” allowing European users of Facebook and Instagram to pay up to €12.99 ($14) a month for ad-free versions.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: “The Commission is concerned that the binary choice imposed by Meta’s ‘pay or consent’ model may not provide a real alternative in case users do not consent, thereby not achieving the objective of preventing the accumulation of personal data by (large companies),” the body said in a statement.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: A Meta spokesperson responded: “Subscriptions as an alternative to advertising are a well-established business model across many industries, and we designed ‘Subscription for no ads’ to address several overlapping regulatory obligations, including the DMA.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: We will continue to engage constructively with the Commission.”
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: The EU is also looking into app stores operated by Apple (AAPL) and Google.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: The DMA states that large digital platforms — so-called gatekeepers — must allow app developers to “steer” consumers to offers outside the two dominant stores, free of charge.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Among other concerns, the EU suspects that Apple and Google’s parent Alphabet (GOOGL) constrain developers’ ability “to freely communicate (with end-users) and promote offers and directly conclude contracts, including by imposing various charges,” the Commission said.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: “We are concerned Alphabet, Apple & Meta & are not meeting their obligations, e.g.: Apple & Alphabet still charge recurring fees to app developers,” European Commissioner Margrethe Vestager wrote on X Monday.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Apple’s “choice screen” for Safari is also under scrutiny, the European Commission said.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Under the DMA, Apple must prompt users with “choice screens which must effectively and easily allow them to select an alternative default service, such as a browser or search engine on their iPhones,” it noted.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Apple told CNN in a statement: “We’re confident our plan complies with the DMA, and we’ll continue to constructively engage with the European Commission as they conduct their investigations.”
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: Another of the Commission’s concerns pertains to Google Search.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text:
Alphabet may not have done enough to ensure that third-party services appearing in search results are treated in “a fair and non-discriminatory manner” compared with Alphabet’s own services, such as Google Shopping and Google Flights.

Oliver Bethell, a competition executive at Google, said in a statement: “To comply with the Digital Markets Act, we have made significant changes to the way our services operate in Europe.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: “We have engaged with the European Commission, stakeholders and third parties in dozens of events over the past year to receive and respond to feedback, and to balance conflicting needs within the ecosystem.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: We will continue to defend our approach in the coming months.”
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text: This story has been updated with additional information.
Article Title: Digital Markets Act: Apple, Google and Meta at risk of ‘heavy’ fines as Europe launches new probes

text:
CNN —

A former official at soccer clubs in England and Wales has been accused by an anti-racism body of stereotyping Black players with “callous language.”

Stuart Webber, who left his role as sporting director of Norwich City last year, made the comments in reference to five Black players he had worked with – Jonny Rowe, Abu Kamara, Max Aarons, Jamal Lewis and Raheem Sterling – while speaking with The Pink Un, a regional newspaper in the city of Norwich.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: Webber’s comments came during an interview about his upcoming four-week expedition to climb Mount Everest for charity.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “We want to help the guys who really need it, not the ones who are maybe privileged,” he said, adding: “Where [the players] come from, it had to work out for them in football because the alternative is potentially jail or something else.”
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: The comments have been widely condemned, with sports anti-discrimination body Kick It Out describing them as “racial profiling” and “deeply offensive and concerning” on X, formerly known as Twitter.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “To read such callous language being used by someone who until recently was a senior executive at the top of the English game paints a very damning picture,” Kick It Out said.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “Resorting to lazy stereotyping is clearly upsetting for those who have been targeted, but also shows a complete lack of respect for their families, who have played a huge part in the journeys that the players have been on.”
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: CNN has attempted to contact Webber for comment.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: Raheem Sterling celebrates scoring for England against Iran at the 2022 FIFA World Cup.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text:
Julian Finney/Getty Images

Webber and his wife Zoe are co-founders of the Summit Foundation, which works with other charitable organizations to create programs to help young people.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: According to the foundation’s website, one of its aims is to help break the poverty cycle through education.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “We have to give the young people in this area something to strive for, to inspire them and, if we can, give them financial support,” he told The Pink Un.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “Post-Everest, we’ll continue the charity work.”
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: In a statement on X, Kamara – a striker who plays for League One team Portsmouth on loan from Norwich City – said that he and his family are “deeply saddened and shocked” by Webber’s remarks.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: He added: “I want to say to all the black and ethnic minority children, you don’t have to be a professional athlete to avoid living a life of crime and it is important that younger audiences are not left with this false narrative.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “I am proud of where I come from and acknowledge the sacrifices my family have made in order for me to have a career in football.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text:
These remarks are a sign that there is still a long way to go to be treated equally.”

Also writing on X, Aarons’ mother, Amber, said that there was “not a chance any of those boys … would have been in jail,” while Lewis’ mother, Catrina, said that Webber’s remarks were “very unprofessional.”
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: In a statement on Monday, Norwich said that Webber’s comments “do not in any way reflect the wider views of the football club,” adding: “Following publication of the interview, club representatives have focused on speaking directly with Abu Kamara and Jonathan Rowe to understand their concerns and offer support.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “The club are also in the process of reaching out to the other named players, whilst also engaging in dialogue with Kick It Out.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: “Norwich City is a home for everyone.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: We remain committed in our work across equality, diversity and inclusion to create an environment where all can feel welcome and valued.”
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

text: Prior to working at Norwich City – where his wife Zoe is an executive director – Webber held roles at Huddersfield Town, Wolverhampton Wanderers, Queens Park Rangers, Liverpool and Wrexham.
Article Title: Stuart Webber: Former soccer club official criticized for ‘lazy stereotyping’ of Black players

Italy’s one-euro-home sales have been attracting a lot of interest over the past few years, with dozens opting to snap up abandoned properties in some of the country’s depopulated towns.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: But while towns like Mussomeli in Sicily and Zungoli in Campania have managed to offload various abandoned dwellings to foreigners longing to live the Italian dream, some have struggled to sell their empty homes.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Among them is Patrica, a remote medieval village of barely 3,000 residents located south of Rome, where more than 40 properties deserted in the early 1900s have been left to rot.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Perched on a rocky plateau overlooking the Sacco valley in central Italy, Patrica is an idyllic spot, but life here wasn’t easy for locals in the past.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
Abandoned homes

Italian village Patrica, located south of Rome, is struggling to offload its abandoned homes.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
Comune di Patrica

Many left in search of a brighter future elsewhere, leaving their homes empty for decades.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: In an attempt to breathe new life into the dying village, the town’s mayor Lucio Fiordaliso has been trying to emulate the success of other Italian villages who’ve put their empty homes up for sale for one euro, or just over a dollar.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: He’s so far had little success.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “We first mapped all abandoned houses and made an official call out to the original owners to invite them to hand over their dilapidated family properties, but we managed to sell just two homes for one euro,” Fiordaliso tells CNN.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: While local authorities in towns left underpopulated due to earthquakes and other natural calamities have the jurisdiction to put abandoned homes up for sale without permission from the owners, this isn’t the case for Patrica and other towns like it.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “We first need the availability of owners, or their heirs, in disposing of their old houses,” says Fiordaliso.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “Only then can we place these properties up for sale with their consent, which makes the process very complicated.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Fiordaliso explains that the town received a “positive response” from 10 owners after sending out a “public call to involve them in our one-euro-homes project,” but they withdrew at the last minute.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: The rest never replied.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
Public call

Many of the town's local families left in search of a brighter future elsewhere, leaving their homes empty for decades.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
Comune di Patrica

Fiordaliso feels that those who changed their minds may have done so because of issues with other relatives who owned shares of the same property.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Abandoned buildings in old Italian towns are sometimes split between multiple heirs who own just a section – like a bathroom, balcony, kitchen - and nothing can be sold without written consent from all heirs, as per Italian law.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: In the past, it was customary for children to inherit parts of their family home, including patches of land, wells and orchards.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: But it’s not always a guarantee that relatives will still be on good terms and/or in contact years down the line.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “The disposal of potential one euro homes faced a deadlock as most relatives sharing the same property were at odds with one another for personal reasons or couldn’t agree on the sale, some hardly spoke or knew each other, others lived in distant cities and even abroad,” says the mayor.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: In some instances, homes were never officially split between heirs in the past, so the ownership line had broken along the way without a clear indication as to who should be the current owner.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: According to Fiordaliso, tracking down the descendants of owners who’d long migrated overseas, mainly to the US, Canada and Argentina and perhaps had different last names, or may have passed on their Italian property to foreigners without notifying Patrica’s town hall, has been a very hard task.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “It’s like looking for a needle in a haystack,” he adds.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: The only two abandoned homes that Patrica managed to sell as part of its one-euro scheme were fully owned by two locals, so no liaising with fourth-degree cousins or great-great-grandsons was required, and they could sell the properties without any complications.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
Family ties

The remote medieval village has a population of around 3,000.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: In situations where family feuds are at play, relatives could choose not to sell their share due to legal issues tied to inheritance disputes, or even as a form of revenge.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
And original owners who’ve been living elsewhere for many years may be wary of making themselves known to local authorities and potentially being hit with back taxes for their property and waste disposal charges of up to 2,500 euros (around $2,730 per year, plus unpaid utility bills

Another reason that the one euro scheme never really kicked off in Patrica could be due to the condition of its forsaken homes.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Some of the houses are simply too neglected to sell, even if the owners were willing to agree to it.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Patrica local Gianni Valleco and his two brothers decided to place their parents’ abandoned home on the market to see what would happen, but soon found that the house was far from desirable.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “We thought, ‘Why not give it a go’?
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Even if it’s just for one euro, we’d be rid of a heap of useless stones.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: We were curious to see if someone might be interested anyway in buying it,” says Valleco.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “We were aware that after half a century our parents’ home had turned into rubble, it was totally destroyed, like razed to the ground.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “The roof and most walls had collapsed, leaving an open-air room covered in grass and bushes.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: All there remained was a patch of land, an ugly garden right in the heart of the historical center.”
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: According to Valleco, a neighbor had been using what remained of the home to dump their old stuff.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “We then realized nobody would ever buy it,” he says.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “It’s a bad investment requiring lots of money to rebuild the house.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: It’s more worth buying a tiny rural cottage in the surroundings.”
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Thankfully, not all of the deserted homes in Patrica that could be potentially sold for one euro are in quite such a terrible state, and some have garnered interest from potential buyers.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “A few foreigners came to see the abandoned one-euro dwellings.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: There was lots of interest but unfortunately we had nothing to offer them,” says the mayor, adding that those interested were from the US and Europe.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: In the meantime, Fiordaliso has been coming up with new ways to boost the town’s appeal in the hope of luring newcomers.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text:
New scheme

The town hall recently funded the makeover of the external façades of some ancient palazzos, prompting several locals to entirely restyle their old family homes and put them to use after decades of neglect.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Local resident Alessandra Pagliarosi took things a step further by turning the 1950s mansion inherited by her husband into an elegant B&B called Patricia.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “We redid the roof, which was practically no longer there, and the interior.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: The mayor’s move finally gave us a good excuse to fully renovate the property which had been sitting there uselessly,” says Pagliarosi, who benefited from the new tax breaks introduced by the town hall to revive the local economy.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Those who decide to kickstart a commercial activity like an B&B or artisan boutique in the ancient district are exempt from paying taxes on waste disposal, advertisement and public space use for 10 years and granted tax credits for restructuring costs.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “For a small B&B, that would amount to a total of roughly 1,200 euros (around $1,310) per year in tax savings, which is a significant amount of money,” says Pagliarosi.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Foreigners planning to relocate to Patrica and launch a small business are also entitled to the tax benefits.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: So far, two new B&Bs and one restaurant have opened up as a result.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Local realtor Ilario Grossi, who runs Immobil Lepini estate agency, located in the nearby town of Ceccano, says several American descendants of emigrant families recently visited Patrica to look at properties.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: But the town’s ready-to-occupy homes, with two-bedroom properties starting at 20,000 euros ($21,832,) proved to be more appealing.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “There is interest, but then when many (foreigners) actually see the bad shape of the old homes they’d prefer to opt for turn-key apartments that are already restyled or in need of just minor fixes,” says Grossi.
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: “So it’s much more convenient to buy one of these newer ones than grab an old building in need of a major renovation, where the final cost would end up being much higher.”
Article Title: This Italian town is struggling to sell off its empty homes for one euro. Here’s why

text: Despite these challenges, Fiordaliso hasn’t given up on selling some of the town’s long neglected homes, even if it means having to negotiate between warring relatives.
