text:
CNN —

In a world now hyper connected by technology, transport links and our smartphone screens, there are few places that can truly be described as untouched.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: But for climber Alex Honnold, some such places, found in the harshest and most unforgiving of environments, still exist and are ripe for adventure.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Honnold had palms sweating and pulses racing when he climbed Yosemite’s 3,200 foot granite monolith El Capitan without any safety ropes – a mind-boggling achievement immortalized in the breathtaking BAFTA and Oscar winning National Geographic documentary “Free Solo.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Following the success of the film and his rise to stardom, Honnold set his sights on Ingmikortilaq, a formidable and unclimbed 3,750-foot rock wall jutting from Greenland’s frigid icy waters.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: The steep rock is more than double the height of the Empire state building.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “I’m never going to do another climbing project that goes to the Oscars, you know?
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: I can just set that expectation aside and I can focus on the projects that I’m excited about, that I’m inspired by,” he tells CNN Sport.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Climbers Alex Honnold, right, and Hazel Findlay assess the route ahead as they ascend Pool Wall, one of the stops before Ingmikortilaq, in Eastern Greenland.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text:
Pablo Durana/National Geographic

The 38-year-old athlete, alongside pro climbers Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer, ventured to the formidable seacliff, known locally as “the separate one,” in a six-week expedition that featured in National Geographic’s documentary “Arctic Ascent.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Honnold has done many first ascents all over the world, but says, that he’d “never done a first ascent of that magnitude, of a wall of that size.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Taking on one of the world’s biggest unscaled walls might be the stuff of dreams for any climber, but the conditions, less so: Honnold and his team were forced to battle unpredictable weather, snow storms, tumbling loose rock and delayed delivery of their climbing equipment.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: In spite of his reputation, Honnold is not entirely unflappable, describing sea cliff Ingmikortilaq as “pretty intimidating” and “daunting,” due to the swirling rock changing in rock type and quality.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “The first time we saw the wall from the boat, we all were pretty, you know, we’re like, ‘Oh, no, that’s a lot’,” he says.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Findlay, who took on the first ascent alongside Honnold, tells CNN even with careful planning and a TV crew, the team faced a surprising number of “unknowns,” not least the pressure and expectation they felt of working on the documentary.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: "Arctic Ascent With Alex Honnold."
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text:
Pablo Durana/National Geographic

“I think as a climber, you kind of get used to going into things with that level of unknown.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: I don’t know if you can really have an adventure without unknowns, that’s definitely just part of the experience,” Findlay explains.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “But when you’re making it for a TV show, there’s this added pressure: you really do kind of have to succeed or otherwise that money gets wasted and people’s jobs are on the line.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: After weeks of traveling to the cliff with a team including glaciologist Dr. Heïdi Sevestre, Greenlandic guide Adam Kjeldsen and adventurer Aldo Kane, the climbers set their sights on the formidable buttress.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Ingmikortilaq mountain stands at a staggering 3,750 ft.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text:
Matt Pycroft/National Geographic

“That wall was just really loose, it was just a lot harder to manage the risks, we felt like we could do everything possible to make it safe, and it still could be too dangerous,” Findlay adds.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Honnold explains he approached the six-week expedition and “almost overwhelming challenge” of the climb the same way he does all his projects: “breaking things down into things that are manageable.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: He adds: “I think a big part of doing things that other people find scary is broadening your comfort zone to the point that things that you used to think were scary are just no longer scary.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “That has meant consistently scaring myself in different ways, consistently doing things that are a small step beyond what I felt comfortable with before.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: He adds that 10 years ago, many aspects of the expedition would have been very scary for him.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “If you do something routinely for 20 years, it’s just not that scary.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: I think a lot of viewers see that and they’re like, ‘Oh, he lives a normal life like I do, and then every once in a while he does things like this’.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “No, no, this is what I do five days a week, all year round for the last 20 years,” he chuckles.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text:
Warnings from a warming planet

Before making it to Ingmikortilaq, the team collected data to help inform a “health check” of Eastern Greenland, which hadn’t been completed in some 20 years.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: The team studied glaciers, icebergs, fjord waters, and rock faces with the aim of increasing our knowledge of the impact climate change is having on this vital, fragile part of our planet, which will have ultimately have reverberations across the world.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: This included a climb up a 1,500-foot rock face, known as the Pool Wall, to take real-time depth and density measurements of a rarely studied section of Greenland’s ice cap.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text:
Pablo Durana/National Geographic

“Behind these really cool walls, we did some useful science.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: That is win, win, all the way across the world,” Honnold explains.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “So much of modern science just has to do with access: if you can get the right person to the right place, they can make meaningful contributions to science with relatively little effort,” he adds.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Sevestre tells CNN that the Arctic is currently warming three to four times faster than the rest of the world.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “By being able to better understand what’s happening to Greenland, this helps us to provide better data and better projections on how the rest of the world could be impacted by Arctic changes,” she explains.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: A recent study from the California Institute of Technology found that the Greenland ice sheet is losing an average of 30 million metric tons of ice an hour on average, as a result of human-caused global warming.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: The team walk up Edward Bailey Glacier.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text:
Matt Pycroft/National Geographic

Sevestre explains that “our present and our future is intimately connected to Greenland.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: The island holds enough ice to increase sea levels by six to seven meters, adding that cities like London, New York and Miami are on the “front line,” she adds.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “And at the moment, we have a choice: do we continue investing in fossil fuels as much as we are today?
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: If we want to give a chance to Greenland and give a chance to our own collective future, we really need to think long and hard about how much we want it.”
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “We’re just agreeing passively to invest more and more into fossil fuels.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: But we really need to understand how high the stakes really are.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: We could totally get a meter of sea level rise by 2070.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: “I mean, this is tomorrow for the younger generations,” she adds.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Call to Earth is a CNN editorial series committed to reporting on the environmental challenges facing our planet, together with the solutions.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

text: Rolex’s Perpetual Planet initiative has partnered with CNN to drive awareness and education around key sustainability issues and to inspire positive action.
Article Title: Alex Honnold, Hazel Findlay and Mikey Shaefer: How three cilmbers scaled one of the world’s largest unclimbed rock faces

CNN —

The Sagrada Familia in Barcelona will finally be finished in 2026, more than 140 years after construction started, officials have confirmed.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: The construction of the last of six towers will mark the completion of the structure of the basilica, the organization responsible for managing the site announced last week.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: “The Chapel of the Assumption is expected to be finished in 2025 and the tower of Jesus Christ, in 2026,” the Sagrada Familia said in a statement announcing the publication of its 2023 annual report.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text:
A scene of the interior of the Sagrada Familia during a mass to consecrate the cathedral in November 2010 Christophe Simon/AFP/Getty Images

The tower of Jesus Christ will stand at 172.5 meters (566 feet) tall, and will be finished with a 17-meter-tall (56-foot) four-armed cross, according to the cathedral.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: When complete, the Sagrada Familia will become the world’s tallest church, overtaking Ulm Minster in Germany.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: Construction began in 1882 according to a design spearheaded by celebrated Catalan architect Antoni Gaudí, who decided the monumental structure would have 18 huge, spindle-shaped towers, each symbolizing a different biblical figure—the 12 apostles, the four evangelists, the Virgin Mary and Jesus.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text:
The Sagrada Familia pictured in 1940 Hulton Archive/Getty Images

When Gaudí died in 1926, only an estimated 10%-15% of the project had been built, including one transept, a crypt and some of the apse wall.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: Construction, already slow, was interrupted in the late 1930s by the Spanish Civil War, when most of the designs and models of Gaudí— whose tomb lies beneath the cathedral—were destroyed.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: Current designs are based on surviving and reconstructed materials, as well as reimagined adaptations of the original.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: In 1984, the building was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site, and it was consecrated by Pope Benedict XVI for religious worship in 2010.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: The construction of the church was carried out illegally for 137 years, until 2019, when a building permit was finally issued by Barcelona’s city council.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

text: Authorities only discovered the “anomaly” that it had never been granted planning permission in 2016.
Article Title: Barcelona’s famous Sagrada Familia will finally be completed in 2026

The fate of the abortion pill lies with the Supreme Court.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: The high court, which has a conservative supermajority, holds the power to maintain full access to the drug or reverse regulation changes that made medication abortion more accessible in recent years.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: This includes allowing the pills to be prescribed via telemedicine, delivered in the mail and used up to 10 weeks of pregnancy instead of seven.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: In a lawsuit brought after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in 2022, a federal judge in Texas ruled to suspend the US Food and Drug Administration’s approval of mifepristone — one of two pills used in most medication abortions.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: The drug is still fully available while the Supreme Court deliberates.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: Medication abortion accounts for nearly two-thirds of all US abortions, according to 2023 data from the Guttmacher Institute.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: At least 5.9 million women have used mifepristone since its FDA approval in 2000.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: It is also often prescribed for miscarriage treatment.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text:
See a timeline of mifepristone access since it was approved in 2000:

Mifepristone’s safety is well-established.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: Data analyzed by CNN shows it is safer than some common, low-risk prescription drugs, such as penicillin and Viagra.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: It also comes with a lower risk of serious complications than the alternatives: procedural abortion and childbirth.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

text: Telehealth for medication abortion is also effective and safe, according to a recent study.
Article Title: Timeline of the Supreme Court’s mifepristone abortion pill ruling

Poland has demanded an explanation from Moscow after saying a Russian cruise missile aimed at Ukraine entered its territory.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text:
“On March 24 at 4:23 a.m., there was a violation of Polish airspace by one of the cruise missiles launched tonight by the long-range aviation of the Russian Federation,” the Operational Command of the Polish armed forces said on X.

“The object flew into Polish
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: [air]space near the village of Oserdow (Lublin Voivodeship) and spent 39 seconds in it,” Operational Command said.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: “It was observed by military radar systems throughout its flight.”
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: The report came after Ukrainian officials said Russia had launched about 20 missiles and seven Shahed attack drones targeting the western Ukrainian region of Lviv, which is near the Polish border.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: There were also multiple explosions reported in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: The head of the Lviv regional military administration, Maksym Kozytskyi, said that Russia hit Ukrainian critical infrastructure in the western Lviv region.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text:
“Preliminarily, there were two hits on the same critical infrastructure facility that the invaders had targeted overnight,” Kozytskyi said on Telegram.

Operational Command said on X that both Polish and allied aircraft had been activated.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: “All necessary procedures to ensure the security of Polish airspace have been activated,” the Command added.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: “The Polish Military is continuously monitoring the situation on Ukrainian territory and remains on constant alert to ensure the safety of Polish airspace,” it said.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: The last time Russia violated Poland’s airspace was on December 29, 2023.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: The Polish military said at the time “an unidentified airborne object” had entered its airspace from Ukrainian territory, and later Poland’s most senior military officer said “all indications” suggested it was a Russian missile.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: Poland’s Foreign Ministry spokesperson, Pawel Wronski, said in a statement on Sunday that the country called on Russia “to stop terrorist attacks from the air on the residents and territory of Ukraine, and to end the war and deal with the country’s internal problems.”
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: Meanwhile, Kyiv mayor Vitali Klitschko said on Telegram that a series of blasts had occurred in the Ukrainian capital, with missile fragments falling in the Desnianskyi district.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: “Explosions in the capital.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: Air defense is active.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: Do not leave your shelters,” Klitschko said.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: He added that fire and rescue units were heading to the scene.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

text: This is a developing story and will be updated.
Article Title: Poland demands explanation after accusing Russia of violating its airspace

At least 137 school children who were kidnapped by armed gunmen in Nigeria earlier this month have been released, the governor of Nigeria’s Kaduna state Uba Sani confirmed in a TV interview aired on Sunday.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: In the interview broadcast on Nigeria’s Channels Television, Sani said he had met with the children’s families.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: “I am happy, the families are happy, we are all happy the children have been rescued,” he told the broadcaster.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: However, Sani said that a teacher had died after developing “some complications” while in captivity, without providing further detail.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: On March 7, more than 300 students were abducted by armed bandits on motorcycles who stormed the LEA Primary and Secondary School in Kuriga village, in Kaduna’s Chikun district, state police told CNN at the time.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: Kaduna state, which borders the Nigerian capital Abuja to the southwest, has grappled with recurring incidents of kidnappings for ransom by bandits and has witnessed several mass abductions in recent years.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: In an earlier post on X, Sani was seen addressing dozens of children and wrote that he was “glad to see our released children in high spirits on Sunday evening.”
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: He wrote that they would continue to “undergo psychosocial counseling” and receive “proper medical supervision.”
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: The gunmen previously demanded a ransom of 1 billion naira ($620,000) and threatened to kill all of the students if their demands were not met, according to a member of the community.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: Nigeria’s National Security Adviser Nuhu Ribadu had coordinated the “operations of the security agencies, which eventually resulted in this successful outcome,” Sani said.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: “The Nigerian Army also deserves special commendation for showing that with courage, determination and commitment, criminal elements can be degraded and security restored in our communities,” Sani said.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: He also thanked Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu for “working round the clock” to ensure the children’s safe return.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text: With previous reporting from CNN’s Nimi Princewill in Abuja and Mariya Knight.
Article Title: Kaduna, Nigeria: 137 school children kidnapped by gunmen released, state governor says

text:
CNN —

South Korean soccer star Son Jun-ho, who was detained in China for allegedly accepting bribes, has recently returned home, the country’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement on Monday.
Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes

text: The ministry has been communicating with the Chinese authorities through “various channels” and requested cooperation to “ensure a swift and fair process,” it said without giving details of the release.
Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes

text:
Son was detained by public security authorities in China’s northeast Liaoning province last May “on suspicion of taking bribes as a person who is not a functionary of a state organ.”

Son is a midfielder for Shandong Taishan, a soccer club in the Chinese Super League (CSL) which won the 2021 league title and more recently the 2022 Chinese Football Association Cup.
Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes

text: He has also represented South Korea’s men’s national team and reached the knockout stages of the World Cup in 2022 with the squad.
Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes

text: Son became the first foreign soccer player to be investigated and detained since the CSL started in 2004, according to China’s state-run Global Times.
Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes

text: His arrest was part of a broader initiative by Beijing to rid Chinese soccer of alleged corruption in the highest levels of the sport, during which the Communist Party’s anti-graft watchdog has been investigating a host of Chinese Football Association figures.
Article Title: Son Jun-ho: South Korean soccer player returns home after being detained in China on suspicion of accepting bribes

text:
CNN —

A powerful storm is pummeling parts of the Plains with blizzard conditions as it drops a blanket of snow from Colorado to Minnesota through Tuesday, threatening widespread power outages and treacherous road conditions.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The wide-reaching storm will also fire up severe thunderstorms and tornadoes in classic springtime fashion.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The storm is the latest in a series that have blurred the transition from winter to spring.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Some cities, like Minneapolis St.-Paul, have received more snow in the past week than they had all winter.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: And parts of New England, where tens of thousands remain without power, endured a bigger snowstorm this weekend than any single storm this winter.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Snow clings to the trees along a walking path at Como Lake in St. Paul, Minnesota on March 22, 2024.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text:
Amy Forliti/AP

Blizzard warnings extend from northern Colorado and Kansas into parts of Minnesota, Nebraska and South Dakota on Monday.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Between 2 and 10 inches of snow could fall in these areas, and some places could see more than a foot, according to the National Weather Service.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Travel could become “nearly impossible” in some areas as the storms move through the Plains and Upper Midwest, creating icy roadways and whiteout conditions, the weather service warned.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Freezing rain and sleet created slick road conditions in parts of Nebraska Sunday night, the weather service office in North Platte said.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The conditions closed a more than 100-mile portion of I-80 in the state Sunday night.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The roadway remained closed Monday morning after the icy mix turned to blowing snow and created whiteout conditions.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Slick conditions also wreaked havoc in Minnesota where nearly 400 crashes and more than 300 spinouts have occurred since Sunday, according the Minnesota State Patrol.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Widespread power outages are also a concern as power lines and trees are likely to be damaged by strong winds and accumulations of heavy, wet snow, the weather service said.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Winter storm warnings stretch from New Mexico to Wisconsin and the Dakotas, where snowfall totals of 4 to 12 inches are possible.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Last week, a storm dumped snow from the northern Plains to the Northeast.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The heaviest snow focused on the Northeast where parts of Maine, New Hampshire and Vermont, saw more than 2 feet of snow.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Nearly 130,000 homes and businesses are still without power across the region as of Monday morning, according to PowerOutage.us.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The majority of outages are in Maine, where nearly 100,000 customers are in the dark.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Many power lines were grounded across Maine after the storm blew through, according to Central Maine Power.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The utility said its crews responded to more than 700 emergency calls Sunday for issues including blocked roads and downed lines.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Though the Maine utility had restored power to more than 50% of customers impacted by the storm as of Sunday night, restoration efforts in severely impacted coastal areas could last through Wednesday, it said.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text:
Strong tornadoes possible in Gulf Coast states

The southern side of the storm will produce damaging thunderstorms in the South Monday.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Warm, moist air from the Gulf of Mexico is providing plenty of fuel for thunderstorms to unload damaging wind gusts, hail and tornadoes.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: A few of these tornadoes could become strong – meaning EF2-strength or greater – the Storm Prediction Center warned Monday.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Thunderstorms were ongoing Monday morning from Texas to Arkansas but are forecast to intensify as the storm system tracks east.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: The greatest risk for severe thunderstorms and strong tornadoes will center on parts of Louisiana and Mississippi from Monday afternoon into Monday night.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Heavy rainfall could also lead to flooding in parts of the Mississippi Valley and Gulf Coast.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Portions of Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Arkansas and Missouri are under a Level 2 of 4 risk of flooding rainfall Monday.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Thunderstorms will track into the Southeast on Tuesday, but any damaging storms are expected to be isolated in nature.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: CNN’s Samantha Beech and Nic F. Anderson contributed to this report.
Article Title: Spring storm brings heavy snow to Plains and Midwest and threatens tornadoes in South

text: Check.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Poop bags?… Check.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Those hoping to climb Everest this year will have to make some slight adjustments to their packing list, as new rules now mandate that climbers bring their excrement down with them from the world’s highest peak, in a bid to tackle pollution.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Most people who attempt to climb the 8,849-meter (29,032-foot) Mount Everest do so via Nepal, paying $11,000 apiece just for the climbing permit.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text:
Mountaineers' tents at Camp 2 of Everest on May 8, 2021 Pemba Dorje Sherpa/AFP/Getty Images

With gear, food, supplemental oxygen, Sherpa guides and more, it costs upward of $35,000 to take on the mountain.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: But the world’s highest peak has a poop problem, driven by the number of visitors, and the harsh conditions on the mountain, which interfere with the degradation process.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: “The problem of human waste on Everest was very bad,” Diwas Pokhrel, first vice president of Everest Summiteers Association, told CNN, adding that at the mountain’s highest points, it was “polluting the mountain environment.”
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Without the new rules, the poo problem was highly likely to get worse: Last year, Nepal gave out a record 478 climbing permits to climb the peak.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Twelve climbers were confirmed to have died on the mountain, while another five remain officially missing.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Jinesh Sindurakar of the Nepal Mountaineering Association told CNN that an estimated 1,200 people will be on Everest this season.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: “Each person produces 250 grams (8.8 ounces) of excrement a day and they will spend 2 weeks on the higher camps for the summit push,” Sindurakar explained, adding that each climber will be given two poop bags, which can each be used six times.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: The bags contain chemicals to solidify the human waste and make it odorless, Sindurakar said, and Nepal’s Khumbu Pasanglhamu Rural Municipality will issue some 8,000 bags this season.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: Efforts to reduce the impact of tourism on the Himalayas have stepped up, with 35,708 kilograms of waste and plastics removed from peaks including Everest, Lhotse, Annapurna and Baruntse through an initiative led by the Nepali Army, according to the Himalayan Times.
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem

text: CNN’s Lilit Marcus contributed reporting
Article Title: Everest climbers will have to take their poop away with them, as Nepal tries to address growing waste problem
