text:
CNN —

A glowing worm moon will light up the sky on Monday with a celestial performance in store for people venturing out in the early morning hours — a penumbral lunar eclipse.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: March’s full moon, referred to as the worm moon by the Farmers’ Almanac due to its proximity to the spring equinox, will be at its fullest at 3 a.m. ET.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: A few hours earlier, starting at 12:53 a.m. ET, according to EarthSky, the moon will be almost perfectly aligned with the sun and Earth, causing the outer edge of Earth’s shadow, known as the penumbra, to be cast onto the glowing orb.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: The moon looks slightly darker during a 2023 penumbral lunar eclipse in Banda Aceh, Indonesia.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: On Monday, the lunar event will begin at 12:53 a.m. ET.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
Chaideer Mahyuddin/AFP/Getty Images

The greatest eclipse will be at 3:12 a.m. ET, when the moon will appear to be slightly darker than usual, said Dr. Shannon Schmoll, director of the Abrams Planetarium at Michigan State University.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: “It’ll be almost a gradient of darkening happening from one side of the moon to the other.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: It’s not going to be a super dramatic change in what we see in the moon,” Schmoll said.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: “But if you’re sitting there watching it, you might notice some slight variations in brightness.”
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: The worm moon — named by Native American tribes in reference to the beetle larvae and other creatures that emerge from hibernation in the spring — will be visible to everyone across the world, since the moon will appear to be full for a couple of days.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: However, the penumbral eclipse will only be visible to those who are on the night side of Earth when the event occurs, including Europe, North and East Asia, Australia, Africa, North America and South America.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: The lunar eclipse will finish at 5:33 a.m. ET, according to EarthSky.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: The penumbral eclipse comes about two weeks before a total solar eclipse that will cross Mexico, the United States and Canada on April 8.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: Lunar and solar eclipses always come in pairs due to the period when the sun, Earth and moon stay aligned, Schmoll said.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: While the full moon will be caught in Earth’s shadow during this penumbral eclipse, the moon’s next new moon phase will allow for the conditions needed for a solar eclipse, when the moon will be in between the sun and Earth and thus block the face of the sun from view.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
Eclipse season

An “eclipse season” is the approximate 35-day period that occurs every six months, near the equinoxes, when the near-perfect alignment of the three celestial bodies needed for eclipses occurs, according to NASA.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: A lunar eclipse does not happen monthly during each full moon because the moon’s orbital plane is tilted by about 5 degrees, so for most full moons, the shadow of the Earth will be just below or above the moon, Schmoll said.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: While a penumbral eclipse is not as dramatic as a total lunar eclipse with the moon appearing an eerie red, there is no special equipment required to view a lunar eclipse such as the viewing glasses needed for a solar eclipse, Schmoll said, allowing for lunar eclipses to be viewed with the naked eye.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: “You pretty much just need to be outside with a clear view of the moon when it’s happening,” Schmoll added.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: “(Eclipses are) always a good excuse to go outside and try to look at the sky and appreciate where we are in the universe, and what we are able to observe from our planet.”
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
Solar and lunar eclipses

While the most highly anticipated of the four eclipse events occurring in 2024 is the total solar eclipse on April 8, an annular solar eclipse will occur on October 2 over parts of South America.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: This type of eclipse is similar to a total solar eclipse, except the moon is at the farthest point in its orbit from Earth, so it can’t completely block the sun.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: Instead, annular solar eclipses create a “ring of fire” in the sky as the sun’s fiery light surrounds the moon’s shadow.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
Meanwhile, a partial lunar eclipse, in which Earth moves between the sun and the full moon without being perfectly aligned, will appear over Europe and much of Asia, Africa, North America and South America between September 17 and 18.

Check Time and Date’s website to see when each of these eclipses will appear.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
More full moons this year

Of the 12 full moons in 2024, the September and October lunar events will be considered supermoons, according to EarthSky.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: Definitions of a supermoon can vary, but the term generally denotes a full moon that is closer to Earth than normal and thus appears larger and brighter in the night sky.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: Some astronomers say the phenomenon occurs when the moon is within 90% of perigee — its closest approach to Earth in orbit.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
Here are the remaining full moons of 2024:

• April 23: Pink moon

• May 23: Flower moon

• June 21: Strawberry moon

• July 21: Buck moon

• August 19: Sturgeon moon

• September 17: Harvest moon

• October 17: Hunter’s moon

• November 15: Beaver moon

• December 15: Cold moon

Meteor showers of 2024

Skygazers can look forward to a multitude of meteor showers this year, according to the American Meteor Society.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text: Here are the dates when meteor events are expected to peak this year.
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
• Lyrids: April 21-22

• Eta Aquariids: May 4-5

• Southern delta
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
Aquariids: July 29-30

• Alpha Capricornids: July 30-31

• Perseids: August 11-12

• Draconids: October 7-8

• Orionids: October 20-21

• Southern Taurids: November 4-5

• Northern Taurids: November 11-12

• Leonids: November 17-18

• Geminids: December 13-14

• Ursids: December 21-22
Article Title: Lunar eclipse: Here’s how to see the upcoming worm moon

text:
CNN —

Rebel Wilson is claiming Sacha Baron Cohen has tried to stop the release of her upcoming memoir, “Rebel Rising.”

Wilson and Baron Cohen starred together “The Brothers Grimsby” in 2016.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: “I will not be bullied or silenced with high priced lawyer or PR crisis managers,” Wilson wrote on her Instagram stories on Monday.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: “The ‘a**hole’ that I am talking about in ONE CHAPTER of my book is Sacha Baron Cohen.”
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: Without naming Baron Cohen, Wilson had previously written on social media: “He’s trying to stop press coming out about my new book.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: But the book WILL come out and you will all know the truth.”
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: In her posts, Wilson did not specify what she wrote about Baron Cohen.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: However, a spokesperson for the comedian and actor told CNN Wilson’s claims are false.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: “While we appreciate the importance of speaking out, these demonstrably false claims are directly contradicted by extensive detailed evidence, including contemporaneous documents, film footage, and eyewitness accounts from those present before, during and after the production of The Brothers Grimsby,” the spokesperson said.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: “When I first came to Hollywood, people were like, yeah, ‘I have a no a**hole policy, means like,
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: I don’t work with a**holes.’
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: I mean, that sounds sensible or logical.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: But then it really sunk in because I worked with a massive a**hole and
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: yeah, now I definitely have a no a**holes policy,” Wilson said in a video shared on Instagram earlier this month.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: In a 2016 interview with UK Marie Claire, Wilson spoke about Baron Cohen wanting her to film a nude scene in “The Brothers Grimsby,” which she declined.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text: “You want to know that the people (behind the camera) have a certain sensibility and decency,” Wilson said at the time.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text:
“And a lot of times in comedy they’re not those people.”

“Rebel Rising” is due to release on April 2.
Article Title: Sacha Baron Cohen’s representative responds to Rebel Wilson claims

text:
New York CNN —

Bring up installing a bidet to the average American before the pandemic, and they might have likely flushed the idea straightaway.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: The bathroom washer business, once a foreign concept to many in the US, experienced a huge boom during the Covid-19 pandemic, when shoppers were battling over toilet paper shortages.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: But while some products or industries saw a boom during Covid that later came back down to earth –- say, masks, roller skates, pet adoptions, Zoom subscriptions, Peloton bikes -– bidets made a big splash and have managed to maintain sales growth.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Bidets and their product cousins – washlets, “bum guns” and other water-based alternatives to toilet paper – are universal in most parts of the world; bidet enthusiasts tout how the devices are more sustainable, clean, and less abrasive.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: But Americans just can’t seem to let go of the Charmin Bear.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: It took a toilet paper shortage for some to come around to the 18th-century invention.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: During the pandemic, every single bidet sold out at bidetking.com, and the business grew exponentially, bidetking.com founder James Lin said.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: The site faced a massive supply crunch, and it had to air freight costly containers to meet demands.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Lin described shipments of products from abroad by water completely selling out before they even hit the warehouse.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: By some estimates, the entire bidet market grew two to three times during 2020.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Tushy, which makes a trendy bidet seat attachment, pulled in a revenue of $40 million in 2020 versus $8 million in 2019, founder Miki Agrawal said to CNN.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Americans are still intrigued by the bidet.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Bidetking.com reports sales have grown a minimum of 20% each year since the pandemic, with 2023 closer to 30%.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text:
A bidet for every bum

A dizzying array of bidet options confront the burgeoning American consumer.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Big spenders can find luxury options to give their porcelain throne the royal treatment.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Japanese electronic bidet seat maker Toto sells a “washlet” for as much as $1,420 on bidetking.com, equipped with a water heating system (that heats the toilet seat and the jet streams of water that clean the user’s backside), a wireless remote control (with multiple spray settings) and a hands-free dryer.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Tushy, defined by its whimsical marketing, sells a popular bidet attachment starting at $99.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Few people buy a bidet every year, so much of the growth is coming from new customers.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Often, bidet sales spread just through word of mouth.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Once one person is converted to the new method of bathroom sanitation, they want their friends and family to join the club.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: And many of those customers often become entrenched rather than transient.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Some customers who start with more basic washer attachments are now upgrading to electronic models that have different temperature and pressure settings.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: The most popular type of bidet in the US, Lin said, is a non-electric attachment that only sprays cold water, found for less than $50 on sites like Amazon.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Others have found an even cheaper alternative.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Joe from Michigan, who did not want to be identified by his last name, says he grabbed a bidet attached to a toilet being discarded on the side of the street, and purchased an adapter hose to fit it into his home (after sanitizing it).
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: “Gosh, I wish I would have known about it sooner,” Joe told CNN.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text:
A foreign concept from the start

The idea to use flowing water – rather than harder objects, whether leaves or paper – to clean one’s underside may be as old as human existence.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: The bidet originated in France, used by aristocrats as a separate piece of furniture next to the chamber pot.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Variations of the bidet are ubiquitous in a large swath of Europe to the Middle East, East Asia and some South American countries.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: During the booming electronics era, the Japanese brand Toto revolutionized the washlet in 1980 with a toilet seat attachment that uses warm water to cleanse.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: The devices have proliferated to homes and businesses around Japan and beyond.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: A common reason why bidets aren’t used in the US is that during World War 2, American soldiers saw brothels utilizing bidets.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: When they came back to United States, they shunned the bidet because of the connotations.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Plus, the construction boom that took place in the post-war years built plumbing systems without bidets.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: (Japanese washlets and other devices, however, connect to existing toilets and don’t require separate plumbing like French-style bidets.)
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Bidet of Elisabeth of Bavaria (Carl Knoll Porcelain Factory, Carlsbad), 1887-1890.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Found in the collection of the Kammerhofmuseen der Stadt Gmunden.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text:
Fine Art Images/Heritage Images/Hulton Archive/Getty Images

The foreignness of bidets stuck.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Some of the new bidet users CNN interviewed said they had associated the object with places like Europe or Japan, or something found in fancy hotels.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: When Joe and his wife lived in Spain, he initially didn’t even know what the unattached bidet in their apartment bathroom was used for.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Agrawal, the Tushy founder, said she was drawn to the bidet business because it was a standard practice she grew up in with an Indian father and Japanese mother.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Of course, for many, water-based cleanliness has long been entrenched in their culture, going back centuries.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: For example, for practicing Muslims, the Islamic jurisprudence lays out strict guidelines on washing oneself.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Many Asian and Middle Eastern countries utilize “bum guns,” or low-cost handheld sprayers attached by a hose to the side of the toilet, or jugs that look like watering cans.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Eyad Atieh, a resident physician in Illinois, spent part of his childhood and adolesence in Jordan, where every house had a bidet installed.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: In his medical training, he learned the bidet’s health benefits, especially for those who suffer from hemorrhoids and hernias.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: “A big part of our culture is using water to clean, otherwise you can’t pray, you can’t be considered clean Islamically,” Atieh said.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text:
Big Toilet Paper

When the great toilet paper shortage hit in 2020, many Americans realized there could be another way to clean themselves.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Environmental concerns around trees, paper and waste perhaps also played a role.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Using toilet paper had seemed, somehow, American, with toilet paper jokes a staple in bathroom humor and “TP-ing” a stereotypical rite of passage for teens.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: And little is more American than the Charmin bear, an industry emblem that already dominates aisles of supermarkets.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: So, “getting consumers to do something different, they have to undo all those brand associations (with toilet paper) and all those habits they have,” Derek Rucker, a marketing professor at Kellogg School of Management told CNN.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Rucker said the bidet industry would need to become a social norm in the US, such as being built into more new home constructions.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Many bidet users in the US were converted after visiting societies where bidet use is widespread.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Mikaela Koelzer, in Chicago, visited Japan the summer before the pandemic and was awestruck by the variety of bidet settings in even the most hole-in-the-wall restaurants.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Then the pandemic hit, and Koelzer had “nothing but time” to find “pockets of joy” in her day.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: With the toilet paper mania, she decided to kill two birds with one stone and splurge on a Tushy.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: “It moreso was just about nurturing myself and feeling like I was doing something good for myself in a way that I could control, because everything else was just so out of control,” Koelzer said.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Though Koelzer has a basic Tushy, her parents are now looking into a more state-of-the-art one that has temperature controls, she says.
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Two of her friends are now “proud bidet owners.”
Article Title: Why are bidets just now getting popular in America?

text: Editor’s note: Dana Santas, known as the “Mobility Maker,” is a certified strength and conditioning specialist and mind-body coach in professional sports, and is the author of the book “Practical Solutions for Back Pain Relief.”
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
CNN —

Have your legs ever been so stiff and tired that simply bending down to tie your shoes felt like a Herculean task?
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Whether muscular discomfort comes from an intense workout or too much sitting, wanting to soothe sore muscles is a shared human experience.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: But because it’s an unrealistic luxury for most of us to receive daily massages or splurge on the latest high-tech massage gun, we need a more practical option.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Enter the foam roller: an affordable and accessible self-care solution that’s backed by science for its muscle-soothing benefits.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: With consistent use, this simple tool can be a game changer in how you feel and move.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: What is a foam roller?
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: A foam roller, as its name implies, is a cylindrical piece of dense foam.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Rollers come in a variety of sizes ranging from 1-4 feet (0.3-1.2 meters) in length and 5-10 inches (13-25 centimeters) in diameter.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: The handy cylinders also vary in degrees of firmness, surface textures and features designed to meet desired intensity levels and uses.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: The ubiquitous gym staple is available from most major department stores starting at prices as low as $5.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Larger sizes and more features (like bumps or points) drive up the price but generally aren’t necessary to reap the science-backed benefits.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
What does foam rolling do?

Considered a self-myofascial release tool, a foam roller can relieve soreness and inflammation, increase range of motion, alleviate muscular tension and release tight fascia — the thin layer of connective tissue under the skin surrounding muscles.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Research is increasingly shedding more light on the effectiveness of foam rolling to improve how you feel and move.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: A comprehensive analysis of 49 studies found that engaging in foam-rolling sessions of 90 seconds to two minutes had the capacity to reduce muscle stiffness and increase range of motion.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: One longer-term study revealed that foam rolling focused on the backs of the legs three times per week for four weeks improved hamstring flexibility.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: And a smaller-scale study found foam rolling during exercise warm-up sessions to be more effective than both static and dynamic stretching for improving flexibility without hampering strength.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: While more research is warranted, current science on foam rolling shows promising benefits.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Muscle soreness: Considerations and safety tips

While foam rolling offers numerous benefits, it’s important to proceed with caution.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Individuals who are pregnant or with conditions such as muscle tears, arthritis, osteoporosis, varicose veins, or any other existing injuries or conditions should seek guidance from their health care provider.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Always practice body awareness when foam rolling to differentiate between general muscle soreness you feel after a workout or prolonged sitting versus cautionary discomfort due to a strain or injury that could be unsafe to roll.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: If you’re unsure about the source of your muscle soreness or whether foam rolling is safe for you, talk to your physical therapist or doctor.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: When selecting a foam roller, keep in mind your pressure tolerance.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: A harder or bumpier roller will increase sensation.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Regardless of the type of roller, always avoid rolling directly over joints, bony areas (such as the neck or spine) or thin skin.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Foam rolling can be part of any workout routine.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
FreshSplash/E+/Getty Images

When, where and how to roll:

Incorporating foam rolling into your fitness routine or lifestyle can be simple with some practical guidance.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Include foam rolling as part of your warm-ups prior to any fitness activities to increase blood flow to your muscles and enhance flexibility.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: As a strength and mobility coach in professional sports, I recommend that all of my athletes prep for their workouts by foam rolling.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: If you have a tendency for chronic tension or experience soreness after intense activity or prolonged sitting, use your foam roller to address the areas of discomfort.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Personally, I keep a foam roller in my office and use it on my back, glutes and hamstrings after any long bouts of sitting at my desk.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Below I’ve outlined areas you can safely target with your foam roller.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Place the roller on the ground and use your body weight to apply rolling pressure (like flattening a piece of dough with a rolling pin).
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Choose areas that make the most sense for you based on what you’re feeling and any activities you plan to do right after rolling.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Roll each of your targeted areas for at least 90 seconds, starting with gentle pressure and gradually increasing intensity as you feel comfortable.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Consistency is key — aim for three or more foam-rolling sessions per week to realize lasting benefits.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Calves

With both hands on the floor behind you for support, rest your calves (back of lower legs) on the roller.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Cross your legs at the ankle.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Roll from just above your ankle to just below your knee.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Repeat on the other side.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Hamstrings

Rest your hamstrings (back of upper legs) on the roller with both hands on the floor behind you for support.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Bend one knee to place a foot on the roller.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Roll your hamstrings from the fold of your glute (bottom) to just above the back of your knees.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Repeat on the other side.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Glutes

Sitting on the roller, bend your leg to bring your foot to the opposite knee.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Place a hand on the floor for support.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Lean your weight into the bent-knee side and slowly roll the entire glute area (back and outside of your hip).
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Repeat on the other side.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
IT band/outside of leg

From a side forearm plank, rest your lower leg on top of the roller and place your top foot on the floor for support.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Roll from the outside of your hip to just above your knee.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: If the sensation is too intense, shift more weight into your supporting foot.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: To increase intensity, stack your legs.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Adductors/inside of leg

From a forearm plank position with your core engaged for support, slightly spread your legs and open one hip to align the roller on a slight diagonal along your adductors (inner thigh).
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Roll along the entire length of your adductors from the groins to just before the knee.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Quadriceps

Take a forearm plank position with your quadriceps (thighs) resting evenly on the roller.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Engage core muscles and walk your forearms forward and back for support as you roll from just below your hips to just above your knees.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
Back

Again, avoid rolling your cervical spine or neck area, and if you have any history of spinal injury or genetic spinal conditions, consult your doctor.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Upper/midback: Lie on the roller with it positioned across your upper back.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Keep both knees bent with your feet down and core engaged for support.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Maintain a neutral neck position with your hands placed gently behind your head.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Roll slowly from your upper back to the base of your ribcage.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: To increase intensity, cross your arms in front.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Lower back: From the same position, roll from just above your hips to just below your ribs.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Foam rolling is a simple yet powerful tool for soothing sore muscles, improving range of motion and enhancing recovery.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: By understanding its benefits, following practical guidance, and prioritizing safety, you can harness its full potential to help you feel and move better.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text: Our seven-part guide will help you ease into a healthy routine, backed by experts.
Article Title: Foam rollers: The must-have tool for soothing sore muscles

text:
CNN —

Technology has revolutionized how people book travel, buy groceries and manage their everyday finances.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Yet, the process of buying a home has withstood many similar changes.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Sites like Redfin and Zillow provide a way for buyers and brokers to connect online, but the role of real estate agents in closing purchases has persisted.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Now the seismic settlement between the National Association of Realtors and home sellers could change that, as home buyers and sellers face the prospect of paying their agents separately, instead of sellers paying a commission split between both sides.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: That, in turn, opens the door for new technology to reshape the agents’ role, as people in other jobs — from the world of finance to travel — have already experienced.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Given the settlement, Tomasz Piskorski, a professor of real estate at Columbia Business School, said buyers’ agents might see their work simplified through technology consumers can use themselves, similar to changes in money management.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “I think we are reaching a point where there’s going to be a lot of innovation in the housing market,” Piskorski said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text:
“One simple idea is: Do homeowners really need a real estate agent?”

Nearly half of home buyers began their search online, according to a 2023 report by the NAR, and many buyers do home research themselves.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “Ultimately, people will understand what real estate agents really do, especially on the buy side,” Piskorski said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text:
“The whole business model actually under which we operate right now makes these fees not very transparent to home buyers.”

Danielle Hale, chief economist at Realtor.com, told CNN in an email that technology could make things easier for buyers in an industry that has often been opaque.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “Ultimately, if these changes bring about greater consumer transparency, that’s a good thing,” Hale told CNN.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: But even with the possibility of major changes, Hale said, one thing will almost certainly remain the same for real estate agents.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Buyers, she noted, “will likely be reluctant to navigate the financial decision of a lifetime without their professional expertise and support.”
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text:
Finance, travel and other models

The NAR settlement essentially decouples the buyers’ and sellers’ agents.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: While previously home sellers have paid a commission (generally 5% to 6%) that was split between agents, the settlement makes it so home buyers might be on the hook for paying their agent up front.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Experts told CNN that could affect how home buyers think about enlisting an agent.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Currently, the framework of real estate solely emphasizes the buy and sell transaction, said John Bodrozic, co-founder of HomeZada, a real estate tech company.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Yet, as technology simplifies the process, agents will have to advertise their value as long-term consultants in a niche industry.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Bodrozic said tech will enable real estate to become more like personal finance in this sense.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “I really believe it’s a bigger picture here, which is the opportunity for the real estate industry to think of their clients as a never-ending client that I want to keep happy and provide value to throughout their entire journey,” he said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Bobby Juncosa, chief technology officer of Edgewise, a real estate tech company, said there are lessons from how travel agents changed as technology has allowed people to search for, compare and purchase flights on their own.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “The buyers’ agent will become, this is the part that’s a little bit more controversial, but a little bit more travel agent-esque, and they’re kind of pointing you in the right direction,” he said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “You know, ‘this neighborhood has good schools,’ all things that are public information that you could find out on your own, but you’re hoping for that local expertise.”
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: A lot of real estate transactions could be digitized, and this settlement may provide impetus for that, Piskorski said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text:
He said developments in tech that organize home inspections, make arrangements to hire lawyers or fulfill other duties of a buyers’ agent, would “significantly reduce the costs associated with home transactions.”

Even as technology expands further into the real estate industry, Piskorski said he thinks a fully automated process, such as an Amazon marketplace for buying and selling homes, is still far in the distance.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: The real estate market, he said, is “too complex to be completely automated on a computer.”
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Juncosa said as the industry adjusts to the settlement rules, agents will become more like consultants throughout the home buying process, offering value-add insight.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Yet what ultimately differentiates a travel agent from a real estate agent is the value and risk associated with the purchase.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Purchasing a home is a major life decision, and some people will always benefit from the assurance of a broker, Juncosa said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: A key point of home buying is the behavioral aspect, Piskorski said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: “Some households just want a human being to be with them, to assure them that this is the right decision,” he said.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text: Ultimately, Juncosa said that agents serve a fundamentally human purpose: reassuring homebuyers about the biggest financial decisions of their lives.
Article Title: Could real estate go the way of the travel industry? Not just yet

text:
CNN —

Investors have approved a deal on Friday to make Truth Social owner Trump Media a publicly traded company.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The green light from shareholders clears a major hurdle for a long-delayed merger that will generate a multi-billion dollar windfall for former President Donald Trump at a time when he’s facing immense financial and legal pressure.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: According to a preliminary vote total announced during the meeting, a majority of shareholders of Digital World Acquisition Corp. voted in favor of the deal to merge with Trump Media.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The companies have indicated the merger could close as soon as early next week.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The new company will be called Trump Media & Technology Group and trade under the ticker DJT, Trump’s initials.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: It will own Trump’s struggling social media platform Truth Social.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Shareholders voted to approve Trump Media’s merger with a blank-check company, following years of legal and regulatory obstacles.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Trump will own a dominant stake in a public company, with shares worth more than $3 billion at current market prices.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: However, experts tell CNN there are numerous practical, financial and legal reasons why this deal is unlikely to solve Trump’s imminent cash crunch.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “President Trump won’t be able to monetize that stake right away,” said Matthew Kennedy, senior initial public offering market strategist at Renaissance Capital.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Trump faces a Monday deadline to post a $464 million bond in New York’s civil fraud case against him or New York’s attorney general could try to seize his golf course and private estate north of Manhattan – or other assets.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text:
The good news for Trump is that there are strong incentives for shareholders to approve the merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp.

If it gets the green light from shareholders, Trump stands to be the dominant shareholder, with a stake of at least 58.1%, according to filings.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The merger agreement calls for Trump to own roughly 79 million shares of the new public company – and potentially tens of millions more if certain goals are hit.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: At Digital World’s share price of around $43 Thursday, that massive stake would be worth $3.4 billion – at least on paper.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: But Digital World shares were volatile Friday, and they were closed 14% lower.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The merger could close swiftly.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Regulatory filings indicate the companies expect to close the merger on the second business day after the shareholder vote is approved.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: That sets the stage for trading to begin under the new name and ticker symbol by Tuesday or Wednesday, although it could take longer, according to Kennedy.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: But the deal still faces legal uncertainty.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: There is ongoing litigation seeking to block the merger from closing.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: ‘Clearly a bubble’
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The bad news for Trump is that this stake is not as liquid as it sounds.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Those paper gains would be very difficult for Trump to translate to actual cash.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: In fact, Trump’s shares in this company are in many ways even less liquid than his real estate holdings, according to Charles Whitehead, a law professor at Cornell Law School.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: First, experts say the market is drastically overvaluing Trump Media based on the company’s fundamentals.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: That means Trump would have a hard time dumping the stock or even pledging it as collateral.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “The stock price is clearly a bubble,” Yale law professor Jonathan Macey told CNN.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “No rational investor would take the stock at face value, especially if they had to hold it for any length of time.”
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: SEC filings indicate Trump Media’s revenue amounted to just $1.1 million during the third quarter.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The company posted a loss of $26 million that quarter.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text:
Truth Social’s shrinking user base

Not only that, but Truth Social appears to be shrinking.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: The number of Truth Social’s US monthly active users on iOS and Android is down 39% year-over-year, according to Similarweb data shared with CNN earlier this month.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Truth Social remains much smaller than X (formerly Twitter), which is also shrinking but at a slower pace.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: And yet Trump Media is being valued north of $6 billion on a fully diluted basis, which includes all stocks and options that could be converted to common stock, according to Jay Ritter, a finance professor at the University of Florida.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Ritter said the current market price is hard, if not impossible, to justify.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “It is grossly overvalued,” said Ritter.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “It qualifies as a meme stock for which the price is divorced from fundamental value…Meme stock investors are usually buying on the basis of the greater fool theory of investing: It is overvalued today, but I hope to make money selling it to an even greater fool tomorrow at an even higher price.”
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text:
Insiders can’t sell right away

But even in the unlikely event that Trump found a taker for those shares, experts say he is likely not allowed to sell or pledge that stock – at least not yet.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: As is typical in a deal like this, certain shareholders are subject to a lock-up period that prevents insiders from immediately selling.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “No one wants to buy into a company where the largest shareholder – and really the face of the biggest product – is selling,” said Whitehead.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: In this case, key shareholders of Trump Media, including its management team, have agreed not to sell their common stock for six months to maintain “important stability to the leadership and governance” of the company, according to SEC filings.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Not only does that lock-up agreement prevent these key shareholders from selling their stock for six months, it says they have agreed not to “lend, offer, pledge…encumber, donate” that stock during the period.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: If the share price stays above $12 for a period of time, it’s possible that insiders can sell or pledge their stock 150 days after the deal closes.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “The lock-up is meant to stop insiders from selling immediately after the merger,” said Xavier Kowalski, a former partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel who is now a lecturer in the finance department at the University of Florida.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “It also stops them from pledging the stock, like with a margin loan.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: So it’s going to be difficult to find a way to use those shares to get cash for now.”
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text:
Banks may balk

Moreover, there are additional lock-up restrictions contained in an amended charter that experts say appear to include Trump.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: That lock-up also restricts certain shareholders from immediately selling after the deal closes.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “If his shares are covered by the charter’s lockup provisions then, absent an amendment to the charter, President Trump cannot pledge this stock.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: Full stop,” Whitehead said.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: And amending the charter would be tricky – even for Trump and his outsized sway over the company.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: That’s the kind of thing that would have to be disclosed ahead of time because it would impact potential buyers of the stock.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “He can’t do this quietly.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: If President Trump today intends to amend the charter and they are not disclosing this intention, that’s a problem,” Whitehead said.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “Presumably, they would need to take the position after the vote approving the merger that President Trump woke up and suddenly said, ‘Hey, let’s amend the charter.’
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text:
”

Now even if Trump overcame these potentially insurmountable obstacles, there is no guarantee any bank would take this stock as collateral in a loan.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “If I’m a bank, I’m going to be troubled by the idea of a significant shareholder pledging his stake,” Whitehead said.
Article Title: Trump is about to get $3 billion richer after deal is approved to take his company public. But it won’t solve his cash crunch

text: “Any bank doing a proper credit analysis must be sensitive to the fact that this stock may very well tank if it turns out that President Trump is looking to sell down the position.”
