text:
CNN —

The nation’s largest credit union said this week that an external review found it hadn’t considered race in mortgage underwriting, responding to CNN’s previous reporting about racial gaps in its mortgage approval rates.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: Navy Federal Credit Union, which has more than 13 million members and lends to military servicemembers, Department of Defense personnel, veterans and their families, said a review it commissioned from a civil rights lawyer “found no race-based decision making in our mortgage underwriting” and that “legitimate, non-race factors” had largely explained racial differences in approval rates.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: A CNN investigation published in December found that Navy Federal approved more than 75% of the White borrowers who applied for a new conventional home purchase mortgage in 2022 while approving less than 50% of Black borrowers who applied for the same type of loan, according to the most recent federal data available from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: The nearly 29-percentage-point gap in Navy Federal’s approval rates was the widest of any of the 50 lenders that originated the most mortgage loans in 2022.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: The disparity remained even after accounting for more than a dozen different variables available in public mortgage data, including applicants’ income, debt-to-income ratio and property value, CNN’s review found.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: In addition, an analysis by staff of the Senate Banking Committee, which 10 Democratic senators cited in a letter asking federal regulators to review Navy Federal’s mortgage lending earlier this year, also found racial disparities in Navy Federal’s mortgage approval rates based on the publicly available data.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: Navy Federal said Thursday that an analysis it had commissioned by lawyer Debo Adegbile, a former member of the U.S. Commission on Civil Rights, found that those racial disparities were largely accounted for by examining “all non-public underwriting factors.”
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: “Our review found that when all relevant factors are controlled for, which CNN did not do, the difference in approval rates between Black and White borrowers falls to less than 1%,” Adegbile said in a statement.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: “The remaining difference in approval rates is explained by legitimate, non-race factors like income verification and incomplete credit applications.”
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: The analysis also accounted for other non-public factors including applicants’ credit scores, the statement said.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: A spokesperson for Navy Federal did not respond to a request for additional details about the analysis.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: As CNN previously reported, applicants’ credit scores are not available in the public mortgage data, and Navy Federal declined to provide CNN any data that would make it possible to analyze credit scores or other non-public factors.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: CNN’s analysis only included mortgage applications that were listed in the public data as being fully submitted and either approved or denied, and excluded those that were listed as “closed for incompleteness.”
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: And while Navy Federal’s statement said its analysis included applicants’ debt-to-income ratios, CNN’s review also took those ratios, which are available in the public mortgage data, into account.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: Navy Federal described Adegbile’s analysis as an “external review,” but his law firm, WilmerHale, is also defending Navy Federal in a class-action lawsuit from Black and Latino borrowers who allege the credit union discriminated against them in mortgage applications.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: The same day that Navy Federal released a statement about the review, other lawyers from WilmerHale filed a motion to dismiss the lawsuit, which had cited CNN’s reporting.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: Attorneys for the credit union argued that the “alleged statistical disparities” the plaintiffs had cited were not sufficient to prove discrimination, and that they “fail to identify any Navy Federal policy or practice that caused any disparity.”
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: The lawyers also argued that agreements the plaintiffs had signed when they became members of the credit union had required them to give Navy Federal adequate notice before filing a lawsuit, and that most had not done so.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: Adegbile’s analysis was not included in Navy Federal’s motion to dismiss the case.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: The plaintiffs’ attorneys – Ben Crump, Adam Levitt, and Hassan Zavareei – said in a statement that it was “a classic conflict of interest” for Adegbile to review Navy Federal’s practices at the same time his firm was defending the credit union in court.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: “Navy Federal should immediately put out the full investigative report and data analysis so that Navy Federal’s members have an opportunity for themselves to review the findings,” the statement said.
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text: In its statement, Navy Federal also said it was “currently examining initiatives to build on our mission of expanding access to credit for our diverse community of members and continue our efforts to address systemic barriers to homeownership.”
Article Title: Navy Federal says external review finds ‘non-race factors’ explained mortgage approval disparities

text:
Chicago CNN —

This winter, every morning that hotel owner Kelli Doyen looked outside her window, she hoped to see the Gwinn Model Towne Inn’s snowmobile caked in snow.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “We are one of only four properties that has a snowmobile trail right off the property,” said Doyen, who co-owns the hotel on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula with her husband.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: In past seasons, that competitive advantage lured roughly 800 snowmobilers – it’s a top winter sport in northern states – to the hotel in Gwinn, Michigan, roughly 20 miles from Marquette.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: This year, instead of fresh powder, too often Doyen said she saw a muddy path.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Now, as the season draws to a close, “We are down 70% over sales from last winter,” she said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “We have had a pretty tough go of it.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: The 2023-2024 season marked the warmest winter on record for the lower 48 states, according to NOAA’s National Center for Environmental Information.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: The change in the weather has had an outsize impact on the festivals, events and tourism that define the Great Lakes identity and produce the income of those living and working there.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: All told, eight states experienced a record-warm season, including Wisconsin, Michigan, New York and Minnesota, plus North Dakota, Iowa, Vermont and New Hampshire.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Instead of a winter wonderland, the past several months have offered tourists less snow, less ice aind less opportunity for some outdoor activities.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Small businesses owners and regional industries scrambled to adapt.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Less outdoor ice skating might mean more indoor ice-skating.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Less snow-shoeing meant more pickleball in some places.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Doyen said the loss of income amounts to roughly $70,000.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: She’s one of several business owners in the midwest whose winter sales keep them afloat until the summer tourism season begins.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Since purchasing the property in 2020 - just before Covid hit – Doyen said she has invested a bulk of her profit into renovations.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Operating expenses total $15,000 per month.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: With the drop in bookings, her husband has pulled from his 401(k) to stay open.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “The last six months, I’ve spent every night here because I can’t afford to pay somebody to be here,” Doyen said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “We’re down to our last $20,000 and we have to make it to June.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “It’s depressing.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: It’s exhausting.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
Event and revenue meltdowns

With less snowfall, severe drought expanded over portions of Wisconsin and Michigan and increased in Iowa during the winter months, according to the US Drought Monitor.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: The situation grew so dire that governors in Michigan, Minnesota, and Wisconsin announced businesses impacted by drought may be eligible for loans from the Small Business Administration.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “From skiing and snowshoeing to winter festivals, snowy winters are part of our way of life in Minnesota,” Gov. Tim Waltz said in a news release in March 7.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
“The low precipitation we’ve experienced this winter has had a real economic impact on small businesses that rely on snow and winter tourism to grow and survive.”

Susan Estler, CEO of Travel Marquette in Marquette, Michigan, told CNN hotel bookings between Christmas and March are down 16% this year.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “We are dependent on the snow for outdoor activities,” Estler said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “Reservations are down.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Businesses are down.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Sunlight reflects off of Lake Michigan at Montrose Harbor on an unseasonably warm day, Tuesday, Feb. 27, 2024, in Chicago.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
Erin Hooley/AP

Estler estimates roughly 30% of tourism dollars are spent on hotels.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: That means the other 70% supports the local economy -– from gas stations to grocery stores to restaurants.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “All of those things have been impacted,” she said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Data from the Bureau of Economic Analysis highlights the significance of climate, and of snow in particular, on business owners’ bottom line.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: According to the BEA, snow activities in states clustered around the Great Lakes add hundreds of millions of dollars to the region’s economy.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: For example, Wisconsin snow activities added $83.6 million in 2022, according to the BEA, and roughly $130 million in Michigan the same year.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
Adapting business plans

Some events that normally bring throngs of tourists to Marquette were forced to cancel this year.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: That includes the UP200, a sled-dog race and qualifier for the famous Iditarod race in Alaska.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “Safety is our top priority and given the lack of snow and the warm temperatures, we cannot offer a safe race,” said Darlene Welch, UP200 President, in a statement on the UP200 website in February.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Estler noted the UP200 still held an outdoor festival instead of a race, an example of businesses quickly adapting to what may become a new normal.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “The time for adjustment is really now,” she said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “Hopefully we will be getting an early spring and an early summer so
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: [businesses] can start recouping some of the money that they lost during the winter.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
A road in Michigan during a snowy phase of winter in February 7, 2023 Christopher Germain

Christopher Germain, CEO of Lake Superior Community Partnership, said some ski areas have been offering summertime kayaking packages and outdoor space for special events and weddings to offset the loss in wintertime revenue.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
Germain added “Some of our small businesses are pairing up with each other to do special dining events.”

Partnerships and discounts

Germain, Estler, and Doyen are all transplants who moved to northern Michigan enchanted by the majesty of Upper Peninsula winters.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “I actually interviewed during the winter, toward the end of January, and it was just breathtakingly beautiful,” Estler said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “The identity of the UP and especially Marquette is very much tied to the winter season and always has been.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: So, it is quite unusual to have this.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Doyen said one of the most difficult parts of her hotel’s emptiness is her inability to deliver more visitors, activities and, therefore, ancillary revenue for her neighbors.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
“The fact that we have been empty has hurt our community too,” Doyen said

Despite the challenges, Doyen still loves running the Inn, and plans to keep her doors open as long as possible.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: “We actually care about our guests and care about our community.”
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Doyen told CNN she also plans to offer a 20 percent discount through the spring months in hopes of bringing in more visitors.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text: Going forward, “You can’t plan around one season anymore,” Germain said.
Article Title: Great Lakes small businesses and ski areas pivot following a record warm winter

text:
CNN —

With no winner of the Mega Millions jackpot Friday, the grand prize for Tuesday’s drawing grew past the billion-dollar mark, according to the lottery.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: The jackpot for the next drawing on Tuesday night – an estimated $1.1 billion – marks the first time in seven months that the jackpot prize has topped $1 billion and only the sixth time in less than six years that the Mega Millions jackpot hit that threshold, according to the lottery.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: Friday’s winning numbers were: 3, 8, 31, 35, 44 and Mega Ball 16.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: While there was no big winner Friday, five tickets matched five of the numbers to win the game’s $1 million prize, Mega Millions said.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: Another player in Virginia won $3 million by activating the Megaplier, according to the lottery.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: If the jackpot is won next Tuesday, it would be the fifth largest prize in the history of the game, according to the lottery.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: In August 2023, $1.602 billion was won by a ticket that was purchased in Neptune Beach, Florida, according to the Mega Millions Jackpot history.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: It was the largest the jackpot prize ever won.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: There has not been a Mega Millions jackpot winner since December 2023, when a prize of $394 million was snagged by two players in California.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: Mega Millions’ five largest jackpots all exceeded $1 billion, the lottery said.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text: Mega Millions drawings are held Tuesdays and Fridays at 11 p.m. ET.
Article Title: Mega Millions jackpot climbs to an estimated $1.1 billion after no grand prize winner Friday

text:
CNN —

Rome might not have built ancient history’s biggest empire – a shout out to Genghis for that one – but it was undoubtedly the most enduring and influential.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: That’s because Roman passions for outrageous, oversized architecture went hand in hand with detailed record-keeping and relentless imperial PR.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: As a result not only have a huge number of landmark sites survived to this day, but we also know a lot about them.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: So grab your toga and follow us from the sands of Africa to the soggiest bits of the Scottish Borders to discover everything from spectacular triple-decker bridges and legendary stadiums to air-fried ancient pets and a huge German gate that didn’t actually work.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Coliseum

What:
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
The most iconic sports stadium of all

Where: Rome, Italy

Whoa: 80,000 seat Roman Super Bowl

When it comes to superlative Roman buildings, Rome’s own amphitheater is by far the most famous.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: With a maximum seating capacity of 80,000, it’s the largest ancient amphitheater ever built.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The instantly recognizable four-story arched oval towers nearly 50 meters (160 feet) high, and was used for gladiatorial games that went on for days at a time.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The passages and rooms for waiting animals – up to 9,000 a show – and fighters can still be clearly seen under where the arena floor would have been.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: We should warn you that the lines to get in now are likely even longer than the Roman ones though.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: So either get there very early or just enjoy watching influencers fighting their own gladiator battles over the best selfie spots as the sun goes down.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Fun fact: The floor of the Coliseum could be flooded with water for the enactment of “sea battles.”

Pompeii and Herculaneum

Many of Pompeii's treasures were baked into a state of perfect preservation.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Marco Cantile/LightRocket/Getty Images

What: Volcanically immortalized Roman towns

Where: Naples, Italy

Whoa: The closest you’ll get to 2,000 years of time travel

Pliny the Younger’s story of the destruction of Pompeii and Herculaneum is the original disaster movie script.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: It tells how the eruption of nearby Mount Vesuvius in 79 ACE buried the two towns in up to six meters of superheated ash in just two days.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: That incinerated 1,000-plus inhabitants who hadn’t fled fast enough and even some of their pets.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: It also literally baked buildings, paintings, artifacts and even food remains into a state of perfect preservation.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: While it was forgotten for over 1,000 years, this UNESCO World Heritage site now gets over 2,500,000 visitors a year.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: That’s still a positive though.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: With the streets crowded with foreign voices and Roman shop signs and graffiti still vivid on the walls, you’ll instantly be transported back in time like no other site we know.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Funereal fact: Archaeologists have created haunting casts of Pompeii’s victims and their pets by filling the voids left in the solidified ash with plaster.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Pont du Gard

What: Incredible triple-decker bridge

Where: Gardon River, France

Whoa: 360 meters long (1,181 feet), 50 meters high, over 2,000 years old

Not only is the Pont du Gard aqueduct breathtakingly beautiful, it’s also an incredible example of how meticulous Roman engineering and mathematics were.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: While most of the Western world was still relying on wells for their water until a century ago, the Romans had running water for drinking, bathing and fountains 2,000 years ago.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The triple-decker aqueduct 50 meters above the river Gardon shows just how ingenious they could be in guaranteeing that supply too.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Not only is the arched architecture absolutely beautiful, but it’s created from such precisely cut stone it doesn’t even use mortar to hold it together.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Look closely and you can even see inscribed instructions as to where each stone (some as heavy as six tons) was meant to go in the grand design.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: The overall water course length the aqueduct is part of is 50 kilometers long (30 miles) with an average gradient of just 1 in 3,000.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Lepcis Magna

Lepcis Magna was once a thriving Roman port city.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Mahmud Turkia/AFP/Getty Images

What: Spectacularly preserved Roman port

Where
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
: Libyan coast

Whoa: Seeing is still not believing

The undoubted winner of the “most incredible Roman site you’ve never heard of” award is Lepcis Magna.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: It might sound more like the scientific name of a rare animal, but this Libyan site is home to an unbelievably well-preserved Roman port.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Once a thriving city, flourishing on the trade from deeper Africa, Lepcis Magna was gradually swallowed up by desert sands after the Roman Empire collapsed.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: It was barely disturbed for the next 1,500 years either, so the huge, column-lined forum, vast semi-circular theater overlooking the sea, multi-tier amphitheater and many stunning sculptures and murals have all survived almost intact.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Sadly, with many governments currently warning against travel to Libya, it’s one that most of us are better off viewing remotely for the time being.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun Fact: Lepcis Magna was the birthplace of emperor Septimus Severus and his majestic triumphal arch is the perfectly preserved gateway to the deserted city.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Pantheon

What: Unique domed temple

Where: Rome, Italy

Whoa: Unbeaten Roman engineering

If it wasn’t for the queues looping right round the square in front of it, you might think the Pantheon was “just another big Roman temple.”
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: After all, the portico (front face) with its eight Corinthian columns and carved triangular top certainly look conventional enough.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Join the queue to get inside though, and the radical construction of this building becomes very clear.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The circular body of this temple-turned-church is topped with a stunning domed rotunda, complete with a central hole to let sunlight in.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The ceiling is awe-inspiring enough aesthetically to have you staring up in wonder, but there’s another reason to be blown away too.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: At 43 meters (140 feet) in diameter, this historic half-sphere is still the largest unreinforced concrete dome in the world, nearly 2,000 years after it was made.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: The base of the dome uses heavyweight travertine concrete while the top is lightweight tufa and pumice.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Palatine Hill

The Palatine was once Rome's swankiest address.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
StevanZZ/Alamy Stock Photo

What: The heart of ancient Rome

Where: Rome, Italy

Whoa: A pancake stack of palaces

Rome might have been known as “the city of the seven hills,” but only one mound really mattered: The Palatine.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: This prehistoric origin site became the must-have address of leading Republican politicians before Emperor Augustus took charge, back in 27 BCE, and started a streak of Imperial palace-building.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Tiberius, Domitian and Nero continued the pancake-stacking frenzy until the whole hill was completely buried under the masonry, monumental arches, pillars and towering retaining walls you see today.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The result is a fascinating puzzle for visitors to unravel while enjoying spectacular views of forum ruins at its feet and across to the Coliseum and Circus Maximus.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Don’t miss the house of Augustus guided tour either, as the projected displays are a masterpiece of museum tech.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: Nero’s palace on the Palatine burnt down, so he swapped to another hill for his second “Golden Home.”
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Porta Nigra

What: Huge German frontier gate

Where: Trier, Germany

Whoa: Like “Game of Thrones” but for real

Throughout Roman history, Germany was the final frontier where only the boldest of emperors would go.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The remains of countless centuries of campaigning against tenacious Teutonic tribes are still relatively rare though.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: This makes the Porta Nigra (Black Gate) in Trier particularly important.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: While having four gates on each side of a square town was the standard Roman civic design all over the empire, Trier’s double-tower castle design is also outstanding in its size and complexity.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: That’s made this dramatic structure a designated UNESCO World Heritage site and well worth a visit on any Roman road trip across Europe.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: The archway stonework was never fully finished, which means the gates would never have shut properly.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Vindolanda

Vindolanda is still being excavated by archaeologists.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Highlight of Hadrian’s Wall

Where: Northern England

Whoa: Roman love letters and so many sandals

The roller coaster, 70-mile-long turf and stone wall that Hadrian built coast to coast across northern England is a multi-site, must-visit Roman treasure in itself.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Vindolanda, just to the south of the craggy, weatherbeaten ridgeline fortifications, is home to a unique and unmissable museum too.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The “Vindolanda tablets” are a collection of wooden “Post It” notes preserved in the waterlogged ground of the site.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Their handwritten texts include military admin documents, curses, love letters and even a party invitation from an officer’s wife.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Together they offer a unique insight into everyday life at the farthest-flung edge of the Roman Empire.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The onsite museum also has a huge collection of superbly preserved sandals, leatherwork, fabric and even wigs from nearly 2,000 years ago.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: You can watch archaeologists working on the site every summer too, so who knows what they’ll find while you’re there.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: Hadrian’s Wall isn’t the furthest north the Romans got.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Antonine built another wall further up in Scotland but didn’t like the cooking so didn’t bother staying.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Aphrodisia

What: The ancient city of love

﻿Where: Anatolia, Turkey

﻿Whoa: Incredibly intact Roman city

Despite being named after the Greek goddess of love, it’s the Roman remains that you’re going to fall head over heels for at Aphrodisia.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: A UNESCO World Heritage site since 2017, Aphrodisia was largely deserted after an earthquake, so it’s been untouched for over 1,500 years.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The incredibly well-preserved remains include the towering columns of the Temple of Aphrodisia itself and a semi-circular, marble-seated Odeon for political meetings.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: A vast multi-story, pillared sebastion (imperial temple), theater auditorium and bath house also wait to be discovered among scattered sculptures and whispering trees.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Or maybe you’ll want to run a Roman lap around one of the best preserved – and largest – stadiums in the empire.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: The Temple of Aphrodisia is actually the least well-loved bit of the site as Christian Emperors partially demolished it to deter die-hard Aphrodisiacs.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
Baths of Caracalla

The Baths of Caracalla were built from an estimated 5,000,000 tons of stone.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text:
leventina/iStockphoto/Getty Images

What: Ruins of a huge public bath complex

Where: Rome, Italy

Whoa: Rome’s forgotten jaw dropper

If there was one Roman site that needs the kind of ominous drone soundtrack normally reserved for the first appearance of a planet-destroying spaceship on a cinema screen, it’s the Baths of Caracalla.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: This one good deed of the infamous, brother-murdering tyrant Caracalla is often forgotten, but we reckon this behemoth of a building is absolutely worth including on any Roman itinerary.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Built from an estimated 5,000,000 tons of stone, it is genuinely jaw dropping in scale.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: The furnace-stoked underfloor heating and multiple baths fed by dedicated aqueducts entertained and steam-cleaned up to 8,000 Romans a day for three centuries.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: And while ruined and isolated from the normal tourist trail now, that somehow makes this monstrous local leisure center even more resonant as a vast brooding reminder of the scale Rome operated on.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Fun fact: The baths of Caracalla aren’t even the biggest in Rome.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Diocletian gets that badge.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Guy Kesteven is a former archaeologist who now joins up ancient sites by bike with his wife Sarah on their @pedallingpast YouTube channel.
Article Title: The genius Roman creations that still amaze us today

text: Their daughter Freya, who is studying archaeology at London’s Royal Holloway University, assisted with research on this story.

text:
CNN —

There’s a global energy crisis and onshore wind farms are a potential growth option.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Larger wind turbines produce more power than standard ones, but the components are too big to be transported by road.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: What’s the solution?
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: A Colorado-based energy startup named Radia has an idea.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: It’s developing the biggest aircraft in aviation history.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Meet the WindRunner airplane, whose mission will be to deliver gigantic 300-foot-long blades directly to wind farms.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: To help the world meet its decarbonization targets, it’ll use sustainable aviation fuel and needs only a simple packed-dirt or gravel runway to land on.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: It’ll operate from regional hubs, says Radia, delivering where needed – and “can land on airstrips as short as 6,000 feet (1,800 meters), something no other large commercial aircraft can achieve.”
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Where do the pilots go?
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Right up top.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text:
Radia

Let’s talk about specs, baby

When it comes to carrying the largest payloads ever moved by air, dainty just isn’t going to cut it.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: So WindRunner will have a cargo bay volume of 272,000 cubic feet, enough to hold three Olympic swimming pools.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: That’s 12 times the volume of a Boeing 747-400 and – at 356 feet in length, it’s 127 feet longer too.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: As for the wingspan, that’s 261 feet – imagine four bowling lanes laid end to end.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: It will also dwarf the Antonov An-225, the heaviest aircraft ever built, which was destroyed at the start of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: The aircraft’s scale might be groundbreaking, but the engineering is not – and that’s by design.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Radia says it’s focusing “on existing technology and safety by using, where applicable, tried-and-true aviation materials, components and fabrication techniques that have FAA [US Federal Aviation Administration] approval, are already in mass production and are lowest-risk.”
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: The idea is to hit the ground running with a fast, well-built fleet that meets aerospace industry standards.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Online reports say commercial operations as soon as 2027, but there’s no timeline confirmed on Radia’s website.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: CNN has reached out to the company for comment.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Radia has patented a system for loading blades into WindRunner.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text:
Radia

There she blows

Radia is banking on research organisation Bloomberg NEF’s estimation that up to $10 trillion will be spent on onshore wind through 2050.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: The development of WindRunner is to enable GigaWind, the XXL turbines made by Radia’s partners, which include five of the world’s top six turbine manufacturers.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Currently, turbine blades today are ordinarily 230 feet or less (70 meters), but Radia wants to deploy blades of up to 104 meters (341 feet).
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: The company says GigaWind turbines could potentially be two to three times more powerful – and two to three times more profitable than those typically deployed today.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: So who are the folks behind these ambitious claims?
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: The founder and CEO is Mark Lundstrum, a cross-industry entrepreneur and MIT aerospace engineer who founded Radia in 2016.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: The company says its team of advisers include former top brass from Boeing, MIT, Rolls-Royce and the FAA, as well as former US Secretary of Energy Ernest Moniz and former Prime Minister of Australia Malcolm Turnbull.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: It’s an impressive lineup and the decision to focus on safe, existing technology is a smart one.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Might we see a WindRunner take off before the end of the decade?
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Could its distinctive shape one day be as popular as the Beluga XL transporter planes created by Airbus?
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text: Watch the skies.
Article Title: WindRunner: Gigantic new aircraft design aims to create the largest plane ever to fly

text:
CNN —

Major League Baseball and the Internal Revenue Service are investigating amid allegations surrounding Los Angeles Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani and his longtime interpreter Ippei Mizuhara.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The investigations are underway just two days after Mizuhara, a longtime interpreter for the Japanese baseball superstar, was fired after the player’s lawyers accused him of “massive theft” of millions of dollars and placing bets with a bookmaker under federal investigation, according to ESPN and the Los Angeles Times, which first reported the story.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: “Major League Baseball has been gathering information since we learned about the allegations involving Shohei Ohtani and Ippei Mizuhari from the news media,” the league said in a news release.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: “Earlier today, our Department of Investigations (DOI) began their formal process investigating the matter.”
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The IRS Criminal Investigation Los Angeles Field Office is investigating both Mizuhara and Mathew Bowyer, IRS spokesperson Scott Villiard told CNN on Friday.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Bowyer is a California resident whose bankruptcy court documents show had gambling debts of $425,000 more than a decade ago.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Diane Bass, an attorney for Bowyer, told CNN her client “never had any contact with Mr. Ohtani.”
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Ohtani’s attorneys have not detailed how they believe the funds were stolen, fueling questions about the scandal that emerged as Ohtani made his much-anticipated debut with the Los Angeles Dodgers.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts told reporters Ohtani will address the media on Monday amid the scandal.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The saga began with reporters asking questions about alleged wire transfers from Ohtani’s bank account and culminated in Mizuhara’s firing.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text:
Here’s how the scandal unfolded:

• Mizuhara told ESPN in a Tuesday interview arranged by Ohtani’s representative that Ohtani had no involvement in his betting and that Mizuhara asked the player last year to pay off his gambling debt, ESPN reported.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: But after the interview, Ohtani’s spokesperson “disavowed” Mizuhara’s account, then released a statement saying Ohtani had been the victim of theft.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: • On the same day, Mizuhara was seen smiling in the LA dugout and talking to Ohtani before translating for the star in the team’s 5-2 win over the San Diego Padres in the MLB season-opening game in Seoul, South Korea, on Wednesday.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: • Later on Wednesday, Mizuhara was fired as Ohtani’s interpreter.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The pair had been working together since 2013.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: • After learning about the allegations against Ohtani and Mizuhara, MLB announced it would be pursuing an investigation on Friday.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The IRS also confirmed it was investigating the translator.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: In an interview with CNN on Saturday, an attorney for Bowyer, the former bookmaker under investigation in connection to the controversy, said Bowyer “never met” or had “any direct contact” with Ohtani.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text:
Former bookmaker ‘only did business’ with interpreter, attorney says

Bowyer’s attorney, Bass, told CNN in an interview Saturday that the only person the former bookmaker “did business” with was Mizuhara.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: “Mathew Bowyer never spoke with or emailed with or texted with or had any contact whatsoever with Shohei Ohtani,” Bass told CNN.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Bowyer met Mizuhara after a Padres game in San Diego in 2022, according to Bass.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Bass told CNN she does not know how often Mizuhara placed bets or how much he bet, but said Bowyer told her that Mizuhara placed bets regularly on “primarily soccer, occasionally football and basketball, but it was never baseball.”
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Mizuhara told ESPN on Tuesday, “I never bet on baseball…That’s 100 percent.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: I knew that rule…We have a meeting about that in spring training.”
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Mizuhara’s gambling “got out of hand at a certain point,” but “he was making regular payments for a significant amount of time,” Bass said.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Asked if the payments were coming from Mizuhara’s or Ohtani’s account, Bass replied, “I honestly don’t know how many transfers came from which account(s),
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: [or] whether it was more than one account.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: I don’t have access to that information,” she told CNN.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: When discussing Ohtani’s name on “one of the wire transfers to Bowyer’s organization to cover a bet,” Bass said, “as far as Mr. Bowyer understood, the bet was from Ippei, or it was being covered by Mr. Ohtani for Ippei.”
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: CNN has sought comment from Mizuhara and Ohtani’s agent.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Bass emphasized that while Bowyer is under federal investigation, he has not been charged with a crime.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text:
She said Bowyer stopped his bookmaking operation in October 2023 when “feds showed up at his house.”

$4.5 million transferred from Ohtani’s accounts, ESPN reports

ESPN’s Tisha Thompson, citing unnamed sources, said on CNN’s “The Lead” Wednesday at least $4.5 million was withdrawn via wire transfer from Ohtani’s bank accounts, though it is unclear who initiated the transfers.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Thompson also reports sources told her Mizuhara’s sports betting dates back as early as 2021, when Ohtani was playing for the Los Angeles Angels.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: When reached for comment, the Angels referred all questions to the Dodgers and Shohei’s representatives.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Ohtani played his last game with the Angels last year before signing a record-breaking 10-year, $700 million contract with the Dodgers.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The Dodgers confirmed Mizuhara’s firing and said they are “aware of media reports and are gathering information.”
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: The team added it had no further comment.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text:
Shifting statements

As news of Mizuhara’s firing and alleged actions unfolded, both the interpreter and Ohtani’s representatives have shifted their statements given to ESPN reporters – first saying the star player was aware of his translator’s gambling debt and later that he had no knowledge or involvement.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: ESPN’s Thompson said the interpreter and Ohtani’s representatives did “a big 180” in what they were telling her.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: At first, Ohtani’s spokesperson told ESPN the player had transferred money to help pay off Mizuhara’s gambling debts, the outlet reported.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: In a Tuesday interview with ESPN, the translator said Ohtani was unhappy with the situation but agreed to pay the debt.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Mizuhara also said that he never bet on MLB games and denied Ohtani had any involvement.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text:
Then on Wednesday, Ohtani’s law firm, Berk Brettler LLP, released a statement saying, “In the course of responding to recent media inquiries, we discovered that Shohei has been the victim of a massive theft and we are turning the matter over to the authorities.”

That same day, Mizuhara admitted lying about Ohtani being aware of his debts, Thompson said.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: He walked back much of his initial story, saying instead that Ohtani had no knowledge of the interpreter’s debts and had made no payments, ESPN reported.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Mizuhara apologized to the team after the Dodgers’ game in Seoul Wednesday, according to ESPN, citing an unnamed Dodgers official.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: “I’ve been told (Mizuhara) says something to the effect of ‘I’m sorry.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Thompson said on ESPN.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: Ohtani and Mizuhara first worked together from 2013 to 2017 when Mizuhara served as a translator for the Nippon-Ham Fighters, Ohtani’s team with Japan’s Nippon Professional Baseball League, according to MLB.com.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations

text: When Ohtani joined the Los Angeles Angels in 2018, he asked Mizuhara to join him as his translator in the rookie season, and Mizuhara eventually followed the star to the Dodgers.
Article Title: Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter: The latest developments on the gambling and ‘massive theft’ allegations
