CNN —

The Los Angeles Lakers produced their highest scoring night in 37 years on Monday, outlasting the Indiana Pacers 150-145 in a clash between two potent offenses.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: The Lakers, led by the superstar duo of LeBron James and Anthony Davis, had four players score at least 25 points in what was the team’s highest scoring game of the season.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Davis led the way with 36 points and 16 rebounds while shooting an efficient 15-of-21 from the field.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: James and Spencer Dinwiddie each had 26 points while Austin Reaves chipped in with 25, including six free throws inside the final minute to help ice the game.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Per the NBA, these four players became the first quartet of teammates to each score 25+ points in over three years, and the first Lakers teammates to achieve the feat since 1971.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Indiana held a six-point lead after the first quarter before a scoring explosion from LA saw the team put up 86 points across the second and third quarters alone.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “Offensively, we were very sharp,” James said postgame.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “We had some turnovers in the first quarter and first half but cleaned it up in the second half.”
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Davis drives to the hoop during the game.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text:
Etienne Laurent/AP

The Pacers, meanwhile, had all five starters – and eight players in total – hit double figures after a late fourth-quarter rally saw the team fall just short.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Indiana has boasted one of the best offenses in the league throughout the season and currently holds the second-best offensive rating in the league.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “We played (the Pacers) in the (In-Season Tournament) championship, and we know how high-powered an offense they are,” said James.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “They’re never going to stop playing no matter how far they get down or how far they’re up, so it’s a good win for us.”
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Despite the free-scoring nature of the game, Davis lamented his side’s defensive performance.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “We allowed them to score 145, so … it was terrible defensively,” Davis said after the game.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “They hit some shots toward the end, but we can do what we want offensively – as you could see tonight – but we’ve got to defend, especially when we’ve got a team (in trouble) like that.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: We don’t need to give them life, but at this point in the season, a win is a win.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: We’ll take it, but we’ve got to learn from it as well.”
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: The Lakers were almost made to pay for their porous defense, as the Pacers came back from 19 points down to cut the lead to only three when All-Star Tyrese Haliburton drilled two triples inside the final 30 seconds of the game.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: The late flurry turned out to be too little, too late for Indiana, but head coach Rick Carlisle was pleased with his squad’s effort.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Haliburton shoots a floater during the game.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text:
Ronald Martinez/Getty Images

“Sometimes, when you have difficult challenges, it’s easy to drop your head and just say, ‘Hey, it’s not our night,’ but our guys don’t do that,” he said.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “Our second unit battled in the second half.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: That last five-minute stretch, the first unit came back in there, and they were defiant about hanging in the game.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: At a certain point, you’ve got to play absolutely perfectly, and that was going to be very, very difficult.”
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Carlisle was also unimpressed with the disparity in foul calls between the two sides.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: “There were just certain things that were impossible to overcome.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: A 27 free throw differential is one, and a 17-foul differential is the other,” he said.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: Mid-season trade acquisition Pascal Siakam led the Pacers in scoring with 36 points to go along with 12 rebounds, while Myles Turner and Andrew Nembhard contributed 20 and 15 points respectively as the Pacers fell to 40-32 – currently good enough for sixth in the Eastern Conference.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: The Purple and Gold, meanwhile, win their third in a row to move to 39-32 and occupy the No. 9 seed in the West and a spot in the postseason Play-In Tournament.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text: The Lakers now embark on a six-game road-trip and will be looking to improve their seeding and secure an automatic playoff berth as the season winds down.
Article Title: LA Lakers post highest point total since 1987 in historic scoring night against Indiana Pacers

text:
CNN —

The No. 3 seeded LSU Tigers held off No. 11 Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders to advance to the women’s March Madness Sweet 16 on Sunday, amid distractions surrounding head coach Kim Mulkey.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: The defending champions overcame a slow start to easily beat Middle Tennessee 83-56 at Pete Maravich Assembly Center to make the Sweet 16 round for the second straight year.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: But, LSU’s March Madness campaign has been overshadowed by a spat between Mulkey and the Washington Post.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: Mulkey said a reporter for the newspaper has been attempting to interview her for the last two years.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: She claims the reporter contacted the school on Tuesday, sending more than a dozen questions to answer by Thursday, as the team was preparing for its first-round game.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: While Mulkey has been highly critical of the Washington Post, she has not divulged the nature of the story that the Post has been working on, or why she is attacking the Post for a story that has not published.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: A Washington Post spokesperson declined to comment on Mulkey’s remarks, which were made before LSU’s win.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: Following the team’s victory on Sunday, Mulkey denied the team’s sluggish first half came as a result of the team being distracted from the off-the-court noise.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “Listen, man, we’re not going to let one sleazy reporter distract us from what we’re trying to do.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: Absolutely not,” Mulkey said after reaching the 17th Sweet 16 round of her career.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “My kids didn’t even know I said that yesterday.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: That team is not involved in this.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: They were in shock when they saw all that on the internet.”
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text:
The Tigers trailed by four points going into halftime, but came out firing in the second period, galvanized by the defense of guard Hailey Van Lith.

From that, the team’s offense sprung into life, with LSU outscoring Middle Tennessee 51-20 in the second half.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: Angel Reese recorded her 14th consecutive double-double – her 25th of the season – with 20 points and 11 rebounds, while Flau’Jae Johnson added 21 points.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: Reese drives to the basket against Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders center Anastasiia Boldyreva.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text:
Stephen Lew/USA TODAY Sports/Reuters

Aneesah Morrow also had a double-double with 19 points and 13 rebounds and Mikaylah Williams had 16 points to seal a victory which ended the Blue Raiders’ 20-game winning run.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “I didn’t want to let my team down,” Reese said afterwards.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “I didn’t want this to be my last game being here in the PMAC.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: So I did whatever it takes to win.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text:
And me and Coach have that kind of relationship where she can get on me and talk to me, like, I need you, and give me that encouragement that I need.”

LSU’s qualification for the Sweet 16 is the 16th time the team has done so in the program’s history and the first time since 2013-14 that it has done it in back-to-back seasons.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: The Tigers will face either No. 2 UCLA or No. 7 Creighton on Saturday, March 30 in the next round.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: After Sunday’s victory, freshman guard Johnson paid tribute to the 12,632 strong crowd in attendance at the Pete Maravich Assembly Center and the inspiration they gave the team.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “I couldn’t hear at one point at PMAC,” Johnson told reporters.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “I didn’t hear the play calls.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: I couldn’t hear what was going on.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: It was so much fun.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: “I love playing here at LSU and everything going on.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: It was so much fun.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: Now to be able to advance in my second year here, it’s just amazing.
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text: I wish we could take this crowd and bring it everywhere we go, but I know they’re going to come to Albany, and I hope to see everybody in Albany.”
Article Title: Kim Mulkey: No. 3 LSU advances to women’s March Madness Sweet 16 amid distraction surrounding head coach

text:
CNN —

UFC fighter Igor Severino was disqualified from his fight on Saturday night after biting his opponent, Andre Lima.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: In the second round of their flyweight bout in Las Vegas, Lima was being held from behind by Severino before the 20-year-old appeared to lean in and bite Lima on his left arm.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: Lima let out an audible shout before referee Chris Tognoni stopped the fight and announced that Severino had been disqualified from the fight, awarding the win to Lima.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: Lima posed for photos after his victory, with a bite mark visible on his left arm.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: According to martial arts journalist Kevin Iole, UFC president Dana White said in a text message that Severino had been released from the organization following the disqualification.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: “Those were two up-and-coming undefeated fighters,” White said, according to Iole.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: “If you get frustrated and want out of the fight, there are plenty of ways to do it, but the worst thing you can do is bite your opponent.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: “Now you get cut and lose the biggest opportunity of your life.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: Not to mention, he’s going to have real problems with the NSAC (Nevada State Athletic Commission).”
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: Lima didn’t appear too bothered by the incident though, posting on Instagram in the hours after his fight that he had got a tattoo of the bite to commemorate it.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: The tattoo is in the same location as the original bite and appears to recreate the bitemarks left on his arm from Severino.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: White appeared impressed by Lima’s tattoo, posting on his Instagram story that he would double the Brazilian’s fight bonus to $50,000, saying: “This is AWESOME.”
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: The UFC’s own social media accounts humorously commemorated the moment, coining Lima’s fight the “bite of the night,” a play on their more traditional “fight of the night” accolade.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: “I was able to hit him really hard, but then he bit me when I was trying to take him down.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: That’s why I yelled,” Lima said in the octagon after his fight.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: It was an unconventional way for Lima to earn his first UFC victory as he was making his debut in the competition on Saturday.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text: He remains undefeated in his MMA career, while the disqualification is Severino’s first defeat.
Article Title: Andre Lima vs. Igor Severino: UFC fighter disqualified for biting opponent

text:
CNN —

Writing in 1863, the French poet and critic Charles Baudelaire turned his eye to a striking faction of Parisian and English high society, one militantly fanatical for appearances — so much that some were said to polish their boots with Champagne.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “Dandyism is a mysterious institution,” he said of the cult of the fastidiously-dressed, 19th-century male, “no less peculiar than the duel.”
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Though himself no stranger to decadence — with a predilection for satin, velvet and changing his hair on a whim, Baudelaire squandered an inheritance with his louche taste for clothing and opium — he identified in the dandy’s subversive character a “burning desire to create a personal form of originality.”
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Scores of subcultures have embraced and interpreted the archetype in the decades since.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Rather than Beau Brummell’s crisply-tied cravat, today the term “dandy” may summon visions of Harry Styles in a string of freshwater pearls or playwright Jeremy O. Harris’ natty Thom Browne suiting.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: But its preening, self-curated elegance remains, beyond limits of the gender binary or preconceived notions of how one “should” dress.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “There’s not one definitive description,” observed the British artist Sarah Ball in a video call with CNN.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “Gender norms are so blurred now, fantastically.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text:
It’s a moving scale, wherever we choose to be.”

"Von," a subject featured in two of Ball's "Tilted" portraits, pictured here in a Puritan-style bonnet and gown.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text:
Todd-White Art Photography/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

"Henry," also twice a sitter for Ball, pictured here in a shirt, tie and louche beret.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text:
Todd-White Art Photography/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

The concept of the dandy in the twenty-first century — and how it may be defined or disrupted — is the connective thread of Ball’s first New York solo exhibition, “Tilted,” which debuted at Stephen Friedman Gallery in Tribeca earlier this year.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Comprising 10 large-scale, tightly composed portraits in Ball’s signature airy stretches of color, the show challenges conventions of gender and celebrates the exuberance of self-expression.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Each of the personalities represented in “Tilted” is dressed in their own idiosyncratic accoutrements, rendered in minute detail: rakish beribboned headgear, delicate lace collars and bonnets, expressive makeup, oversized eyewear and, in one instance, even a cocktail glass, holding a slosh of liquid and the briny green of a Castelvetrano olive.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Ball — who works from a studio in the small English town of St Ives, Cornwall, where artists have been drawn to the light and the sea for generations — typically finds her subjects through social media or on the street, attracted by their “degree of complete individuality,” she told CNN.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Exploring the dandy persona has been a natural development for Ball, whose work needles the tension between self-identity and the performance of outward presentation.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “It’s part of a much bigger idea: how we are defined by others or how we define ourselves.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: That can be anything — race, ethnicity, or religion, or sexuality or gender fluidity,” she told CNN.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “I’ve always been very interested in how we present a version of ourselves externally; how our personality manifests itself.”
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: For all the wit in the clothes, there is a stillness and a surreal quality in Ball’s portraits that place her subjects slightly out of time.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “That is definitely something I seek when I’m looking for people to paint,” she said.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Indelible personal style is also crucial to the allure.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Ball doesn’t costume her subjects, though she edits details to balance the composition.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “They’re ready-made, in a way,” she explained, “but then the painting really does take over.”
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Ball's 2023 painting "Declan (In Simone Rocha With Eddie)."
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Ball imbues the pair with a self-composure that borders on stoicism; together, they project an imperiousness akin to a Holbein patron.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Todd-White Art Photography/Courtesy Friedman Gallery
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: At over eight feet tall, “Declan (In Simone Rocha With Eddie),” depicts an individual in a sumptuous, crystal-embroidered smock dress by the Irish designer, known for her rebellious take on historic ritual, “feminine” codes and gender play.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Accompanied by their long-haired guinea pig Eddie, swaddled in a lace-edged handkerchief, Declan’s coiffed shag haircut could read 18th century Flanders — or any contemporary hipster enclave, be it in Brooklyn or Berlin.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: An encounter with the writer Andrew Solomon’s 2004 essay Dandyism, published years before Instagram and other social media became the de facto avenue for exhibitionist display, influenced the body of work, according to Ball.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “I’ve always looked (at) and used historical archives as a way of connecting with what’s happening in the world at the moment,” Ball said.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “It’s a bit tongue in cheek, but the idea of ‘promenade’ in showing oneself peacocking is the same as people use social media for, really.”
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: (Cue Solomon, quoting the French novelist Jules Barbey d’Aurevilly, “To appear to be is to be for Dandies.”)
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Ball's engaging, enigmatic portraits withhold any narrative about their sitters, instead emphasizing physical and aesthetic characteristics that offer an interpretation of the self.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text:
Olympia Shannon/Courtesy Friedman Gallery

Two figures in the show, Von and Henry, materialize in multiple guises, demonstrating the transformativeness of persona construction and the depth of what may lie beyond the surface.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “I’m aware that Instagram allows us to curate an image, an idea of ourselves, but unless you know that person, you don’t really ever know whether that’s true,” Ball noted.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “There’s that intersection where truth meets fiction.”
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: Her interpretations on the dandy shows how mutable and fluid the persona is, as Ball name-checks a series of female inspirations for the ‘look;’ the outré trouser suits and cropped bobs introduced by designer Gabrielle “Coco” Chanel, screen cipher Marlene Dietrich and Sandy Powell, the flame-haired, bespectacled costume designer known for her collaborations with directors Martin Scorsese and Todd Haynes.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: What remains is pure individual verve.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text: “I’ve always been drawn to people that have not followed one path or another…who are extroverts, theatrical, unusual, creative, and wonderful,” Ball said.
Article Title: The painter reframing ‘dandies’ for the female gaze

text:
CNN —

Diamonds are forever – especially for Emily Ratajkowski, who has chosen to turn her engagement ring into something entirely new following her split from her film producer husband, Sebastian Bear-McClard.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: With the help of Alison Chemla, creative director of jewelry brand Alison Lou, Ratajkowski worked to remake her old engagement ring, which featured a pear-shaped and a princess-cut diamond, into two separate rings.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: “The rings represent my own personal evolution,” the model told Vogue.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: “I don’t think a woman should be stripped of her diamonds just because she’s losing a man.”
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: Now, the pear-shaped diamond sits on Ratajkowski’s pinkie finger, while the princess cut has been flanked by more trapezoid stones and turned into a new sparkler.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: Ratajkowski went on to explain that she got the idea after reading Stephanie Danler’s story “The Unravelers” in The Paris Review.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: Ratajkowski told Vogue she was inspired by a story in The Paris Review in which the author writes of a grandmother's ring made of stones from her previous marriages.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text:
From Emily Ratajkowski/Instagram

“(It) includes the story of her grandmother’s snake ring—a ring that is made up of the different stones from her various marriages,” said Ratajkowski, who was catapulted to fame after she appeared in the music video for Robin Thicke’s 2013 track “Blurred Lines.”
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: “I loved the idea of a ring unabashedly representing the many lives a woman has lived.”
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: The model, who shares a son with Bear-McClard, added that creating the rings was a “fun project” to work on “amidst a hugely transitional period in my life.”
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: “The ring became symbolic to me—some kind of token or evidence of my life becoming my own again,” she said.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text: “Somehow, these rings feel like a reminder that I can make myself happy in ways I never imagined,” she added.
Article Title: Emily Ratajkowski has changed her engagement ring into two ‘divorce rings’

text:
CNN —

More than 4,000 culturally significant items, including textiles, ceramics, and clothing, have been repatriated to Peru, their country of origin, the Peruvian Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: The 4,600 cultural assets were returned to the South American country from the United States and countries across Europe including Germany, Italy, and Switzerland, the foreign ministry said Wednesday.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: According to the statement, Peru’s Ministry of Culture and Ministry of Foreign Affairs worked alongside local authorities, consulates and embassies in the countries where the objects were located to bring them back to Peru.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: Peru's foreign minister, Javier González-Olaechea, speaks at a ceremony marking the return of the cultural assets in Lima on Wednesday.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text:
Sebastian Castaneda/Reuters

Of the items returned, 4,556 came from a collection of archaeological material belonging to the late American archaeologist and anthropologist John Rowe, the statement said.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: Another 33 were returned from Italy – 21 of which were previously seized by Italian authorities from an art gallery, the statement continued.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: Among these items were clothing and ceramics from the Nazca, Wari, Inca, Paracas and Chimú cultures, it said.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: A silver incense burner from the 18th or 19th century was returned from Portugal, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said, and other archaeological items were voluntarily returned from Germany and the Netherlands.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: Swiss authorities also seized and repatriated four pieces of pre-Hispanic ceramics, the statement continued.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: Recovered Inca textiles are displayed at the Foreign Ministry in Lima, Peru, Wednesday, March 20, 2024.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text:
Miguel Paredes Haro/AP

“Since 2019, Peru has managed to recover more than 7,000 pieces of its cultural heritage, establishing itself as an international benchmark in the fight against illicit trafficking of cultural property,” Peru’s foreign minister, Javier González-Olaechea, said at a ceremony marking the return of the objects.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text: “We will continue on this upward path in strengthening sovereignty over our precious heritage, because the cultural legacy of Peru is a fundamental pillar for the formation of our identity as Peruvians,” Leslie Urteaga, the country’s culture minister, said, according to a post on the Ministry of Culture’s X account.
Article Title: Peru recovers 4,600 culturally significant items from across US and Europe

text:
CNN —

Celebrated architect Norman Foster has unveiled plans for a new $1-billion office tower in ﻿Los Angeles that will see greenery spilling out from a series of terraces spiraling up its facade.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: The eye-catching proposal, which was formally submitted to city planning authorities this week, will transform a two-acre site on Hollywood’s Sunset Boulevard into a 22-story entertainment industry workplace dubbed The Star.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: Digital impressions of the high-rise, released by the British architect’s firm Foster + Partners on Wednesday, show elevated gardens bursting with plants and trees, as well as outdoor decks and modern office space.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: A digital rendering shows an outdoor deck with views over the Hollywood Hills and the landmark Hollywood sign.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text:
Foster + Partners

In a statement, Foster described it as a “true reflection of the workplace of the future, nurturing community, wellbeing and collaboration.”

Comprised largely of offices and billed as “a modern landmark,” The Star will house entertainment firms and “Hollywood’s top content creators,” said Foster + Partners.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: Current plans include production space, a gallery, a screening theater, a rooftop restaurant and “community gathering spaces” at ground level.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: The proposal, which is set across 525,000 square feet of floor space, replaces an earlier plan for the site unveiled in 2019.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: Designed by MAD Architects, the Chinese firm behind the curvilinear Lucas Museum of Narrative Art (which is set to open in LA next year), the original circular design featured a funicular railway wrapping around the exterior.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: The scheme was reportedly set to cost $500 million, half the price of the new proposal.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: Asked why the tower’s developer, Maggie Gong Miracle, abandoned the original plan, a spokesperson for the project told CNN that Foster’s new design — which is the same height, but thinner than the previous proposal — was intended to be an “asset to the community” that “respected the views” enjoyed by those living in the Hollywood Hills, which overlook the site.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: An aerial view of the terraces set to spiral up through the 22-story tower.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: The announcement comes as LA’s real estate market struggles to recover from the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, Hollywood writers strikes and the growth of remote and hybrid working.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: More than a quarter of the city’s office space — rising to almost 30% in downtown LA — is currently vacant, according to the latest data from property brokerage Savills.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text: Should the city greenlight the proposal, construction on The Star will start by early 2026 and complete in 2029.
Article Title: The Star, LA: Plans for $1-billion Hollywood tower by Norman Foster unveiled

text:
CNN —

Within hours of the Russian invasion in February 2022, Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky invoked martial law across the country, setting in motion an ongoing defence operation and signing a decree to mobilize conscripts.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: With eligible men aged between 18-60 not being allowed to leave Ukraine, news reports were filled with images of mostly women and young children fleeing the country, wrapped in blankets or with grandparents nearby.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Like many of us, in the early days of the war, British photographer Polly Braden’s grasp of what was happening was informed by TV and newspaper coverage.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: In it, she recognized the correlation between what she was witnessing and her own practice.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “I’d made this body of work about single parents (‘Holding the Baby,’ 2022), and seeing these women leaving Ukraine, I thought about everything they were going to have to do to support the children and older people they were bringing with them,” she told CNN in an interview.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Lena telling her mum she was offered a job.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Weeks after those initial reportage images began being shown, Braden flew to Moldova, which shares a border with Ukraine, inspired to work on a new series.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “It felt important to record what was going to happen to these women.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: They were going to have to find housing, schooling, jobs… to build new lives,” she explained.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “It also meant they suddenly became refugees — they might have been teachers, lawyers, important people in their community — what was that going to look like for them?”
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: The project would ultimately become an exhibition called “Leaving Ukraine,” currently on display at the Foundling Museum in London.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “Of course, it’s important we have pictures of the frontline and what’s happening inside Ukraine, but it’s also important we understand what role women play in war, especially this war, where women have given up their status in their country,” continued Braden, reflecting on the traditionally gendered approach to documenting conflict.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
“They are safeguarding the next generation of Ukraine.”

Anya with baby Vavara — seen here at 10 hours old — at the Inflancka No6 Women’s Hospital in Warsaw on May 16, 2022.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Spanning two years (the most recent image was taken in early March 2024) and featuring a mix of still photography and moving image, “Leaving Ukraine” closely follows the stories of six women Braden met when she travelled to Moldova: law graduate Lena, pregnant mother Anya, school friends Sofiia, Aliesia and Yuliia, and Narine who left Ukraine with her children and a close friend.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Conscious of the work’s broader scope, Braden considers “Leaving Ukraine” not just a depiction of these six women and their families, but also as a reflection of the countries they’ve ended up in, which include Italy, Poland and the UK.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: According to the UNHCR’s most recent report, Moldova has received over 850,000 Ukrainian refugees and more than 120,000 third country nationals since February 22, 2022.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Of them, as of November 12, 2023, more than 113,000 have stayed on in the country.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Narine with her son Valentine, 9. Chişinău, Moldova, March 2022.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
Courtesy Polly Braden

“I thought I’d meet people in a country then follow them building a life there, but not one person I met has landed in a country, found their feet and made it work,” she shared.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “They’ve had to move because they can’t find work, there’s no housing, they can’t get their kid to school — or they’ve landed in the countryside in a country they’ve never been to.”
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Braden describes the project as wholly collaborative, detailing her close work with the women to construct an intimate portrait of their new reality (photographing Anya, for example, just hours after she gave birth).
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Many of the images are tender studies of private moments, shot in homes, social spaces and on public transport.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “They’ve been telling their own story really, I’ve just been holding a camera,” she said.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Yulia,16, in Byala, Bulgaria, the day before the family packed up to drive to Warsaw, June 2022.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Lena, who Braden recalled had become irritated speaking to journalists in Moldova, later came to live with her in London.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: The photographer noted how they didn’t take any photos during this period.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “I thought it was quite invasive,” she said, reflecting on the trust they’d developed.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “After all it’s a privilege, (this work).
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: And finding a new life is like a jigsaw, right?”
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Lena has since moved out, meeting a partner and having a baby, and Braden is conscious of how the war has affected her family’s trajectory.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “The child hopefully will speak Ukrainian, but they’re an English family,” she said.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Elsewhere, with two teenagers of her own, the photographer has taken great pleasure in working with the three schoolgirls, one of whom is now studying film in Warsaw and used the project in her coursework.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “The most amazing part about following young people, like Sofiia, Aliesia and Yuliia, is they’re optimistic and full of the joys of life,” she said.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
“Wanting love and all the normal things young people want.”

Narine with her children Nicole (6) and Valentine (9).
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: The family were preparing to leave Regina Pacis, Moldova, with their friend Yuliia looking out for a minibus that will drive them to Italy.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
Courtesy Polly Braden

Initially, Braden had envisioned she’d be able to return to Ukraine with some of the women, but with the war now in its third year, that has not yet been possible.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Ultimately she determined that the series is about building a life away from home, and “finding new paths in Europe.”
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: Similarly, her commitment to just a small group of families, in tandem with her long-term approach, allowed her to harness greater power in her storytelling.
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text: “If we don’t look at individual stories,” she clarified, “then big policies are made without understanding details.”
Article Title: Polly Braden spent two years documenting life for the women forced to leave Ukraine

text:
CNN —

A treasure hunter struggling with faulty equipment has unearthed a gold nugget believed to be the largest ever found in England.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: Richard Brock discovered the gold nugget, weighing 64.8 grams (2.3 ounces), in the country’s Shropshire Hills near the border with Wales, auction house Mullock Jones said Thursday.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: The nugget is around the size of a UK 50 pence coin.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: The find, nicknamed Hiro’s Nugget, has an estimated worth of between £30,000 ($38,000) and £40,000 ($50,700), according to Shropshire-based Mullock Jones, which is handling the sale.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: However, it almost seemed that luck had eluded Brock, whose equipment almost failed him on the day of the dig.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: When Brock arrived at the site in Shropshire in May, he discovered that his metal detector was faulty, according to a press release from Mullock Jones.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: As his hopes dimmed, he turned to a piece of older equipment.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: At first he found only a coin of little value, but within five minutes he made the shocking discovery, the auction house said.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: “It just goes to show that it doesn’t really matter what equipment you use, if you are walking over the find and are alert enough to what might be lurking underneath the soil, that makes all the difference,” Brock said in the release.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: The nugget is considered to be a “rare find,” auctioneer Ben Jones of Mullock Jones told CNN Thursday.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: How it made it to the dig site is a mystery.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: Parts of the Shropshire Hills were once under a prehistoric ocean, and pieces of coral are often unearthed there, according to the auction house.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: “The site does contain an old road/ railway line and has remnants of Welsh stone within,” auctioneer Jones said, adding: “So [there’s] a variety of possibilities of how it made it there.”
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: The auction ends April 1.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: Although Hiro’s Nugget is believed to be the largest discovered so far in England, several previous finds in other parts of the United Kingdom dwarf it in size.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: The record holder is the 121.3-gram [4.3 ounces]
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: Reunion Nugget, found in Scotland in 2019.
Article Title: Man finds ‘England’s largest’ gold nugget, despite metal detector failing

text: Editor’s Note: Peter Bergen is CNN’s national security analyst, a vice president at New America, a professor of practice at Arizona State University and the host of the Audible podcast “In the Room” also on Apple and Spotify.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: He is the author of “The Rise and Fall of Osama bin Laden.”
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: The views expressed in this commentary are his own.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Read more opinion at CNN.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text:
CNN —

If ISIS was indeed responsible for the attack Friday at a Moscow-area concert venue that killed at least 133 people, it would suggest that, unfortunately, the terror group is making something of a comeback.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack; a US official told CNN the US has no reason to doubt it.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Back in its heyday of 2014 and 2015, ISIS had controlled territory in Iraq and Syria around the size of the United Kingdom and a population of millions of people.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: During that period, the group also carried out a number of terrorist plots in Europe, including an attack in Paris that killed 130 people in 2015.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: ISIS had also inspired terrorists in the US, including the gunman who killed 49 people at the Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida, in 2016 in what was then the most lethal terrorist attack in the US since 9/11.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: But between 2017 and 2018, ISIS lost its so-called geographical “caliphate” in Iraq and Syria, and it has since devolved into a loosely allied group of ISIS affiliates in Africa and Asia with seemingly scant capabilities to carry out large-scale attacks elsewhere.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: One of the most virulent affiliates is ISIS-K in Afghanistan, which killed 13 American service members and some 170 Afghan civilians at Kabul Airport as the Biden administration pulled all US troops from Afghanistan in August 2021.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Yet, the understanding at the time was that ISIS affiliates in Afghanistan and certain African countries like the Democratic Republic of Congo or Somalia were not capable of carrying out major international attacks.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: But then came a large-scale terrorist attack in Iran in January that killed 84 people at a memorial service commemorating General Qasem Soleimani, one of the most powerful military leaders in Iran who had been killed by a US drone strike in 2020.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Through that attack, ISIS-K showed that the group, which is very anti-Shia, could target a hostile state like predominantly Shia Iran.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: In March alone, a Russian state news agency said the country had thwarted multiple ISIS-related incidents, including a plan to attack a synagogue in Moscow.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: The US embassy in Russia also said on March 7 that it was “monitoring reports that extremists have imminent plans to target large gatherings in Moscow,” including concerts.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: According to a US National Security Council spokesperson, “The US Government also shared this information with Russian authorities in accordance with its longstanding ‘duty to warn’ policy.”
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text:
But Russian President Vladimir Putin dismissed the US’ warning as “provocative,” saying, “These actions resemble outright blackmail and the intention to intimidate and destabilize our society.”

Taken together, the fact that Russian authorities had detected a number of ISIS-related plots earlier this month and that US authorities were warning of an attack at the same time indicates that there was an active terrorist threat in Moscow from ISIS that was known not only to the US but also to the Russians.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: But Russian President Vladimir Putin linked the suspects in Friday’s attack to Ukraine during a five-minute address on Saturday.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: State news agencies said that authorities arrested the four men suspected of attacking the Moscow-area concert venue while they were trying to cross the border into Ukraine, and that they “had relevant contacts on the Ukrainian side,” according to the FSB.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Ukraine has emphatically denied any role in the attack, and both Ukrainian and American officials expressed concerns that Putin’s comments may be used to justify an escalation in the ongoing war.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: ISIS-K certainly has the capability and motive to attack Russia.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: When it comes to motive, the Russian support for the Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad, which helped him remain in power during the Syrian civil war, certainly comes to mind.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: For ISIS, Assad is a mortal enemy, both because he is a member of a Shia sect and because he has systematically killed Sunnis in Syria.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Also, historically, Russia has brutally repressed Muslim minorities like the Chechens.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: As for capability, the ISIS-K attack in Iran earlier this year demonstrated that the group could carry out a large-scale attack outside of its home base in Afghanistan.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: What we do know is that Putin made a glaring mistake by denouncing the US’ warning.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: And if ISIS-K did attack the concert hall, the Biden administration would have to ask itself some serious questions about whether the decision to pull all American troops out of Afghanistan allowed ISIS to regroup there with the capability to carry out large-scale attacks in other countries.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: If that were the case, that would be a blow for the Biden administration.
Article Title: Opinion: ISIS is making a comeback

text: Editor’s Note: Sara Stewart is a film and culture writer who lives in western Pennsylvania.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: The views expressed here are her own.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: View more opinion on CNN.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text:
CNN —

As news that Catherine, Princess of Wales had announced her cancer diagnosis dominated headlines Friday, I felt a deep and traumatic solidarity.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: Recovering from major abdominal surgery — as Kate has been since January — is ghastly, and having to do it so you can be healthy enough for chemotherapy is a humbling one-two punch from the universe.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: For Kate, that’s topped off by having to endure it all while the entire world chases you down like a fox on one of those hunts the royals are always throwing.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text:
Sara Stewart Todd Thompson

Kate has not yet disclosed specifically what kind of cancer she has.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: An oncologist told Today.com that it could be colon, stomach, genital or urinary cancer.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: We know that rates of colon cancer diagnoses in particular are going up alarmingly in younger populations.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: I was 45 when I received my diagnosis of stage 3 colon cancer, and, like Kate, underwent major abdominal surgery followed by chemo.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: I was told by countless doctors and nurses that they were seeing an upsetting uptick in younger patients like me.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: One of the first things health care providers recommend to aid your recovery from surgery is reducing your stress.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: I truly cannot imagine trying to deal with the indignities of post-surgical recovery — such as, in my case not being able to walk even a single block unassisted for weeks, or being incontinent when you used to be a normal healthy person — on top of the relentless scrutiny Kate’s been under since that unnecessary photoshopped image.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: But I do know this: She is in a unique position to be a much-needed voice for people around the world dealing with cancer at a young age.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: As a survivor of a gastrointestinal cancer, whose sufferers face much greater stigma than other types of cancer, I feel this most acutely.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: Kate is someone with a global public profile whose voice can truly make a difference in, for example, advocating for younger people to get colonoscopies and other cancer screenings.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: For the development of blood tests to detect gastrointestinal and other hard-to-detect cancers.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: And for health care providers to get on board with more modern practices, like the study that just found it’s unnecessary for people to starve themselves on a liquid diet the day before a colonoscopy.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: I just celebrated my five-year cancerversary, which is to say I’ve been cancer-free since I finished a course of chemotherapy in February 2019.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: People ask me how I’m feeling now, and when I answer, I make sure to throw in details like “I’m definitely going to be advocating for more public restroom access from now on!”
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: and “My digestive system will never be the same, but I’m happy to be alive!”
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: Maybe this makes me a Debbie Downer, but I’m fine with risking that to call attention to the fact that colon cancer survivors are often dealing with a very different version of “healthy” than the world might prefer to think about.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: Depending on the nature of her abdominal surgery, Kate might have been assigned a short-term or a permanent colostomy bag.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: If she was lucky enough not to, she’s very likely dealing with all kinds of abdominal distress nonetheless.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: And although I cannot stress enough that she owes absolutely nothing to the public while she goes through treatment, my fervent hope is that once she’s on the other side of it she’ll become a powerful voice advocating for more ways of early testing and destigmatization.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: Having cancer is not elegant.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: It is not sophisticated.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: I’m sure it’s the kind of thing
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: the royal family would rather never, ever think about.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: But it’s landed squarely in their midst regardless, so this is Kate’s chance to make a real difference in the health outcomes of countless people around the world.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: Here’s to a speedy and minimally awful course of chemotherapy, Kate.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

text: If you ever want to swap caustic bathroom humor with a fellow survivor, you’re always welcome to come sit next to me.
Article Title: Opinion: As a cancer survivor, I feel for Kate Middleton

Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: We’re looking back at the strongest, smartest opinion takes of the week from CNN and other outlets.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text:
CNN —

In Charles Dickens’ 1850 novel “David Copperfield,” the perpetually indebted Mr. Micawber notes that all he can offer his young lodger is this advice: “Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure nineteen nineteen six, result happiness.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: By contrast, “Annual income twenty pounds, annual expenditure twenty pounds ought and six, result misery.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: In that case, “the blossom is blighted, the leaf is withered,” Micawber says, “and in short you are forever floored.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Like Dickens’ own father who gave him the same advice in real life, Micawber is dragged off to debtors’ prison, but he never loses his optimism that “something will turn up.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Something may turn up for former President Donald Trump.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: He faces a Monday deadline to post a $464 million bond that would prevent New York Attorney General Letitia James from attempting to seize his assets while he appeals the judgment imposed on him, his sons and his companies in the civil fraud case.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Trump can hope that he’ll succeed in an appeal to reduce the size of the bond, or that somehow the $3 billion he may reap from a public offering of his Truth Social platform can improve his situation, even though his stake is locked up for six months.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: And, in a post on Truth Social, he boasted of having nearly half a billion in ready cash to put to work in his presidential campaign, while his lawyers insist he can’t post the bond.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Debtors’ prisons are a thing of the past, but the cold hard reality of finance isn’t — if your cash going out exceeds what’s coming in, you have to borrow money, or sell something.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Money has always been integral to the Trump brand, starting decades before he played a billionaire on “The Apprentice.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Trump’s 1987 bestseller “The Art of the Deal”, written with Tony Schwartz, begins, “I don’t do it for the money.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: I’ve got enough, much more than I’ll ever need.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: … Deals are my art form.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Having a lot of money distinguished him from other presidential candidates, Trump contended.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: “Boasting, as he always has, of being fabulously rich, he told the 2016 voters that his campaign, unlike that of his rival, was completely self-funded,” Frida Ghitis wrote.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: “That wasn’t true, of course, but his argument was actually correct.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Nobody would control him, he claimed, because those who give you money expect something in return.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: ‘I don’t need anybody’s money,’ Trump said in his June 2015 presidential campaign announcement.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: “Now Trump needs money, a lot of it.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text:
What would his creditors or benefactors want in return?…

Dana Summers/Tribune Content Agency

“In addition to nearly half a billion dollars in judgments, Trump faces massive legal fees over multiple civil and criminal cases, and his presidential campaign funds, drained after funding his personal legal costs, are badly lagging behind President Joe Biden’s massive war chest.”

“Anyone who thinks America’s foes are not paying attention to what could become an entry gate for a Trojan Horse is suffering from wishful thinking.”

Get our free weekly newsletter Sign up for CNN Opinion’s newsletter.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text:
Join us on Twitter and Facebook

As Julian Zelizer noted, “The problem for Trump is that as his legal expenses and obligations are piling up, his fundraising efforts have been lagging.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: His leadership political action committee, Save America, spent nearly $5.6 million in legal fees in February alone.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: And while the super PAC Maga Inc. has refunded nearly all of that money, that’s money that could have been used for Trump’s campaign.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: “It doesn’t help that there is a growing fundraising gap between Trump and Biden.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Right now, President Biden’s campaign coffers are overflowing.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: … In a campaign where a relatively small percentage of swing voters in a handful of states will likely determine the outcome, turnout and advertising buys will have an outsized impact.
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text: Biden’s financial strength has allowed his campaign to unleash a torrent of blistering ads in swing states, targeting core voters such as Latinos.”
Article Title: Opinion: Trump’s image is on the line

text:
Bill Bramhall/Tribune Content Agency

Trump faces trial in a New York courtroom next month over a $130,000 “hush money” payment to adult film actress Stormy Daniels before the 2016 election.

Donald Trump’s first criminal trial was supposed to begin Monday.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Instead, his lawyers will get the chance to argue for a lengthy postponement and even a dismissal of the charges.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Judge Juan Merchan is holding a pre-trial hearing in New York on Monday to discuss the discovery issues that led to the delay of the trial on charges brought by the Manhattan district attorney related to hush money payments until at least the middle of next month.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Trump is charged with 34 counts of falsifying business documents related to the repayment of Michael Cohen for hush-money payments made before the 2016 election to cover up an alleged affair with adult film star Stormy Daniels.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Trump has pleaded not guilty and denied the affair.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: If the trial starts in April, it would be the first of Trump’s four criminal trials to begin – and potentially the only one that would occur before the November election.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text:
Here’s what to know:

What happened?
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: The trial was postponed and Monday’s hearing was ordered after more than 100,000 new documents were turned over by the US Attorney for the Southern District of New York, related to the 2018 prosecution of Trump’s former lawyer Cohen, who is a key witness in the case.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Trump’s lawyers say the new information is potentially exculpatory for the former president and they need at least 90 days to properly review the new material – a delay that fits with the former president’s overall efforts to delay all four criminal trials he’s facing until after the November election.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Merchan said the trial postponement would be 30 days from the date of his letter, March 15, meaning the earliest the trial could start is April 15.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: The judge made clear that the hearing would only focus on the document production from the Southern District of New York, and not other issues such as the complaint from Trump’s lawyers that a new documentary about Daniels was intended to be released close to the start of trial to prejudice the jury pool.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: What are the documents?
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: The documents in question relate to the 2018 federal investigation into Cohen that led to charges on campaign finance violations and tax evasion.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: The bulk of the documents include records relied upon to obtain search warrants for Cohen’s devices and homes, including bank records.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: The US attorney’s office also turned over 30,000 pages related to documents seized from five iPhones and email accounts associated with Cohen.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: In addition, prosecutors said the US attorney’s office turned over FBI interview notes from special counsel Robert Mueller’s interviews with Cohen, which the office only received in December as a result of Freedom of Information Act litigation.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: In all, more than 200,000 pages of records this month were handed over.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Why were the documents turned over so late?
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Trump’s attorneys and prosecutors are pointing fingers at one another over the reason the US attorney’s office did not turn over tens of thousands of documents until this month.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Trump’s team alleged that the district attorney was trying to hide exculpatory evidence ahead of the trial, and that the US attorney’s office only turned it over following a January subpoena from Trump’s attorneys.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: But the district attorney says that Trump’s attorneys are to blame for the delay.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Prosecutors argue that Trump’s attorneys raised no issues with the document production made in July 2023 until six months later with the January subpoena.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: “The belated nature of the recent productions is entirely a result of defendant’s own inexplicable and strategic delay in identifying perceived deficiencies in the People’s disclosures and pursuing independent means to obtain that evidence,” prosecutors wrote in a filing.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: What happens next?
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: The effort to dismiss the indictment is likely a long shot – Merchan has already rejected previous motions for dismissal.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: But the judge could signal on Monday whether he thinks the delay he put in place is long enough to go through the new documents – and whether he might block any testimony.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: Merchan, has already ruled that he would allow testimony from Cohen, rejecting a motion from Trump to prevent him from testifying because of credibility problems.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: And, he said Daniels could testify finding that she is part of the timeline.
Article Title: Trump’s hush money trial was set to begin Monday. Here’s what’s happening instead

text: A trial is expected to last six weeks, meaning Trump would be in the courtroom four days a week while it’s ongoing (the court will not meet on Wednesdays).
