Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Our eight-part guide shows you a delicious expert-backed eating lifestyle that will boost your health for life.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
CNN —

Approximately 95% of nonorganic strawberries, leafy greens such as spinach and kale, collard and mustard greens, grapes, peaches and pears tested by the United States government contained detectable levels of pesticides, according to the 2024 Shopper’s Guide to Pesticides in Produce.

Nectarines, apples, bell and hot peppers, cherries, blueberries and green beans rounded out the list of the 12 most contaminated samples of produce.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: It’s dubbed the “Dirty Dozen” by the Environmental Working Group, or EWG, an environmental and health advocacy organization that has produced the annual report since 2004.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Pesticides have been linked in studies to preterm births, congenital malformations such as neural tube defects, spontaneous abortions and an increase in genetic damage in humans.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Exposure to pesticides has also been associated with lower sperm concentrations, heart disease, cancer and other disorders.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Farmworkers who use or are exposed to pesticides are at highest risk, according to studies.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: A 2022 meta-analysis found workers exposed to pesticides were nearly five times as likely to have DNA damage while a February study found children exposed at an early age showed poorer neurodevelopment from infancy to adolescence.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: It’s not all bad news.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Avocados, sweet corn, pineapples, onions and papayas led the “Clean Fifteen” list of conventionally grown produce with the least amount of trace pesticides — nearly 65% of the fruits and veggies in that grouping had no detectable pesticide residues, according to the report released Wednesday.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Rounding out the “Clean Fifteen” were frozen sweet peas, asparagus, honeydew melons, kiwis, cabbage, watermelons, mushrooms, mangoes, sweet potatoes and carrots.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Crops which grow close to the ground, such as strawberries, spinach and other leafy greens are particularly subject to pests.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
Ekaterina Goncharova/Moment RF/Getty Images

Washed, peeled and scrubbed

Each year, a rotating list of domestic and imported produce is tested by US Department of Agriculture and US Food and Drug Administration.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Staffers at the USDA Pesticide Data Program wash, peel and scrub fruits and vegetables as consumers would, while workers at the FDA only brush dirt off the produce.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Then the fruits and vegetables are tested for more than 250 different pesticides and the results are posted online.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: For 2024, EWG researchers examined testing data on 47,510 samples of 46 nonorganic fruits and vegetables, with the majority of testing from the USDA.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: An analysis of that data found traces of 254 pesticides in all fruits and vegetables analyzed, with 209 of those chemicals on produce in the “Dirty Dozen” list.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “We find that what ends up on one list versus the other reflects how those fruits and vegetables are grown,” said Alexis Temkin, EWG’s senior toxicologist.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “Avocados, for example, aren’t pesticide intensive, while strawberries grow very close to the ground and have a lot of pests.”
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
Report is unfair to farmers, critics say

About 70% of nonorganic produce tested by the USDA and FDA have pesticide levels within the legal limits allowed by the US Environmental Protection Agency, according to the EWG report.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: That fact makes the report misleading, said Carl Winter, emeritus professor of cooperative extension at the University of California, Davis.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “The dose makes the poison, not its presence or its absence, and that dose determines the potential for harm.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: In many cases you’d have to be exposed to a million times more than what we’re exposed to before you’d even see any effects,” said Winter, speaking on behalf of the Alliance on Food and Farming, which represents organic and conventional farmers.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: She pointed to times when regulators allowed potentially dangerous chemicals, such as the pesticide DCPA, to remain on the market long after scientific research had raised concerns.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: The herbicide was linked to thyroid concerns for years before the EPA told the public the chemical posed “significant risks to human health” in 2023.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Another example: chlorpyrifos, a pesticide linked to brain damage in children and fetuses.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: The American Academy of Pediatrics joined EWG in 2017 protesting the EPA’s continued approval of the chemical.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: In addition, pesticides banned by the government continue to show up on crops sold in the US, according to the EWG report.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “Green beans for example, continue to show traces of acephate, a toxic pesticide the EPA banned for use on green beans more than 10 years ago,” Temkin said.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “A lot of pesticides found on the ‘Dirty Dozen’ have also been banned in the European Union because of their harmful effects on human health.”
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
Another concern from critics is that the “Dirty Dozen” list is insulting to multigenerational farmers who struggle to grow food for the nation and feed those same products to their own children, said Steve Clement, CEO of Pacific Northwest Tree Fruit

“When this report comes out it’s like getting stabbed a little bit because we’re working so hard to put out a nice healthy product, and the implication of the ‘Dirty Dozen’ list is that it is unhealthy,” Clement said.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “It’s like doing something kind for somebody and then having them turn around and call you some sort of monster.”
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: The report may scare people away from eating the fruits and vegetables they need, said Neil Nagata, whose family has grown organic and conventional strawberries in Oceanside, California, for decades.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “Every time the report comes out, or there’s a scare on imported strawberries, we see our sales drop off,” Nagata said.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “It’s not as if we’re doing something that is wrong or incorrect, we’re actually producing very healthy, safe food.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: In fact, we actually live in the strawberry field and my father is 100 and my mom is 97, and they still eat strawberries.”
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Some farmers feel the term "Dirty Dozen" is insulting, according to the Alliance on Food and Farming.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
kcline/iStockphoto/Getty Images

It is important that people eat lots of fruits and vegetables, even conventionally grown, said EWG’s Temkin.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “We always emphasize that,” she said.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “We want to enable consumers who wish to avoid as many pesticides as possible by opting for organic versions of the ‘Dirty Dozen,’ where pesticide levels will be lower, and then, if they wish, choose less expensive conventionally grown produce from the ‘Clean Fifteen.’
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
”

Organic produce is not more nutritious, but studies have found that levels of pesticides in the urine of adults and children can drop up to 95% after a switch to an organic diet.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
Fungicide levels were high

For the first time, EWG analysts looked at reported levels of fungicides, one form of pesticide used to kill fungal diseases such as powdery mildew.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “Four out of five of the most frequently found pesticides on the ‘Dirty Dozen’ list were fungicides, and they were also found in particularly high concentrations,” Temkin said.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Two fungicides — fludioxonil and pyrimethanil — had the highest concentration on the “Dirty Dozen” list of any other pesticide, according to the report.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Fludioxonil was found on 90% of peaches and nearly 30% of all “Dirty Dozen” samples, according to the report.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Pyrimethanil was found on 65% of pear, 30% of apple, 27% of grape, 26% of strawberry and 24% of nectarine samples.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “Fungicides are often applied after harvest to keep produce mold-free on its way to market.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: That’s likely why the concentrations were so high on some samples – higher than other pesticides applied earlier in the growing season,” Temkin said.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: “The application of the fungicide is also closer to the time the produce is put on store shelves and consumers are eating them.”
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Fludioxonil creates a waxy coating on the fruit or vegetable that studies find is difficult to wash away.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: While the EPA finds fludioxonil safe at regulated levels, some studies have raised concerns that it might disrupt hormone and neurological systems.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Exposing breast cancer cells to fludioxonil in a petri dish found the fungicide increased cell production by 1.5%.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Pyrimethanil was classified as a “possible human carcinogen” by the EPA in 2004, but the agency determined in 2015 the chemical was “not likely to be carcinogenic to humans” at low doses.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Studies have shown it to be toxic to tree frogs and aquatic life, and it may disrupt thyroid levels in pregnant women living in agricultural areas.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: In lab tests, pyrimethanil and fludioxonil were show to impact androgen activity — hormones that contribute to growth and reproduction in both men and women.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text:
Ways to reduce pesticides in your food

Cleaning fruits and vegetables before eating does reduce pesticide levels, but “no washing method is 100% effective for removing all pesticide residues,” according to the National Pesticide Information Center.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Starting with clean hands, wash and rub produce under running water instead of soaking to remove the most pesticide, the center recommends on its website.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Don’t use soap, detergent or a commercial soak or scrub, however, as they have not been proven to be any more effective, according to the FDA.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

text: Dry the produce with a clean cloth or paper towel to further reduce bacteria that may be present.
Article Title: ‘Dirty Dozen’ 2024 list of foods with most pesticides

Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Explore the universe with news on fascinating discoveries, scientific advancements and more.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text:
CNN —

Paleontologists with the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History have discovered a previously unknown prehistoric species — a 270 million-year-old amphibian with wide eyes and a cartoonish grin — and its name is a nod to an iconic froggy celebrity.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Kermit the Frog meet Kermitops gratus, the most recent ancient amphibian to be identified after examination of a tiny fossilized skull that once sat unstudied in the Smithsonian fossil collection for 40 years, according to a paper published Thursday in the Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Predating the dinosaurs, Kermitops is believed to have roamed the lower Clear Fork Formation of Texas during the Early Permian Epoch 298.9 million to 272.3 million years ago.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The skull of the ancient amphibian, measuring just over an inch (about 2.5 centimeters) long, features big oval eye sockets and — due to its slightly crushed state — a lopsided smile that researchers said reminded them of the Muppet icon.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The researchers believe the small opening at the tip of the critter's snout, the internarial fontanelle, held a mucus gland that would aid in catching insects.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The palpebral ossicles were small boney shingles embedded within the eyelid to protect the eye.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text:
Brittany M. Hance/Smithsonian/CNN

The discovery of the new amphibian species could provide some answers to how frogs and salamanders evolved to get their special characteristics today, the authors wrote in the paper.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “One thing that Kermitops really shows is that the origins of modern amphibians are a little more complex than some of the research has led on,” said study coauthor Arjan Mann, a postdoctoral paleontologist at the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “And that really means that people need to keep studying these things because just looking at museum collections, like this fossil, has the potential to change our ideas of evolutionary hypotheses of living lineages.”
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Kermitops, not a frog
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The fossil was first uncovered in 1984 by the late Nicholas Hotton III, a museum paleontologist who had excavated fossils from the Red Beds in Texas, an area known to be rich in Permian-age remains.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Researchers unearthed a large cache at the site, including the remains of ancient reptiles, amphibians and synapsids, the precursors to mammals.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The resulting collection included so many finds, paleontologists could not study a number of the specimens, including the newly named Kermitops.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: That changed in 2021, when the skull caught the eye of Mann, a postdoctoral fellow at the time, who was sifting through the Texas collection to see whether any notable specimens had been overlooked.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Authors of the new paper, Calvin So (left) and Arjan Mann (right), named the prehistoric amphibian after Kermit the Frog.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The Muppet icon is photographed in the Entertainment Nation exhibition at Smithsonian's National Museum of American History.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text:
James D. Tiller/James D. Loreto/Courtesy National Museum of Natural History Smithsonian

“Not only was (the skull) well-prepared by somebody, but it had features that distinguished it from anything else in the group that I’d ever seen,” Mann said.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: In early 2023, Calvin So, lead author of the new paper and a doctoral student at George Washington University, began to study the skull for a doctoral paper.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: Kermitops is not classified as a frog because the prehistoric amphibian does not share all the same traits and anatomy found in modern frogs, So said.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: But the researchers determined the specimen is from the group temnospondyls, which are believed to be the most common ancestor of all lissamphibians — a category that includes frogs, salamanders and caecilians, Mann added.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The researchers noted several features that the ancient amphibian shares with its modern-day relatives, including a similar location for the eardrum at the back of the skull, a small opening between the nostrils that produces a sticky mucus to help frogs catch their prey, and even evidence of bicuspid, pedicellate teeth that are unique to amphibians and are found in most modern amphibian species.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text:
Features of the ancient amphibian

The presence of teeth and other modern features of this prehistoric species can help researchers to better understand the evolutionary transition amphibians went through to get their unique features, such as teeth, today.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: A June 2021 study found that some species of frogs have lost and again evolved teeth several times throughout their lineages.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “This work is significant because it provides yet one more distinct early distant relative of our modern amphibians,” said David Blackburn, a coauthor of that 2021 study and a curator of amphibians and reptiles at the Florida Museum of Natural History at the University of Florida, via email.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “The last 20 to 30 years has seen many new species discovered and described of these distant relatives, and each discovery tends to reshape our knowledge of the evolutionary tree,” Blackburn added.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: But Kermitops had many features distinct from its modern relatives.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The critter’s robust skull had additional bones and elements that have likely disappeared with evolution, and its elongated snout paired with a short region of the skull behind the eyes was unique to the species, most likely serving to aid in catching insects.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The fossil’s features, a mix of modern and prehistoric traits, reinforces previous suggestions that amphibians’ evolution was complex, said Marc Jones, a curator of fossil reptiles at the Natural History Museum London.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “It further adds to the diversity of Early Permian animals that are likely the evolutionary cousins of modern amphibians.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: It highlights the need for more fossils from the Late Permian,” Jones said via email, adding he appreciated the amphibian’s name.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “It’s not a frog but then technically neither is Kermit.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: He has five fingers and a lizard frill.”
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text:
The preservation of small fossils

The early fossil record for lissamphibians is considered to be fragmentary, according to a news release from the Smithsonian Institution, and is largely due to the creatures’ small size and delicate bone composition, which make the fossils difficult to preserve and find later, So said.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “What we see today is but a small percentage of all the things that were living in Earth’s history,” So added.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “And one of the conditions that significantly improves fossil preservation is their size, because if it’s larger, it’s going to be more resistant to some of the erosional forces that we experience such as wind erosion and water erosion.”
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: What’s more, while prehistoric species are typically thought to be large, Kermitops could help to fill in the gap of amphibian evolution, explaining how some of today’s critters got their small size.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: The skull of Kermitops is of similar size to the skull of another well-known Early Permian amphibian, Gerobatrachus, which had a head about an inch in length (2.5 centimeters).
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: But many frogs today have bodies shorter than that length, Blackburn said.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “You might wonder, ‘Were there really no very tiny vertebrates in the past, similar in size to miniature species today?’
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: My bet is that yes, they existed, but our ability to find them in the fossil record is very difficult,” Blackburn added.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: So said they hoped the species’ name would draw attention to the notable discoveries that paleontologists make through studying museum collections of prehistoric fossils — including those less imposing than dinosaurs.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

text: “We wanted to name it Kermitops because we wanted to bring attention to this unique fossil that’s really small, that most people would not notice if you were to put it next to a Tyrannosaurus in the gallery,” So said.
Article Title: Kermitops: Newly identified fossil named for Kermit the Frog could help solve evolutionary puzzle

Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Explore the universe with news on fascinating discoveries, scientific advancements and more.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text:
CNN —

About 74,000 years ago, Sumatra’s Mount Toba experienced a super-eruption, one of the largest in Earth’s history, potentially kicking off a massive disruption in the world’s climate.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Some scientists have suspected a volcanic winter resulting from the eruption was a big enough shift to wipe out most early humans due to genetic evidence suggesting a steep drop in the human population.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: But now a cutting-edge study on an archaeological site in northwest Ethiopia once occupied by early modern humans has added to a growing body of evidence that suggests the event might not have been so apocalyptic.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Instead, the new research found humans in that location, known as Shinfa-Metema 1, adapted to the arid conditions brought on by the volcanic eruption in a way that may have facilitated humanity’s pivotal migration out of Africa to the rest of the world.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Microscopic fragments of volcanic glass found alongside stone tools and animal remains in the same layer of sediment at the Shinfa-Metema 1 site, near Ethiopia’s Shinfa River, show humans were occupying the site before and after the volcano erupted more than 4,000 miles away.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “These fragments are less than the diameter of a human hair.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Even as tiny as (that) they are still big enough to analyze the chemistry and the trace elements,” said John Kappelman, a professor of anthropology and geological science at the University of Texas at Austin and lead author of the study, which published Wednesday in the journal Nature.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: By piecing together clues from the fossils and artifacts found at the site, along with geological and molecular analysis, the team began to understand how the humans living there forged ahead despite the likely climate shift that the volcanic cataclysm triggered.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Excavations at the Shinfa-Metema 1 site have revealed that a population of humans survived the eruption of the Mount Toba supervolcano 74,000 years ago.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text:
John Kappelman and Marsha Miller

Catching fish

To understand the climate around the time of the eruption, Kappelman and his colleagues analyzed oxygen and carbon isotopes, variations of the same element, from ostrich eggshells and fossilized mammal teeth.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: That work shed light on water intake and revealed the animals ate plants that were more likely to grow in drier conditions.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “The isotopes are incorporated in the hard tissues.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: So for the mammals, we look at their teeth, the enamel of their teeth, but we also find it in the eggshell of the ostrich,” he said.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: An analysis of the site’s flora and fauna also found an abundance of fish remains in the aftermath of the eruption.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: The finding is perhaps not surprising given how near the site was to the river, but fish are rare in other Stone Age sites from the same period, the study noted.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “People start to increase the percentage of fish in the diet when Toba comes in.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: They’re capturing and processing almost four times as much fish (as before the eruption),” he said.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “We think the reason for that is because if Toba is in fact, creating more aridity, that means it’s going to be a shorter wet season, which means longer dry season.”
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: The team theorized that the drier climate, counterintuitively, explains the increased reliance on fish:
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: As the river shrank, fish were trapped in water holes or shallower streams that hunters could more easily target.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text:
Blue vs. green corridor

The fish-rich water holes may have potentially created what the team described as a “blue corridor,” along which early humans moved north out of Africa once they were depleted of fish.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: This theory contradicts most other models that suggest that humanity’s main migration out of Africa took place along “green corridors” during humid periods.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “This study … demonstrates the great plasticity of Homo sapiens populations and their ability to adapt easily to any type of environment, whether hyper-humid or hyper-arid, including during catastrophic events such as the hyper-explosion of the Toba volcano,” said Ludovic Slimak, a researcher at the French National Centre for Scientific Research and the University of Toulouse, in an email.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Slimak was not involved in the research.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: The study authors were also able to explore the geology of the ancient riverbed, which suggested that it flowed slower and lower at that point than in the present.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “We can do that by just looking at the cobbles,” Kappelman said.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “A very energetic river can move bigger boulders and cobbles than a river that isn’t that (energetic.)
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: What (cobbles) we find for the ancestor river are smaller than the river today.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: The excavation team was able to build a detailed picture of what happened at the site in Ethiopia around 74,000 years ago.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text:
Lawrence C. Todd

Oldest known arrowheads?
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: The researchers also uncovered the remains of several small triangular points, which tantalizingly rank among the earliest examples of the use of archery and provide clues that the site’s inhabitants might have used bows and arrows to hunt fish and other larger prey.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Slimak, who has studied similar points discovered in France that date back 50,000 years, agreed with the new study’s assessment of the artifacts.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “The authors also highlight very clear indicators suggesting the existence of archery here 74,000 years ago,” Slimak said.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “There is therefore every reason to … consider these ancient Homo sapiens as bearers of already highly advanced technologies, largely emancipated from natural and climatic constraints, crucial factors for understanding their migrations later on, across all continents and under all latitudes.”
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: Ancient species of humans likely left Africa multiple times, but archaeologists and geneticists largely agree that the most significant dispersal of Homo sapiens, our own species — which ultimately led to modern humans living in every corner of the globe — took place around 70,000 to 50,000 years ago.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: The new research offers another potential scenario for how this dispersal happened while not ruling out previous theories, said Chris Stringer, a professor and research leader in human evolution at the Natural History Museum in London, who called it an “intriguing paper.”
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “I’m sure each of these propositions will fuel debate amongst the relevant specialists but I think the authors have made a plausible (though not definitive) case for each scenario they propose,” Stringer said via email.
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

text: “Of course this new work doesn’t mean that humid corridors were not still important conduits for dispersals out of Africa, but this work adds credible additional possibilities during more arid phases.”
Article Title: Mount Toba: One of the largest eruptions in Earth’s history could have wiped out humans

Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: To get it in your inbox, sign up for free, here.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text:
New York CNN —

The Justice Department’s lawsuit against Apple wants to break the company’s notoriously tight grip on the iPhone, the device that’s made it one of the biggest and most profitable companies on the planet.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: But regardless of what happens in court, the case is already shining a light on the two faces of Apple: the cool, high-end tech brand that customers adore; and the ruthless, unavoidable behemoth that developers loathe.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Here’s the deal: The Feds say Apple is maintaining a monopoly that stifles competition, deprives consumers of choice and ultimately forces them to pay more.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Apple’s response to the allegations is, more or less, a)
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: no we don’t, and b) good luck proving customer harm when everybody loves us.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: And that’s where this Goliath versus Goliath battle gets interesting.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Customers really like Apple.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: We love the phones, the watches, the laptops and the AirPods that ensure we never have to be alone with our thoughts (unless, heaven help you, you forgot to charge them).
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Heck, I’m typing this article on an Apple keyboard connected to a MacBook connected to iCloud, and I would throw a fit if I had to switch to a PC.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text:
Apple even nodded to this in its widely circulated statement to the media Thursday:

“We innovate every day to make technology people love – designing products that work seamlessly together, protect people’s privacy and security, and create a magical experience for our users.”
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: The company added: “This lawsuit threatens who we are and the principles that set Apple products apart in fiercely competitive markets.”
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: And it’s true — the gods saw fit to get Steve Jobs and Jony Ive (the revered product designer behind Apple’s biggest hits) in the same room at the same time, and the world was never the same.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Their products married good design and good software.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: They were never cheap, but they were shiny, user-friendly, simply beautiful.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: With help from the best marketing team in Silicon Valley history, Apple became a tech icon with a billion devotees.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: The darker side of Apple
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: But on the business side, Apple is not so beloved.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: The company has a reputation for quashing competition and squeezing developers with exorbitant fees.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Many smaller tech companies hate Apple as much as they live in fear of its lawyers.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: “Apple has this practice of seeing what others innovate for the phone, copying it, and then making it so that those others can’t compete,” Adam Wolfson, an antitrust lawyer with the firm Quinn Emanuel, told me.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: (There’s even an industry term for when Apple appropriates a third party’s tech, called “Sherlocking” — a nod to one of Apple’s search products that rendered its non-Apple rival, Watson, redundant.)
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: “They very much have an approach to being about as sharp-elbowed as you can possibly get,” said Wolfson, who has represented clients in Apple disputes.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: “Apple is extraordinarily litigious, and will fight to the very last breath, because it can.”
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: The DOJ lawsuit argues Apple has illegally monopolized smartphone markets by blocking innovative new apps and services.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: If you’re an iPhone user and you’ve ever been in a text thread with someone using an Android device, you know the green-bubble problem and how annoying it is.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: It’s not as if Apple can’t make that experience better, according to the DOJ — it just doesn’t want to, because it’s better for Apple if its users see Android as a social faux pas.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: It’s tech tribalism, and Apple is a master at cultivating loyalty.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: The green bubble issue is just one of several ways Apple is abusing its dominant position, according to the lawsuit.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: (My colleague David Goldman has more on that here.)
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: If it succeeds, the Justice Department could force Apple to loosen some of the restrictions it has placed on its “walled garden” approach, which Apple says is meant to create a seamless experience for users and keep them relatively safe from viruses.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: That is a concern for investors, says Gene Muster, managing partner at Deepwater Asset Management, because the lawsuit goes after “the juiciest part of their business.”
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: But Muster doesn’t expect the lawsuit to be a body blow for the company, and believes “people will still gravitate to Apple products.”
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Indeed, customer satisfaction is, paradoxically, a tricky issue for the DOJ as well.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: People are pretty content with their iPhones.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Could we be more content with more competition?
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: The DOJ will have their work cut out for them trying to prove it.
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text: Ultimately, Wolfson said, “the law wants to make sure that consumers are getting the absolute best, not just what Apple decides we want.”
Article Title: Apple customers love Apple. The Biden administration thinks they could do better

text:
CNN —

A federal judge has dismissed a criminal indictment against seven Twitter users and a podcaster accused of running a $100 million stock manipulation scheme over social media.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The Justice Department did not do enough to describe the influencers’ activities as a “scheme to defraud,” wrote District Judge Andrew Hanen of the US District Court for the Southern District of Texas, in an order dated Wednesday.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: In the indictment, the DOJ had alleged a lucrative “pump and dump” scheme in which the social media influencers used the messaging app Discord to promote certain stocks to their followers before selling their positions after a run-up in the stocks’ prices.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The result was an alleged conspiracy by defendants “to unlawfully enrich themselves by pumping and dumping securities … through false and misleading posts and material omissions on Twitter [and Discord].”
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: At least one of the defendants whose account CNN previously reviewed had tweeted about Gamestop and AMC, two so-called “meme stocks” that saw significant public interest and trading in 2021.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: On Wednesday, however, Hanen wrote that while the defendants may well have intended to separate followers from their money, the evidence did not support a finding of actual securities fraud or conspiracy to commit fraud.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: “The key question is whether one statement by one of the co-defendants that ‘we’re robbing … idiots of their money,’ which is alleged in the Indictment, is sufficient,” the judge wrote.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: “This statement sufficiently alleges ‘intent to defraud’ … but does not on its own sufficiently allege that Defendants executed, or conspired to execute, a ‘scheme to defraud’ investors of money or property” as defined by court precedent.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: Unlike a traditional fraud case, Hanen added, the DOJ merely claimed investors were deprived of relevant market information — not that the influencers directly stole money from investors.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The indictment was dismissed without prejudice, meaning charges could potentially be amended and refiled.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The DOJ case is distinct from a civil suit brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission around the same time against those same defendants and that accused them of violating US securities law.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The SEC’s case is currently on hold, after the Justice Department asked the court in January 2023 to stay that lawsuit while its own criminal case against the defendants unfolded.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The Justice Department didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The SEC declined to comment.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: Correction: An earlier version of this story misidentified the plaintiff in the case.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: It is the Justice Department.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text: The photo has also been replaced.
Article Title: Judge tosses DOJ suit against social media influencers in alleged pump-and-dump scheme

text:
New York CNN —

“Buy your mom an iPhone.”
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: That was Apple CEO Tim Cook’s famous response at Vox’s 2022 Code Conference, when a reporter complained that her mother couldn’t see the videos she texted to her mom’s Android phone because they were grainy and slow.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: It’s also a quip that US Attorney General Merrick Garland quoted – and sharply criticized – Thursday at a press conference announcing the Justice Department’s landmark antitrust lawsuit against Apple, in which the Biden administration and 16 states allege Apple is illegally abusing the iPhone’s monopoly power in the smartphone market.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: The massive lawsuit against one of the world’s largest companies claims Apple is breaking the law by carefully curating its app store and customer experience, designed to lure customers in and keep them buying Apple products and services – to the exclusion of competitors.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Apple, in a statement, said it disagreed with the lawsuit and would fight it vigorously.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “This lawsuit threatens who we are and the principles that set Apple products apart in fiercely competitive markets,” the company said.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: If successful, the suit could force Apple to loosen some of the restrictions it has placed on its “walled garden” approach to hardware and software.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: It could be made to open up its iPhone to alternative app stores and its technologies like iMessage with Android phones.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: The Justice Department, in its complaint, highlighted five ways it says Apple is abusing its dominant position to the detriment of Americans.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text:
Green bubbles

With iMessage, Apple created an enhanced text messaging service that allows people to seamlessly communicate with one another, sending rich text, high-quality video and audio that uploads almost instantly – as long as it’s sent to another iPhone customer.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: When those messages get sent to people with Android phones, they appear grainy, they can be slow to load , and they can miss out on key features like emoji responses, editing functionality and end-to-end encryption.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: The dreaded “green bubbles” that mark Android users within iMessage – and particularly the lower-quality performance – are illegal, the Justice Department alleges.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “As any iPhone user who has ever seen a green text message, or received a tiny, grainy video can attest — Apple’s anticompetitive conduct also includes making it more difficult for iPhone users to message with users of non-Apple products,” Garland said on Thursday.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “As a result, iPhone users perceive rival smartphones as being lower quality because the experience of messaging friends and family who do not own iPhones is worse — even though Apple is the one responsible for breaking cross-platform messaging.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: And it does so intentionally.”
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Apple last year said it would adopt a new standard of technology for communication with Android phones that will open up some, but not all, of those features.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: The green bubbles will remain.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text:
Apple Pay exclusivity

Apple helped revolutionize the way we pay for things, tying customers’ credit cards to technology inside iPhones to make payments more secure and seamless.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: And Apple takes a tiny payment for each transaction.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: But Apple Pay is the only way iPhone owners can pay for stuff using that technology on an iPhone.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Apple, citing security reasons, doesn’t allow third-party apps to access the chip that allows for iPhones to make mobile payments.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: It also could entice some customers to stick with iPhones when they’d otherwise switch to a competitor, the lawsuit alleges.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “Apple also deprives users of the benefits and innovations third-party wallets would provide,” the Justice Department said in its complaint.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “Cross-platform digital wallets would offer an easier, more seamless, and potentially more secure way for users to switch from the iPhone to another smartphone.”
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text:
Making rivals less useful than Apple Watch

Apple Watch, one of Apple’s most successful products, is not compatible with Android phones – on purpose, the Justice Department alleges.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Although some smartwatches work seamlessly with any kind of smartphone, Apple Watches, a market leader, require iPhones to operate.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: That locks customers into Apple’s ecosystem of hardware and software, forcing Apple Watch customers to buy iPhones.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “Apple uses smartwatches, a costly accessory, to prevent iPhone customers from choosing other phones,” the Justice Department said in its complaint.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “Having copied the idea of a smartwatch from third-party developers, Apple now prevents those developers from innovating and limits the Apple Watch to the iPhone to prevent a negative ‘impact to iPhone sales.’”
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text:
Banning third-party app stores

The only way to get apps on an iPhone is through Apple’s proprietary app store.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Apple has long claimed that its approach to maintaining what apps can and cannot be used on an iPhone helps customers.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: It prevents spam and harmful apps, Apple says.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: It forces apps into Apple’s onerous limitations and expensive 30% commissions, the Justice Department argues.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: And it limits competition.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: For example, the Justice Department cites cloud-based gaming app stores as a service that Apple illegally prevents from appearing on an iPhone.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Companies that want to stream games to customers have to load each individual game to the app store, which prevents companies from marketing and selling potentially powerful and popular competitive technology to customers.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text:
Restricting super apps

Apple forces app developers to write code specifically for its operating system, restricting developers from coding using universal languages that could offer a single app experience across any device.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: That prevents apps from becoming “super apps” – apps that run identically on Apple’s iOS
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: iPhone operating system and Google’s Android OS.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: Apple also restricts “mini programs” – apps within apps that effectively run on the web.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: The Justice Department says that requirement locks developers into Apple’s system.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “Since at least 2017, Apple has arbitrarily imposed exclusionary requirements that unnecessarily and unjustifiably restrict mini programs and super apps,” the Justice Department said in its complaint.
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text: “Apple exerted its control over app distribution to stifle others’ innovation.”
Article Title: Why America says Apple is a monopoly

text:
Washington CNN —

The US Justice Department and more than a dozen states filed a blockbuster antitrust lawsuit against Apple on Thursday, accusing the giant company of illegally monopolizing the smartphone market.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: It’s the largest in a recent string of Big Tech companies to face antitrust complaints from the US government, which is cracking down on the massive industry, whose power has gone largely unchecked over the past several decades.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The complaint, said Attorney General Merrick Garland at a news conference, alleges that ”Apple has maintained monopoly power in the smartphone market not simply by staying ahead of the competition on the merits but by violating federal antitrust law.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “Consumers should not have to pay higher prices because companies break the law,” he added.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The long-anticipated lawsuit, which was filed in the US District Court for the District of New Jersey, comes after years of allegations by critics that Apple has harmed competition with restrictive app store terms, high fees and its “walled-garden” approach to its hardware and software:
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Apple famously makes its tech easy to use, but it achieves that by tightly controlling – and in some cases, restricting – how third-party companies can interact with the tech behemoth’s products and services.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: In some cases, Apple may give its own products better access and features than its competitors.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The company said it denied the lawsuit’s allegations and would fight them and added that the lawsuit could empower government “to take a heavy hand in designing people’s technology.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: But Garland on Thursday said Apple’s actions have wide-ranging effects.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “Monopolies like Apple’s threaten the free and fair markets upon which our economy is based.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: They stifle innovation.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: They hurt producers and workers and increase cost for consumers,” Garland said Thursday.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “If left unchallenged, Apple will only continue to strengthen its smartphone monopoly.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: But there’s a law for that,” he added.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: For example, Apple allows iPhone customers to send high-quality photos and videos seamlessly to one another, but multimedia texts to Android phones are slower and grainy.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The company late last year relented and agreed to improve the quality standard it uses to interact with Android phones via text message – but it still maintains those messages in green bubbles, creating a kind of class divide, critics argue.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The company also gives its own products the ability to access certain parts of its hardware that it restricts other companies from using.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: That unleashes an almost magical experience for how iPhones interact with AirTags, when competitors’ products are far more limited in their capabilities.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “Apple creates barriers that make it extremely difficult and expensive for both users and developers to venture outside the Apple ecosystem,” Garland said on Thursday.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text:
‘We will vigorously defend against it’

This year, European regulations forced Apple to give other companies access to the iPhone’s tap-to-pay hardware chip, enabling the creation of competing digital wallets.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: But those rules are limited to the European Union.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: And Apple maintains a 30% commission on most sales through its app store – a frequent complaint from companies that try to sell subscriptions, saying Apple’s enormous share of the smartphone market forces them to pay what they argue is an unnecessarily high commission.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “We believe this lawsuit is wrong on the facts and the law, and we will vigorously defend against it,” Apple said in a statement.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Thursday’s suit claims Apple has illegally monopolized smartphone markets by using a complex web of contractual terms that harm everything from text messaging to mobile payments.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Among other things, the DOJ says, Apple has used its control over iOS, the iPhone operating system, to block innovative new apps and cloud streaming services from the public; degrade how Android messages appear on iPhones; restricted how competing smartwatches can work with iPhones; and hindered rival payment solutions.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Apple, in a statement, said the lawsuit would set a “dangerous precedent” and hinder its ability to make the compelling and consumer-friendly technology that have made the company one of the most valuable in the world.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “At Apple, we innovate every day to make technology people love – designing products that work seamlessly together, protect people’s privacy and security, and create a magical experience for our users,” the company said in its statement.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “This lawsuit threatens who we are and the principles that set Apple products apart in fiercely competitive markets.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text:
The changes the DOJ wants from Apple

Thursday’s lawsuit against Apple seeks three specific remedies that could dramatically change the company’s business model.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The Justice Department wants a court order barring Apple from using its app store to block innovative new apps.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: It also wants the court to block Apple-imposed restrictions that prevent other messaging apps, smartwatches, digital wallets and other technologies from integrating with the iPhone.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: It also called for the court to prevent Apple from using its contractual terms to “obtain, maintain, extend, or entrench” the company’s alleged monopoly.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The complaint, a copy of which was reviewed by CNN, does not explicitly call for a breakup of Apple.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: But it did not rule out the possibility, and asks for “relief as needed to cure any competitive harm.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: According to the complaint, the list of participating states or districts in the suit include New Jersey, Arizona, California, Connecticut, Maine, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, New York, North Dakota, Oklahoma, Oregon, Tennessee, Vermont, Wisconsin and the District of Columbia.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text:
Years of scrutiny

Apple has shrugged off legal challenges and criticism for years that its practices are anticompetitive.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Its sterling consumer reputation and a disciplined public relations and legal strategy mirror the precision with which Apple manufactures and oversees its products.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: But the Justice Department’s landmark suit challenges a broad range of Apple’s practices.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The case represents the Biden administration’s latest effort to hold a Big Tech giant accountable under US antitrust law.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Apple was named in a sprawling House report in 2020 finding that the iPhone maker, along with Meta, Google and Amazon, hold “monopoly power.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Until Thursday, Apple was the only one of those tech companies the federal government had not yet sued for alleged antitrust violations.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The legal action could weigh on Apple’s stock price, which currently values the company at just under $3 trillion, and could force changes to policies, business strategies, products and applications by the tech giant.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Even divestment of some assets is not out of the question for Apple, the tech company founded by Steve Jobs in the 1970s.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Apple’s (AAPL) stock fell 3% Thursday.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The lawsuit was widely anticipated.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Along with a pair of ongoing antitrust cases against Google, the DOJ lawsuit against Apple is likely to become a symbol of the Biden administration’s commitment to competition and lowering prices.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: It will also be a test of how far courts are willing to go to apply decades-old antitrust law to the modern digital economy.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The Apple case may be one of the most closely watched lawsuits brought by Jonathan Kanter, Biden’s top DOJ antitrust official.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Kanter, who in private practice once represented rivals to Google including Microsoft and Yelp, is viewed as part of a fresh generation of regulators.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Along with his counterpart at the Federal Trade Commission, Lina Khan, Kanter has argued that the United States has for decades allowed a wave of corporate consolidation and anticompetitive practices that ultimately harmed the public through higher prices, fewer choices or reduced innovation.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text:
Apps vs Apple

To solve Android phone customers’ “green bubble” issue, Eric Migicovsky, a tech entrepreneur, says an app he created, dubbed Beeper Mini, to help Android users message iPhone users without those limitations was quickly shut down by Apple.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “It lasted for a total of three days before Apple started to take swings at us,” Migicovsky said.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “Technologically, they worked very hard to take actions to penalize Beeper Mini users by knocking the connection offline or by making it progressively more unreliable.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Those kind of interactions have made Apple’s app store a focus of antitrust complaints.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Beginning in 2020, Apple fought a highly public court battle against Epic Games, maker of the video game “Fortnite.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Apple isn’t an illegal monopolist in distributing iOS apps, federal courts have decided in that case, highlighting the difficulty of pinning Apple down on federal antitrust charges.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Apple did, however, get penalized for violating a California competition law and altered some of its app store practices in response to a court order.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Those rulings highlight the challenges ahead for the Justice Department, which will need to bring a strong legal theory about how Apple has allegedly harmed competition, legal experts say.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The DOJ would also need to prove that the benefits Apple has delivered to consumers don’t outweigh its alleged antitrust violations.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text:
Europe’s bite at Apple

The US government isn’t the only one to pressure Apple to change its business practices.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: In March, a new European Union law took effect that forces Apple to make significant adjustments.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: In a seismic move to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA), Apple said for the first time it would allow users in the trading bloc to download apps from third-party app stores.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: But critics including Epic are already accusing Apple of violating the EU law.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Just before the DMA took effect, Epic complained to competition authorities that Apple blocked it from launching its own app store on iOS.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: The European Commission is investigating.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text:
Upstart turned behemoth

Since its early days, Apple has pursued a reputation as an elite, high-design brand.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: It’s often focused on a premium user experience and design aesthetic, setting its products apart from rivals such as Microsoft and Google.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: That limited approach worked for years, until a wave of complaints by app developers and consumers drew more attention to the potential downsides of Apple’s restrictiveness.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: In the era led by founder Steve Jobs, “Apple was a cultural phenomenon that pitted wingtips against sandals; suits against t-shirts,” said James Bailey, a professor of leadership development at the George Washington University School of Business.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “Apple relentlessly innovated.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: They were always steps ahead of the competition.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: Now, however, Apple’s advances are more “incremental” than earth-shattering, Bailey added.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “[CEO Tim] Cook has been focused on financial management and expanding market share.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: “Apple’s financially healthy,” Bailey said, but their reputation for innovation is “dimming.”
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit

text: This story has been updated with additional context and developments.
Article Title: Apple sued in a landmark iPhone monopoly lawsuit
