text: Courtesy Address Hotel + Resorts
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: The sky at night: The pool is 293.906 meters high, which is about nine-tenths the height of the Eiffel Tower.
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: Courtesy Address Hotel + Resorts Long as well as tall: At 94.84 meters in length and 16.5 meters in width, it's nearly twice as long as an Olympic-sized pool.
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: Courtesy Address Hotel + Resorts
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: This rooftop pool is nearly 1,000 feet above the ground Prev
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text:
Next

The Link’s 100-meter (328 feet) elevation and floor-to-ceiling windows provide 360-degree views across the city to the desert beyond, from which the building gets its name (“Za’abeel means the white sands of the region,” explains Badr).
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: The cantilever isn’t just important for the building’s social space, but also its design: the two towers were built leaning slightly out, so the weight of The Link would pull them both in, strengthening the overall structure, says Jabri.
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: Weighing nearly 10,000 tons, it was constructed in eight parts and lifted into place with cranes over three days, which required the road below to be closed on several occasions.
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text: The $1 billion project was originally expected to open in late 2021, but was delayed by Covid.
Article Title: The Link, Dubai: The UAE’s longest suspended infinity pool just opened on the world’s longest cantilever building

text:
CNN —

There’s one small corner of the world that Michael Jordan cherishes more than any other — his own personal haven of sporting bliss.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: But it’s not in Chicago.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: In fact, there isn’t a basketball court or hoop in sight.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Even as he was staking his claim in the 1990s as the greatest player the NBA has ever seen, the Bulls icon was a regular guest on the golf course.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: These days, though, he hosts.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The Grove XXIII – a nod to his signature No. 23 jersey — is Jordan’s very own golf paradise, a private club tucked away on the outskirts of Hobe Sound, Florida.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Ultra-exclusive, few have seen it, and even fewer have played it.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The main clubhouse entrance to The Grove XXIII.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Design by Nichols Architects / Photo by Mike Butler

For Bobby Weed, it was at once the most straightforward and most difficult brief he had ever received: “Build me the best golf course.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Build me the best driving range.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: And there had been plenty of briefs before.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: A protégé, then close friend, of legendary course designer Pete Dye, the South Carolinian served as the PGA Tour’s chief architect before launching his own course design company in 1994.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Almost three decades on, Bobby Weed Golf Design has sculpted more than 20 courses from the ground up – from Stillwater, Minnesota, to Mito, Japan — and renovated many more, including Hobe Sound’s Medalist Golf Club in 2015.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: With Tiger Woods headlining a member’s list that reads like a who’s who of the game’s elite, the Medalist is a private club that attracts a star-studded cohort of visitors.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Among them was Jordan, a keen admirer of the revamp and who, in late 2017, was on the hunt for a course architect.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The Medalist is a popular site for PGA Tour players.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Cliff Hawkins / Getty Images

A meeting later, Weed’s team was signed on to construct a golf kingdom fit for “His Airness.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: As one of history’s most famous athletes, and with a net worth edging towards the $2 billion mark, according to Forbes, Jordan was a special category of client.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “I knew that it would get a lot of attention because of MJ,” Weed, 68, told CNN.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “I knew that there was some fanfare associated with it and I didn’t want to let him down.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The land was secured soon after, some 200-plus acres of former citrus grove, next to Atlantic Ridge State Park.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: As he often does for projects, Weed lived on site, making the 265-mile switch across the state from Ponte Vedra Beach.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Weed was all-in, and encouraged Jordan to be as engaged as he wanted to be in developments, inviting him to come out once weekly to track the progress.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jordan often visited multiple times a week.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jordan, pictured in March 2023, has a well-documented love of golf.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Jacob Kupferman/Getty Images

Weed likens his role as course architect to that of a quarterback: calling plays for a large roster of consultants.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Watching Jordan in discussion with the team during one early meeting, he got the impression of a coach interacting with his players.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “I think one of his qualities is he was such a good listener, and he absorbed everything that you were discussing,” Weed said.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “He didn’t come out and say ‘do this or do that.’
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: He came out and observed and was a great listener, and he let me do my job.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Weed evaluates his plan for the course.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Bobby Weed Golf Design

“Slaughterhouse 23”

Weed had his two pillars for a great golf course — an engaged owner and a good piece of property, though the latter would require some polishing.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Turning a flat, “featureless” site – bordered by two long drainage canals – into a cross between the manicured, parkland style of Augusta National and the rustic layout of Pine Valley represented the greatest challenge to him and his team.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Dirt was excavated from lagoons to build the course and its features, fixing the flatness issue and leaving behind six large lakes – the same number of NBA Championships Jordan won.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: It was a coincidence, but ultimately fit the theme of a course tuned to the finest degree to its owner’s style.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jordan wanted firm and fast, a course that could both excite and challenge its members, many of whom would be among the PGA Tour’s current stars.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: A double-helix layout, with a “crossover” at the 5th and 14th holes, offers the flexibility to play continual internal circuits in three, six, or nine-hole loops – ideal for Jordan’s busy schedule.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Two irrigation canals border the site.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Bobby Weed Golf Design
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The course didn’t just need to suit the playstyle of its owner, though, it needed to enhance it.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “You don’t think I’m going to spend this much money and not have a little bit of an advantage do you?”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Weed recalled Jordan saying.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Add to that the five-time MVP’s penchant for wagers, which will be familiar to viewers of docuseries “The Last Dance,” and the course has earned a new name among some members: “Slaughterhouse 23.”

“It’s his golf course, so it’s set up very well for him,” former world No. 1
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Rickie Fowler told the Subpar podcast in 2020.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Weed, too, got drawn into the wagers, even during construction.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “I can remember us being out there hitting shots and doing a little gambling while we were just playing in the dirt.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: It was just great fun and interaction,” he said.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “It’s hard not to go out there and play a round with MJ without having a friendly wager.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jordan and Weed during the course's construction.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Bobby Weed Golf Design

To meet the second requirement of Jordan’s brief, Weed’s team set aside 20 acres to construct a state-of-the-art practice facility that the designer believes has no equal.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Two 400-yard, double-sided driving lanes can be maintained for specific conditions, such as US Open or PGA Tour style fairways, with “target greens” in 25-yard increments.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Each green has built-in pods that can track swathes of shot information, incorporating the PGA Tour’s ShotLink data.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The putting green is split into four quadrants, with incremental slopes ranging from 0-1% to 3-4% inclines.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Even the grass on the tees is customizable, with different types to mimic warm or cool seasons.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “It’s a Tour player’s haven to work on their game,” said Weed.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jordan wanted an elite practice facility.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Bobby Weed Golf Design

Taking a swing

Compared to Bobby Weed Golf Design, Nichols Architects had considerably less experience in golf courses, but it did have one key advantage in its efforts to beat other bids to build The Grove XXIII’s clubhouse.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Specializing in hospitality, residential, and commercial design, the firm had worked on the W South Beach in Miami — the favorite hotel of Jordan’s wife Yvette Prieto.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The team pulled no punches with its pitch to Jordan.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “You’re not going to confuse this clubhouse with a clubhouse down the road or anything like that, and that’s what we’re selling you,” planning and design partner Igor Reyes told CNN of the pitching process, likening it to that depicted in the “Air” movie, where Nike must lure a rookie Jordan away from a deal with Adidas.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “You’ve really got to make an architectural iconic shape, and a shape that you could almost immediately feel was swinging across the landscape.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Hopefully you can almost read the concept without anybody having to tell you,” Reyes said.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: The deal clincher — outlined to Jordan in a pitch video — was that clubhouse shape, inspired by the smooth, “almost machine-like” perfection of a golf swing.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: An early concept of the swing-inspired clubhouse shape.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Nichols Architects

Reyes said his team had heard of Jordan’s purported early struggles with his swing, and, in the video, set up a column grid to map the building’s structure onto Tiger Woods’ club trajectory.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jordan was captivated, and told the firm there and then that it would get the contract.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “The first time you walk into the room with him, you don’t want to get too close or anything like that, it was kind of an odd thing,” Reyes said.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “But by the second or third meeting we were just talking to him like a ‘regular’ client with a huge amount of respect.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “There was a really a sense of, ‘This isn’t just a guy with a lot of money that wants to do something.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: This guy knows what he’s doing, he knows what he likes, and how to get to it.’
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
”

Nichols Architects was determined to create an iconic design.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
Design by Nichols Architects / Photo by Mike Butler

The elephant in the roof

Inside, 15,000 square feet of space leaves ample room for men’s and women’s lockers, indoor and outdoor lounge areas, kitchen and dining facilities, and even a shop.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Hospitality was a priority, with a below-ground level meaning all service, as well as golf cart storage, can be managed from underneath.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Like the course, Jordan’s identity was stamped all over.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Columns were set further inside below an overhanging roof to mimic the hang-time that inspired the “Air Jordan” tag, while an elephant print used on some of his shoes was incorporated into the fritted-glass roof, casting the print across the floor when the sun shines through.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Customization goes all the way down to Air Jordan logos on the ice cubes, as PGA Tour pro Jimmy Walker shared to Instagram after a round at the course in March 2021.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Jimmy Walker shared an image of Jordan's personalized ice cubes.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “He was involved with a lot of the decisions … we didn’t change a color without him knowing,” Reyes said.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “We have had work with other celebrity people and they won’t talk to you, it’s ‘I just want this’ and sort of like, ‘get out of the way.’
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: But he realized there was a lot of creativity going on and he wanted to be a part of it.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text:
“No other place I’d rather be”

Given Jordan’s regular on-site visits, there was no big reveal for the owner when the Grove XXIII officially opened in the fall of 2019, but there was a revelation when Weed joined him for his very first round.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: When play finished, the architect found himself wrapped in a 6-foot, 6-inch bear hug.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “He looked at me and said, ‘I’m fortunate enough I can be anywhere in the world, but there’s no other place I’d rather be than right here,’”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Weed recalled.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “That’s like the ultimate compliment … to have his own golf course and to shape and mold that golf course for him and his friends, it’s just where he wants to be.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: It’s just a great spot and evolved into something fantastic.
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: “He’s going to enjoy it as long as he’s playing and then it’s going to get passed along to the next generation — it’s just one of the great things about golf and why it has sustained itself over centuries.”
Article Title: Michael Jordan’s ultra-private, ultra-exclusive personal golf course: The Grove XXIII

text: Editor’s Note: Call to Earth is a CNN editorial series committed to reporting on the environmental challenges facing our planet, together with the solutions.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Rolex’s Perpetual Planet initiative has partnered with CNN to drive awareness and education around key sustainability issues and to inspire positive action.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text:
CNN —

Mesmerizing photos of ants firing acid, a shrimp floating over a rainbow-colored mosaic sea star, and a butterfly peering in at a wedding party are among the winning images of the Close-up Photographer of the Year 2023 competition.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: The contest, in its fifth year, celebrates micro and macro photography, striving to show the hidden wonders of the natural world, from microscopic fungi to majestic animals.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Micro is the term used for taking photos of tiny subjects that require magnification, while macro involves capturing close-up images of larger subjects.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Tracy Calder, co-founder of the competition and jury member, told CNN how the photos reveal unusual interactions between animals and plants, demonstrating how everything in the natural world is interconnected and interdependent.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: It “celebrates animals and behavior that people have never seen or encountered before,” she said.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: This year’s grand prize went to Hungarian photographer Csaba Daróczi, for his black and white image of a Eurasian nuthatch soaring through a forest.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Taken with a GoPro from inside a hollowed-out tree stump, the striking image offers a new perspective of the bird against the backdrop of outstretched trees.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: The title of young close-up photographer of the year went to 17-year-old Spaniard Carlos Pérez Naval for his image of a Moorish gecko on a wall covered with pyrolusite crystals.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: “These magnesium minerals create stunning formations, which look just like petrified trees, but they are so small that they’re tricky to spot,” he said in a press release.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Seventeen-year-old Carlos Pérez Naval took this photo in Calamacha, Spain, the village where he lives.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text:
Carlos Pérez Naval/cupoty.com

“I wanted to capture a gecko in the ‘petrified forest’ for a long time, but they only recently appeared in my village – probably carried in fruit baskets from hotter areas.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Due to climate change they can now survive here,” he added.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: The jury – made up of 23 photographers, scientists and naturalists – chose the winning photos for each category from a total of 12,000 entries from 67 countries.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Many were taken in areas local to the photographers, showing the beauty of what can be seen in your own backyard, said Calder.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: She, along with her husband Daniel, founded the competition in 2018.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Both are professional photographers.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: While many other photo awards feature close-up categories, they believed there was a need for an entire competition dedicated to macro and micro photography.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: “It’s often easier for people to get behind conservation stories featuring ‘cute’ or more obvious animals and plants: rhinos, pandas, orchids.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: But the lesser-known insects and plants we often consider weeds have a huge role to play in keeping everything balanced.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Close-up photography often showcases these animals and plants,” she said.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: “There’s also a joy in showing people things they wouldn’t be able to see without a macro lens or microscope.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: Many of the creatures and plants we show are all around us but are never noticed.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text: The competition is a way for them to be noticed,” she added.
Article Title: Close-up Photographer of the Year: Images show the hidden wonders of nature

text:
CNN —

Pope Francis unexpectedly skipped delivering his homily during the Palm Sunday Mass service at the Vatican on Sunday, although was able to preside over the service and was later driven around in the popemobile.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: The service marks the beginning of Holy Week, the most sacred week in the church’s calendar as Christians around the world prepare to celebrate Easter, and his decision to skip the homily (reflection) was a surprise.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: The 87-year-old has in recent weeks had aides read out several of his speeches after suffering from a bout of ill health, which on 28 February saw him go to hospital for tests.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: Over the winter months, Francis has battled with bouts of bronchitis, cold and flu.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: Crowds gather in St. Peter's Square during the Palm Sunday mass.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text:
Gregorio Borgia/AP

While the pope has occasionally skipped homilies on Easter Sunday, it is the first time he has not given a homily on Palm Sunday.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: Francis did speak during the Mass, reading prayers and giving his blessing.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: He also prayed the Angelus at the conclusion of the liturgy, beforehand recalling the “martyred people of Ukraine” and those suffering from war.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: At the end of the liturgy, he greeted cardinals individually from his wheelchair, which he has been using for several months.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: He then got into the popemobile to greet some of the thousands of people gathered in the square.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: Following the service, he also condemned the “vile” concert hall shooting in Moscow.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: Francis told the crowd at St. Peter’s Square that he was praying for the “victims of the vile terrorist attack,” the worst that Russia has suffered in recent decades.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text:
On Saturday, the pope met with employees from Italian state broadcaster RAI where he delivered a speech and on 8 March spoke at length at a parish in Rome.

Holy Week and Easter is an intense schedule for the pope.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: He is to travel to a prison outside of Rome on Thursday to celebrate the foot washing ritual with female prisoners, and on Good Friday be present at services in St Peter’s and the Colosseum.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text: On Easter Saturday evening he’s due to preside at a long evening liturgy and on Easter Sunday offer his “Urbi et Orbi” blessing to the city of Rome and the world.
Article Title: Pope Francis skips homily at Palm Sunday Mass in rare move

text:
CNN —

What happens when others assume people with Down syndrome can’t hit hard, aim high or drink a darn margarita?
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: Well, it can become a reality.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: A new Down syndrome awareness ad cuts right to the philosophical heart of this often-misunderstood condition, reminding us that the way we treat people with Down syndrome can help smash false limits — or reinforce them.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: False limits like, say, someone of-age not being able to drink just because they have Down syndrome.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “If your assumptions become reality, then assume I can drink a margarita.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: So you serve me a margarita, so I drink a margarita,” says actress Madison Tevlin in the now-viral ad.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: The same goes for things like living alone, having sex or any other achievement, both great and small.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “Assume that I can, so maybe I will,” the spot concludes.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: ASSUME THAT I CAN | World Down Syndrome Day 2024
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: The ad, created by an Italian Down syndrome organization called Coor Down, was released in recognition of World Down Syndrome Awareness Day, March 21.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: Its tagline, #AssumeICan, is being used by people with Down Syndrome to show that many of the assumptions about their drive and abilities are just that … assumptions.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: Tevlin, the 22-year-old actress who starred in the ad, talked to CNN about tearing down stereotypes while also celebrating the differences people with Down syndrome bring to the table.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “When I was born, the doctor told my mom and dad that life would be really hard for me, saying that I can’t talk, or walk, or dance, or model, or act — or drinking or getting married — any of this stuff that’s part of normal life,” she said.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “And it’s so much fun proving people wrong.”
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: Tevlin was connected to the Coor Down campaign through the National Down Syndrome Society, and says she’s loving the reactions to the ad, which has 160,000 views on YouTube and has been burning up social media feeds.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “I’m just so happy everyone looks up to me as a role model.”
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: Other Down syndrome activists and achievers are sharing their own ways they defy stereotypes, like 17-year-old triathlete Caleb Prewitt, or members of the Hijinx Theatre, an inclusive theatre company in Wales.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: Down syndrome is a condition caused by an extra partial or full chromosome.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: According to the National Down Syndrome Society, one in 772 babies in the US is born with Down Syndrome.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: It’s not a disease or an affliction, it’s just the way some people are made.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: While Down syndrome results in slight cognitive delays, the NDSS says these issues are usually “mild to moderate” and don’t affect people’s ability to vote, contribute to their communities or make decisions about their own lives.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: As an actress and advocate, Tevlin has taken control of her own life.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: She says getting past stereotypes about Down syndrome allows the whole person to shine through.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “I always say that I have Down syndrome, and it’s the least interesting thing about me,” she said.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: “The part of who I am, well it’s not all of me.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: We should all celebrate our differences in our own special and unique ways.”
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text: CNN’s Taylor Galgano and Krista Bo contributed to this report.
Article Title: Madison Tevlin, star of the Down Syndrome awareness ad, smashes assumptions about her condition

text:
London CNN —

Catherine, Princess of Wales, revealed Friday she has been diagnosed with cancer and is in the “early stages” of treatment.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: The princess, known as Kate, described her diagnosis as a “huge shock” in a video statement released on social media.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: The news comes two months after she had temporarily stepped away from public life following what Kensington Palace said at the time was surgery for a non-cancerous abdominal condition.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: “In January, I underwent major abdominal surgery in London and at the time, it was thought that my condition was non-cancerous,” said Catherine, 42, who is married to the heir to the British throne, Prince William.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: “The surgery was successful.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: However, tests after the operation found cancer had been present.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: My medical team therefore advised that I should undergo a course of preventative chemotherapy and I am now in the early stages of that treatment.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Catherine, Princess of Wales during a Portage Session for her 'Shaping Us' campaign on early childhood, taken September 27, 2023 in Sittingbourne, England.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text:
Paul Grover/WPA Pool/Getty Images

Kate continued that “William and I have been doing everything we can to process and manage this privately for the sake of our young family.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: The princess added, “As you can imagine, this has taken time.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: It has taken me time to recover from major surgery in order to start my treatment.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: But, most importantly, it has taken us time to explain everything to George, Charlotte and Louis in a way that is appropriate for them, and to reassure them that I am going to be ok.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Kate said that she had told them she is “well and getting stronger every day by focusing on the things that will help me heal; in my mind, body and spirits.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: She praised Prince William for being by her side as “a great source of comfort and reassurance” as well as the support she has received from the public.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: “We hope that you will understand that, as a family, we now need some time, space and privacy while I complete my treatment.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: My work has always brought me a deep sense of joy and I look forward to being back when I am able, but for now I must focus on making a full recovery,” the princess said.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: She ended her heartfelt message by saying that she was also keeping “all those whose lives have been affected by cancer” in her thoughts.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: “For everyone facing this disease, in whatever form, please do not lose faith or hope.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: You are not alone,” Kate concluded in the video statement, which was filmed by BBC Studios at Windsor on Wednesday.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: CNN understands the Prince and Princess of Wales wanted to wait for their young children to be out of school for the Easter holidays before making the announcement.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Prince William has been balancing supporting his wife and children while continuing his public-facing duties and will continue to do so, a royal source told CNN.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: The princess started preventative chemotherapy in late February, the source said, adding that Kate had been expected to return to official duties after Easter, however she will now postpone further work until she has been cleared to do so by her medical team.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Kensington Palace is not expected to reveal any further medical details such as the type of cancer or what stage it is.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Preventative chemotherapy is often used after surgery as an “adjuvant” therapy, to weaken the chances of cancer returning, Dr. Karen Knudsen, chief executive officer of the American Cancer Society, told CNN.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Video Ad Feedback Dr. Gupta describes what stands out to him about Princess of Wales' cancer diagnosis
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: 02:57 - Source: CNN
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: The news is a devastating blow for the British monarchy and comes as King Charles III is currently undergoing treatment for an unspecified cancer, which was announced by Buckingham Palace in early February.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: King Charles said he was “so proud” of Catherine, his daughter-in-law, for “her courage in speaking as she did” in sharing her cancer diagnosis, a Buckingham Palace spokesperson said late Friday.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Charles said he “remained in the closest contact” with Kate since they received treatment at the same London hospital, and that he and Queen Camilla will “continue to offer their love and support to the whole family through this difficult time.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: GET OUR FREE ROYAL NEWSLETTER • Sign up to CNN’s Royal News, a weekly dispatch bringing you the inside track on the royal family, what they are up to in public and what’s happening behind palace walls.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Kate was admitted to The London Clinic, a private hospital in the city, on January 16 and successfully underwent a planned abdominal surgery, Kensington Palace said at the time.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: She remained in the hospital for 13 days following the procedure and, on doctor’s advice, had since been away from public duties during her recovery.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Kate was spotted in public for the first time since her surgery, visiting a farm shop with her husband Prince William last weekend, amid intense speculation about her health and whereabouts.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Since the announcement on Friday, well wishes have poured in for the princess.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text:
Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex said in a joint statement that they “wish health and healing for Kate and the family, and hope they are able to do so privately and in peace.”

British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said in a statement that the princess had “the love and support of the whole country,” adding that Kate had shown “tremendous bravery” and that she had been “unfairly treated” during weeks of “intense scrutiny” by the press and on social media.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text:
He added that his thoughts were with her and “in particular her three children.”

British opposition Labour party leader Keir Starmer also sent his “best wishes” to the princess, saying that the “lurid speculation” of recent weeks must have “added” to her stress.
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text: Meanwhile, the White House said the update from the princess was “terrible” and that the administration was “incredibly sad to hear of the news.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text:
White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said the administration’s thoughts were with the royal and her family “during this incredibly difficult time, and certainly we wish her a full recovery.”

Jean-Pierre stressed it was “important that we respect their privacy, especially at this time, so I’m not going to go further than that.”
Article Title: Catherine, Princess of Wales, announces she has cancer

text:
CNN —

In a trailblazing study, researchers have discovered bottled water sold in stores can contain 10 to 100 times more bits of plastic than previously estimated — nanoparticles so infinitesimally tiny they cannot be seen under a microscope.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: At 1,000th the average width of a human hair, nanoplastics are so teeny they can migrate through the tissues of the digestive tract or lungs into the bloodstream, distributing potentially harmful synthetic chemicals throughout the body and into cells, experts say.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: One liter of water — the equivalent of two standard-size bottled waters — contained an average of 240,000 plastic particles from seven types of plastics, of which 90% were identified as nanoplastics and the rest were microplastics, according to the study.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Microplastics are polymer fragments that can range from less than 0.2 inch (5 millimeters) down to 1/25,000th of an inch (1 micrometer).
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Anything smaller is a nanoplastic that must be measured in billionths of a meter.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “This study, I have to say, is exceedingly impressive.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: The body of work that they put into this was really quite profound.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: … I would call it groundbreaking,” said Sherri “Sam” Mason, director of sustainability at Penn State Behrend in Erie, Pennsylvania, who was not involved in the study.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: The finding reinforces long-held expert advice to drink tap water from glass or stainless steel containers to reduce exposure, Mason said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: That advice extends to other foods and drinks packaged in plastic as well, she added.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “People don’t think of plastics as shedding but they do,” she said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “In almost the same way we’re constantly shedding skin cells, plastics are constantly shedding little bits that break off, such as when you open that plastic container for your store-bought salad or a cheese that’s wrapped in plastic.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: How many nanoplastics are there?
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Mason was the coauthor of a 2018 study that first detected the existence of micro- and nanoplastics in 93% of samples of bottled water sold by 11 different brands in nine countries.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: In that past study, Mason found each tainted liter of water held an average of 10 plastic particles wider than a human hair, along with 300 smaller particles.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Five years ago, however, there was no way to analyze those tiny flecks or discover if there were more.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “It’s not that we didn’t know nanoplastics existed.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: We just couldn’t analyze them,” Mason explained.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: In the recent study, published in January 2024 in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, researchers from Columbia University presented a new technology that can see, count and analyze the chemical structure of nanoparticles in bottled water.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Instead of 300 per liter, the team behind the latest study found the actual number of plastic bits in three popular brands of water sold in the United States to be in between 110,000 and 370,000, if not higher.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: (The authors declined to mention which brands of bottled water they studied.)
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: However, the new technology was actually able to see millions of nanoparticles in the water, which could be “inorganic nanoparticles, organic particles and some other plastic particles not among the seven major plastic types we studied,” said coauthor and environmental chemist Beizhan Yan, an associate research professor at Columbia University’s Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: The innovative new techniques presented in the study open the door for further research to better understand the potential risks to human health, said Jane Houlihan, research director for Healthy Babies, Bright Futures, an alliance of nonprofits, scientists and donors committed to reducing babies’ exposures to neurotoxic chemicals, who was not involved in the study.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “They suggest widespread human exposures to minuscule plastic particles posing largely unstudied risks,” Houlihan said in an email.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “Infants and young children may face the greatest risks, as their developing brains and bodies are often more vulnerable to impacts from toxic exposures.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text:
Dangers to human health

Nanoplastics are the most worrisome type of plastic pollution for human health, experts say.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: That’s because the minuscule particles can invade individual cells and tissues in major organs, potentially interrupting cellular processes and depositing endocrine-disrupting chemicals such as bisphenols, phthalates, flame retardants, per- and polyfluorinated substances, or PFAS, and heavy metals.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “All of those chemicals are used in the manufacturing of plastic, so if a plastic makes its way into us, it’s carrying those chemicals with it.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: And because the temperature of the body is higher than the outside, those chemicals are going to migrate out of that plastic and end up in our body,” Mason said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “The chemicals can be carried to your liver and your kidney and your brain and even make their way across the placental boundary and end up in an unborn child,” Mason said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: In studies of pregnant mice, researchers have found plastic chemicals in the brain, heart, liver, kidney and lungs of the developing baby 24 hours after the pregnant mother ingested or breathed in plastic particles, said study coauthor Phoebe Stapleton, associate professor of pharmacology and toxicology at Rutgers University’s Ernest Mario School of Pharmacy in Piscataway, New Jersey.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “Micro and nanoplastics have been found in the human placenta at this point, Stapleton said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “They’ve been found in human lung tissues.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: They’ve been found in human feces; they’ve been found in human blood.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: In addition to the chemicals and toxic metals plastics may carry, another relatively unstudied area is whether the plastic polymer itself is also harming the body.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “The new frontier in plastics is understanding the polymers — the plastic part of plastic,” Mason said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “We’ve been very limited in our ability to understand the potential impact of the polymers on human health because we have not been able to detect down to that level.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Now, with this new approach, we will be able to start doing so.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: CNN reached out to the International Bottled Water Association, which represents the industry, for a response to the study’s findings.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “This new method needs to be fully reviewed by the scientific community and more research needs to be done to develop standardized methods for measuring and quantifying nanoplastics in our environment,” a spokesperson for the association told CNN via email.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “There currently is both a lack of standardized methods and no scientific consensus on the potential health impacts of nano- and microplastic particles.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Therefore, media reports about these particles in drinking water do nothing more than unnecessarily scare consumers.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Which plastics are you swallowing?
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: The study’s new method of identifying nanoparticles in bottled water relies on a modified version of Raman spectroscopy, a laser-based technique that can analyze the chemical composition of cells by measuring how molecules vibrate in response to light.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: The altered version, called stimulated Raman scattering microscopy, or SRS, adds a second laser to “amplify the previous signal by several orders of magnitude, allowing the previously unseen nanoparticle to be detected,” said senior author Wei Min, a professor of chemistry at Columbia University in New York City, who coinvented SRS in 2008.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “This study is the first one to apply this microscopy to the nanoplastic world,” Min said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: By dramatically boosting the image, SRS can clearly identify and capture images of nanoparticles in microseconds rather than the hours needed by the older technique — and do so without harming the tissues being imaged.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “But seeing the particles is not good enough because how do you know this is plastic or not?
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: To do that we developed a new machine-based learning technology that allows us to identify and classify which plastic it is,” Yan said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: At the time of publication, the study’s algorithm was able to identify seven types of plastics: polyamide, polypropylene, polyethylene, polymethyl methacrylate, polyvinyl chloride, polystyrene, and polyethylene terephthalate.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “Based on other studies we expected most of the microplastics in bottled water would come from leakage of the plastic bottle itself, which is typically made of PET (polyethylene terephthalate) plastic,” said lead author Naixin Qian, a doctoral student in chemistry at Columbia University.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “However, we found there’s actually many diverse types of plastics in a bottle of water, and that different plastic types have different size distributions,” she said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text:
“The PET particles were larger, while others were down to 200 nanometers, which is much, much smaller.”

Studies have found that particles of PET plastics can be broken off by repeatedly opening and closing the cap of the bottle, crushing the bottle or subjecting it to heat, such as in a car.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text:
Much more research to be done

Now that nanoplastics can be identified and classified
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: , it’s possible to research the answer to all sorts of questions.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: For example, if the nanoplastics floating in the bottled water weren’t from the bottle itself, where did they come from?
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: The Columbia team is investigating a hypothesis that the other nanoplastics may come from source water, perhaps tainted by some part of the manufacturing process.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text:
Another important question: Which has fewer nanoplastics and chemical residues, bottled or tap water?

“Several studies have reported lower microplastic levels in tap water.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Hence, it’s plausible to expect lower nanoplastic levels in tap water as well, considering their common sources,” Yan said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “We’re conducting research on that right now.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: What happens once the plastic polymer and the endocrine-disrupting chemicals enter the body’s cells?
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: Do the invaders remain, wreaking havoc by disrupting or damaging cellular processes, or does the body succeed in kicking them out?
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “We know these microparticles are getting into the body, and we know even greater percentages of the smaller nanoparticles are getting into cells, but we don’t know exactly where they’re going in the cell or what they are doing,” Stapleton said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “And we don’t know if or how they’re getting back out again.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: However, the new technology is well-suited to analyzing human tissue samples and should soon provide some answers, Min said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “If you look at our raw data, it’s actually a series of images,” Min said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “In fact, we have plenty of data to show if a particle has entered a particular location in a certain type of cell, then we will be able to locate it precisely in space.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: While science explores these and other questions, there are things people can do to reduce their exposure to plastics, said Healthy Babies, Bright Futures’ Houlihan.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “We can avoid consuming foods and beverages in plastic containers.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: We can wear clothing made from natural fabrics and buy consumer products made from natural materials,” Houlihan said.
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text: “We can simply take stock of the plastic in our daily lives and find alternatives whenever feasible.”
Article Title: Bottled water packed with nanoplastics, study finds

text:
CNN —

A United Nations Security Council resolution proposed by the United States calling for a ceasefire tied to the release of hostages in Gaza failed to pass on Friday, after Russia and China vetoed the draft.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The rejected draft resolution called for “an immediate and sustained ceasefire… in connection with the release of all remaining hostages.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: Washington had previously vetoed three prior UN resolutions calling for a ceasefire.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The UN vote came amid resumed hostage talks in Qatar on Friday, and as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Israel to meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as part of an intensive diplomatic push toward a ceasefire.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The US, Israel’s most prominent defender on the world stage, has faced severe criticism in Arab countries and in Europe for its refusal to call for a ceasefire early in the Gaza war as well as its reluctance to translate its verbal criticism of Israel’s conduct to diplomatic action.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: Eleven security council members voted for the resolution but permanent members Russia and China, who have veto power, blocked it.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: Israel Ambassador to the UN Gilad Erdan said the Security Council’s decision “not to condemn Hamas is a stain that will never be forgotten.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: Meanwhile, Algeria – which also rejected the resolution – said the submitted text “was not a clear message of peace, and would have allowed for more Palestinian civilians to be killed.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The US had previously rejected a ceasefire resolution put forth by Algeria.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: With the draft resolution, Washington was seeking to recover from international criticism of its support for Israel, experts say.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The resolution included phrasing that the US was unwilling to use before, said Frank Lowenstein, who worked as US Special Envoy for Israeli-Palestinian Negotiations under US President Barack Obama during the 2014 Israel-Gaza war.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: This referred to an “immediate ceasefire,” which the former diplomat said was likely a bid to bring the US back from months of international “isolation.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: “It gets the US back in line with the international community so we’re not as isolated as we’ve been in vetoing,” he said.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: Lowenstein said that Russia and China’s veto was “a blatant effort” to keep the US isolated.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: “They (Russia and China) are playing politics with the ceasefire, clearly putting their desire to isolate the US internationally ahead of the interests of the Palestinians in Gaza who desperately need a ceasefire,” he said.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The US struck down a draft resolution on October 18 that called for “humanitarian pauses,” which US Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield vetoed as it “did not mention Israel’s right of self-defense.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The US vetoed a second UN resolution on December 8, rejecting a version put forth by the United Arab Emirates that called for “an immediate humanitarian ceasefire,” as well as “the immediate and unconditional release of all hostages” and “ensuring humanitarian access.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text:
More recently, US vetoed an Algerian resolution on February 20 that called for an immediate ceasefire, which Thomas-Greenfield said “would put sensitive negotiations in jeopardy.”

Washington’s attitude toward Israel’s war policies gradually changed, however, amid mounting death tolls in Gaza and growing opposition to what American and international observers perceived as the Biden administration’s inability to reign in its Israeli ally.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: US President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu this month traded barbs in interviews over Israel’s war, and especially about Israel’s planned incursion into Rafah.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: The US even sanctioned Israeli settlers in the West Bank, and Biden publicly praised a speech by Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer that called for new Israeli elections that would replace Netanyahu.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: “I think there has been a gap from day one, a gap between the language and the actions,” said Yossi Mekelberg, an associate fellow with the Middle East and North Africa program at the Chatham House think tank in London.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: “But I think gradually, the language and the action are coming closer, closing the gap, millimeter by millimeter.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: If the US resolution had passed, it would have been “the end of giving Israel the carte blanche to do whatever they like,” he said, speaking to CNN before Friday’s vote.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: “The (strain in) relations between the two countries is unprecedented.”
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: Lowenstein said the resolution is “a strong signal” to Israel there are consequences to defying the US on its requests for humanitarian aid and against a Rafah incursion.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text: It also meant to get all parties to agree on a ceasefire-hostage deal, particularly Hamas, he told CNN.
Article Title: After vetoing three prior UN resolutions on Gaza, US sees its own ceasefire proposal rejected

text:
CNN —

Fresh off of his Oscar win for best actor, it looks like Cillian Murphy hasn’t forgotten where he came from.
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: Steven Knight, creator of the beloved crime drama “Peaky Blinders,” told Birmingham World Murphy is set to reprise his role as gang leader Tommy Shelby in the planned “Peaky Blinders” movie.
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: “He definitely is returning for it,” Knight told the publication.
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: “We’re shooting it in September just down the road in Digbeth.”
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: CNN has reached out to representatives for Murphy for comment.
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: The actor was the darling of this most recent awards season for his portrayal of physicist J. Robert Oppenheimer in the Christopher Nolan film “Oppenheimer.”
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: Fans of “Peaky Blinders” had expressed interest on social media as to whether Murphy would return to the role given his great success with “Oppenheimer.”
Article Title: Cillian Murphy returning for ‘Peaky Blinders’ movie, creator says

text: Editor’s Note: Featuring the good, the bad and the ugly, ‘Look of the Week’ is a regular series dedicated to unpacking the most talked about outfit of the last seven days.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text:
CNN —

On Tuesday, a starry guestlist poured into the regal halls of London’s National Portrait Gallery for the museum’s first fundraising Gala since its hefty three-year remodel completed in 2023.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Against the backdrop of 1700s portraiture, former British Vogue editor-in-chief Edward Enninful, artist Tracey Emin and Dame Kristen Scott Thomas (now a Miu Miu catwalk model as well as a BAFTA Award-winning actor) were snapped in their frocks and tuxedos, adhering to a dress code of “glamour.”
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: With many attendees from the upper echelons of the British creative scene choosing to champion homegrown labels — Alexa Chung wore Erdem, TV presenter Maya Jama opted for a satin, off-the-shoulder Vivienne Westwood number — one could imagine a born-and-bred Californian could feel daunted.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: But Hole singer Courtney Love certainly got the memo.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Straying from the London Fashion Week mainstays, Love instead chose to revive a name from fashion history — and arrived in the biggest (and arguably the best) gown of the evening.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: The gown was inspired by Marie Antoinette and customized for Love.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text:
Dave Benett/Getty Images

Dressed in a waterfall of gray silk duchess satin and black tulle, Love was the punk princess of St. Martin’s Place.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: And it was no wonder, considering the 18th-century inspired gown was the work of Elizabeth Emanuel, Princess Diana’s wedding dress designer.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: The custom look was a variation on Emanuel’s “Marie Antoinette” frock which Love had spotted in last month’s copy of British high-society gossip magazine, Tatler.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Originally designed in pale pink, Love’s version was fashioned out of a darker palette for more drama.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Emanuel added crystal appliques at the waist, while the corset itself was boned and fastened with black lacing.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Most captivating of all, perhaps, was the bustle skirt silhouette, hand-draped by Emanuel.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: “The effect was very grown up (yet) ‘Princess’ like,” she told CNN via email.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Love was a DJ at the National Portrait Gallery's event.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text:
Dave Benett/Getty Images

Dress designer Emanuel rose to fame when she received the commission of a lifetime in 1981.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: The gown she created for Princess Diana’s wedding to Prince Charles — a pearl-embellished, ivory taffeta dress complete with ‘80s puff sleeves and a 25-foot train — has since gone down in history as one of the most iconic moments in fashion.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: In June 2021, 40 years after it was worn down the aisle, the dress was exhibited at Diana’s former home in Kensington Palace.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Later in the evening, Love is photographed stepping behind the decks to DJ.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: An outstretched arm shows a torn tulle sleeve — snagged presumably while she was lost in the music.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: The mark of a true people’s princess.
Article Title: Courtney Love is a punk princess at London’s National Portrait Gallery

text: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote In a change in position, the US refrained from vetoing the ceasfire measure, which also calls for the release of hostages.
Article Title: BBC Live & Breaking World and U.S. News

text:
Reuters Copyright: Reuters

The Palestinian representative to the UN, Riyad Mansour, has welcomed today's resolution - but says it is overdue.
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text: "It has taken six months, over 100,000 Palestinians killed and maimed, two million displaced, and famine, for this council to finally demand an immediate ceasefire," Mansour tells the UN.
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text: He says the draft resolution was a “vote for humanity to prevail, for life to prevail".
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text: "The Palestinians in Gaza pleaded and appealed, shouted, cried, cursed, prayed, defied the odds to survive time and time again.
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text: And yet continued to face death, destruction and displacement, depravation and disease.
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text: And an occupation-made famine.
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text: “Their ordeal must come to an end, and it must come to an immediate end now."
Article Title: Israel cancels White House visit after US doesn't block UN ceasefire vote

text:
Getty Images Copyright: Getty Images

Donald Trump had been facing the prospect of forking over nearly half a billion dollars today.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing

text: But now he has been given 10 more days, and that sum has been reduced down to $175m.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing

text: Trump had struggled to come up with $464m in cash, and last week said no private companies had been willing to put up a bond of that size.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing

text: With the 10 day extension and a lower amount, his assets are safe from being seized by the state of New York - for now.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing

text: This lifeline means Attorney General Letitia James will not be trying to freeze Trump's bank accounts today, and will not be making moves to seize any of his property just yet.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing

text: Both of those outcomes were possible before this new decision from an appeals court judge.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing

text: The $464m penalty was issued by a judge earlier this year in a civil trial, which found Trump inflated his net worth to secure better deals on loans.
Article Title: Donald Trump's $464m deadline and Stormy Daniels hearing
